review_content:
Coloração palha,límpida ,espuma tênue de rápida dissipação,aroma nulo,sabor com ĺeve malte,baixo corpo,boa carbonatação,textura aguada.
Lager "neutra" ...não gostei.

Bottle purchased at Smooth Endings, St. Joseph, Missouri. Poured crystal clear golden with a white head. Aroma was grassy, green hops. Taste was bittersweet, sweet grain, grassy hops. Saw this occasionally in Omaha but haven’t for a few years purchased mostly for the new country rate.
Öl hittad i kylen i sommarstugan. Klar ljust gyllenfärgad vätska lågt skum. Väldigt clean och lättdrucken utan mycket smak. Ganska torr iaf. Typisk internationell lager.

Old Untappd checkin, April 26, 2016. Brown glass bottle. Pours light golden color, small head, clear appearance. Sweet malty aroma with a match, if light flavor profile. Clean finish makes this one a refreshing ice cold beer.

우선 예전에 병입 제품으로 마셨을때는 거품이 꽤나 넉넉했던것 같은데 캔은 상당히 야박했습니다. 1분만에 거품이 사라지고 테두리만 남네요.

한 입 가득 머금어보면 고소한 곡물향과 청량한 탄산으로 시작해서 페일라거 특유의 쌉쌀한 과일향이 느껴지는데 홉향이라면 홉향으로 그 정도가 미약하며 하이네켄과 전반적으로 비슷하지만

하이네켄이 필스너스러운 쓴맛에 가깝다면, 타이거는 뭐랄까 풀내음 가득한 여름밤의 향기랄까요. 더운 기후에서 양조하는 대부분의 동남아시아권 맥주들이 비슷한 향을 가지는데 이를 타이거에서는 '트로피컬 라거링' 기술이라 하더라구요.

피니쉬로 갈땐 곡물의 달달함이 다시 살아나는데 표현이 노골적으로 인위적이라 라벨 속 원재료를 확인해보니 아니나다를까 설탕이 들었습니다. 표기순서상 홉보다 더 많이 들었음을 알 수 있는데

애초에 이 맥주는 현지에서나 국내에서나 시끄러운 음악과 자극적이고 튀겨진 음식에 페어링하지, 고요속에서 풍미를 찬찬히 음미할 맥주가 아니지 않는가 그렇다보니 가볍고 시원하고 깔끔하면 장땡 아니냐?라는 외치는 타이거 맥주네요.

무적권 최대한 차게, 가능하면 얼음잔.. 아 온더락의 의미가 아닌 얼린 잔에 마시면 더 기분좋게 마실 수 있겠습니다.

하루를 마치고 샤워 후 호랑이 기운으로 시원하게 마시기 좋은..? 그렇지만 훌륭하다는건 아님.
Muffiger Geruch. Hell im Glas. Der Antrunk ist hopfig süßlich. Alles ziemlich unspektakulär. Dezent carbonisiert

Aroma of malt, rice, straw and slight citrus
Clear golden colour with small head
Taste is malt, slight straw, rice and mild citrus
Thin mouthfeel with low carbonation
Good
Tasted at pho c&p
Clear yellow with small white head. Light smell of citrus grass. Taste is fresh and dominated by citrus, light malt and rice.
Clear golden body and white head. Sweet malty, some corn and low hops aroma. Grainy and refreshing taste, low bitter. almost watery and medium carbonation. An average beer.

Straw colour.
Aroma of grain, malt.
Taste is sweet, bland, with a slight bitter finish.
Not great.

Bottle from an Asian shop, brewed in EU. Pale gold, small head. Grain, light lagery spicy nose. Mild bitterness, nothing special. Pretty decent body for a mild lager. It's not bad for those hot climates.

Enjoyed: Poured from bottle into mug.
Appearance: Clear golden colour, short-lived head with no remains.
Aroma: Malt, hay, gentle hops.	
Palate: Light body, gentle carbonation.	
Taste: Malt, grains, hops, gently bitter aftertaste.
Overall impression: Usual industrial lager, drinkable while cold.
Note: Brewed/bottled in Netherlands.

This is a backlog rating from many years ago from a bottle while eating sushi, from notes. When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time, work and/or family. Words to describe this beer are very average, corn, grainy, grassy,  it was probably better with the food because there wasn't enough flavor to interfere with the food.

Poured from bottle, rich golden colour, with large white head. Aroma of sweet malt and faint hops. Taste- a much fuller mouthfeel than most lagers, rounded bitterness balanced by sweet malt, finish quick and clean. One of the best mainstream lagers.
Well deserved beer after busy but good first day at the China Import and Export Fairi in Guangzhou. Beer from Singapore in the Shangri-La.
Rating copied from Untappd. Enjoyed at the Sevens Rugby Stadium in Dubai on 10 feb 2016.
Une petite bière surprenante avec un goût appréciable. Une bien belle découverte.

It won't be my favourite, that's for sure. Pours clear golden colour, with quickly disappearing white foam and average carbonation. Aroma is sweet, corny, malty. Taste is grainy, watery, nothing extraordinary.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 2A). Bottle 33 cl - Batch 0087528X0502 (BBF 03-2021). AROMA: medium-low grainy malt aroma with a low sweet background. slight herbaceous hop aroma. APPEARANCE: pale yellow color and cristal clear. medium-low white head with low retention. TASTE: similar to the aroma with medium-low to low grainy cereal malt flavor. hop flavor not detected. medium bitterness with an almost dry finish. PALATE: medium-low to low body with medium carbonation. OVERALL: yet another pale lager.
Bright, stwar golden color and a quick dissapearing white head. Easy with a nice View of Burj Kalifat
bottle bb7/20 chiara limpida buona schiuma media persistenza cereali Niente aroma poco amaro un po’ polvere

# 2257; 9/2020. Apple in aroma. Brilliant straw body; white head with low persistance. Wattery, malty, apple, corny; short floral bitternes, crispy. Bad beer. 0,33 l, bottle, supermarket, Nepomuk (Bohemia, CZ).

Made in Heineken Brouweijen, Amsterdam.

Balanced international taste between malt and hops, with the corn it brings something extra i cant describe, foamy carbonation, but its nothing special. Beside of tsigtao on the okeyest in south east asia i Think, it needs to be colder than 7 degrees before opening.

DescriptionTiger Beer is a brand of beer from Singapore and is produced by Heineken Asia Pacific, part of Heineken. According to Brand Finance’s Top 100 Singapore brands 2012 Report, Tiger is amongst Singapore’s top 10 most valuable brands.

640ml bottle @ 4.8%. Pours a light gold with average carbonation. Aroma of malt and grain. Taste is the same with an edge of sweetness and quite watery. Slightly dry and bitter finish. Boring below average international lager.

It’s various range 50 THB with 1 can or 120-180 THB per pint

Thailand is the one of high humidity countries same as Malaysia, Singapore then the lager beer was popular long time ago. 

You can see Singha, Chang also Heineken in convenient stores around Thailand but Tiger beers is not. 

Sip from the can is so grainy from corn or something like that low malt taste came with a little sweet but if you drink on the draft version mostly sweet more than can version, yes a little bit hops tasting too. 

The good one of Tiger beer is you don’t feel headache compared with Thai local beers. 

Another choice of lagers in my country.
Can at Tallinn Crap Beer Festival. Pours clear golden colour, small off-white head. Aroma is grainy, malty, quite sweet. Taste is malty, grainy, sweet, rubbery. Light body, average carbonation. Poor.
0,33 l Flasche. Goldenes Bier, weißer Schaum. Riecht nach Mais, muffig, schmeckt wässrig.

Bottled. Clear pale yellow colour, small and quickly disappearing white head. Some malty aromas with dusty grains and hay. Taste is malty with low hop bitterness and slightly metallic aftertaste. Light body, average carbonation, watery mouthfeel, dry finish. Crap.
Just to remember me how life will be after Coronavirus if we don't support our local craft breweries now! Just an average, industrial, cheap lager. Not worth a euro.

0.33 bottle
C: pale amber
N: malt, lightly grainy
P: malty, lightly creamy, shredded grain, thin body, quite water, abrupt finish.
Clean, crisp with a bright gold appearance. A bit more depth than an average easy-drinking lager, but still light and good for a session beer.
Smooth, nice golden colour, spicy smell, light but good. No bad stomach effect
Meget lys med fint skum. Humle duft med svage antydninger af frugt. Med neutral let bitter. En helt almindelig lager. Slukker tørsten. That's it.
11.2 ounce bottle in Kent Ohio. Smells grainy. Golden in color with light white head. Taste grainy and sweet. Smooth and light. Grainy aftertaste. Just an easy drinking lager. Cheers!

Another standard international macro lager. Nothing really to write home about. Not a totally insulting drink. Tiger Beer sounds cool though. Yep... tiger... Tiger Beer... Tiger Woods... year of the tiger... Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon... Eye of the Tiger... pretty cool stuff.

L:
-pours a clear straw golden with a medium,foamy,white head
-low to medium carbonation visible
S:
-lemon,floral,grassy
T:
-Follows the nose+sweet,grainy,faint acidity
F:
-High carbonation
-light body
O:
Typically average mass market Lager,differing only in the light acidic note.
500ml bottle from Tesco, Watford and drunk on 29/05/2006.  Yup; another crappy pale lager, probably brewed under licence in Burton, or similar.

Clear golden with a thin head.
Grainy, malty smell with a grassy, hoppy note. In taste a maltiness similar to a low alcohol beer. Nice little hoppy bitterness.
Dieses Bier riecht komisch und schmeckt nach gar nichts. Wenig bis gar kein Schaum. Farbe gold

Review: 500ml bottle of Tiger Beer: 4.8% vol.

Can find it as 5% vol. in other regions of the world. Comes in a bottle, can or from the tap. Popular in Asia especially as it is the perfect beer to have as the sun goes down.

Unlike a lot of other Asian beers, Tiger actually use quality ingredients from Australia and Europe. No shitty rice beers here!

Love the famous iconic branding, the famous tiger logo and nice big colourful lettering, the blue, orange and gold. Stands out for sure. On the bottle we get "World acclaimed Asian lager”, born in Singapore and this is an “award winning full bodied beer”. 

On the pour I am getting a nice clear golden coloured beer with a white head that is a little on the small side. Some slight carbonation. Ok on the looks. 

The aroma is not great, very light, an ok lagery smell, all malty and grainy on the nose but too light and a little too much corn and very sweet.

The taste is easy enough to appreciate, was very soft on the tongue, nice and crisp.

Nice frothy mouthfuls initially, and also getting some corn in the taste.

Tasted like a regular lager, no real complaints there. Perhaps a little creamy off taste but generally it was ok. Getting the malts and grains, and the fruits, with the hops on the low level.

To be frank I was a little disappointed as the overall taste was ok but nothing too exciting, a bit bland in fact, nothing to set it apart from the millions of lagers out there. Disappointed as I have had this beer many a time when I was in Asia. In fact it was my most favourite beer that side of the world, lovely from the taps. I just guess it doesn't travel well, and not so exciting in a bottle thousands of miles away from home. Perfect for the hot humid Asian cityscape, not so when its piddling down in bog town Ireland!

Overall it was light, smooth and drinkable but with no kick or standout features. Boring.
Pours golden with a thin white head. Aroma of dry malt. Taste has florally hopped malt, sweet in nature. Palate has grass. Robust, good.
Taste refrehing and crisp with sweet corn, aroma little bit malty. Good for any asian street food and snack

Not bad, but mainly because you need a refreshing drink during the hot and humid days in Southeast Asia. As soon as you start thinking about what you are drinking while having a Tiger, it is just nothing more than a watery, malty and corn-like lager. Well... It quenched my thirst in Singapore though.
De Aldi. En copa Teku. Jugando a Slay the Spire, luego Guacamelee 2. Lager industrial bastante standard, sin sabores fuera de lugar

The asian macro-swill of choice. I'm in Kuala Lumpur now and it's either this or Carlsberg if you want to save the pennies.  

When it's hot here, like it always is, it's always a lovely refreshing beverage, although it always warms up too damn fast! Crisp, orange coloured and weak flavoured. For the non-halal guzzlers we have no other choice. Pity us.

Also, pity me, I haven't had an artisan or mainstream quality German or British beer for over 6 weeks now.
Pale yellow, large white head. Light malty smell and flavour, very weak palate. Refreshing though.

+4 stars for affordability
-2 stars for tasting a bit like piss
+0.8 stars for exotic animal feature

Color amarillo pálido, transparente. Espuma blanca, jabonosa, de más de dos dedos de espesor y corta retención. Aroma medio a cereal, ligeramente floral y una nota de caramelo. Sabor escaso a cereal, final de ligero amargor herbal, alcohol bien integrado. Textura acuosa y un punto oleosa. Carbonatación media.

Por lo menos no aparecen las temidas notas metálicas.

16 oz can pours a golden color with a small white head. Aromas of sweet bread and malt, not much else. A very basic beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Yellow, overly carbonated beer with quickly diminishing foam. It was a bit smelly and unfortunately corny, watery. Easily to drink and it was bitter enough for me.
Beer is ok if you start on it. The moment you mix a session with another beer you will then taste it’s true taste a strange metallic flavour.

12 ounce bottle

A forgettable import provides the same experience as almost every other Asian lager out there. Little more than a new country tick, the tame presence is best "enjoyed" with a few friends before moving on to another selection.

AROMA / APPEARANCE
Grainy corn husks, stale lemons, and a rough edge generate a plain somewhat uninviting profile that feels cheap and generic. The carbonated rusty body is no better as it sits idly and lifeless.

FLAVOR / PALATE
Cheap toast, stale grain, and week old lemons turning brown around the edges dull the palate. The plain finish feels expired and unmemorable with nothing to help it maintain focus. The bland texture means this is best enjoyed as a cheap rate or freebie.

330mml. bottle. 10/08/2019.
Golden colour with a white head. Poor retention. Aroma is malty and corn. Taste is barley, corn and sugar. Soft watery but not bad overall.
Next one please!
Quasiment chaque pays a sa lager internationale et Singapour n'échappe pas à la règle. La Tiger est une Lager très commune, aussitôt bue, aussitôt oubliée.
If this beer is the only beer on offer, which is often the case in chinese restaurants, I’ll drink water and protest. I find it has no worthy qualities, watery, headless, depressing.

Flaska 620 ml från 7Eleven i Thailand. Ljust guldfärgad med fint skum. Doft av malt och apelsin. Smak av malt, bröd, honung och kryddor. Medelstor beska med en bitterhet som finns kvar i eftersmaken. En riktigt trevlig öl att dricka när man är i Thailand.
33 cl bottle at home. Drank on July 20th 2019 as Tiger Beer (5,0%). Decent lager.

This is such an underrated beer and should have more recognition as it tastes really good considering it’s a beer from Singapore! With its short but rocky history this beer has done pretty well and it sure has made me happy! :)
Gold with a clear white head. Slightly sweeter and more bitter than your standard light lager.
Light malt aroma and taste, fairly clean. One good cheap beer. Possible to buy even in not only the cheapest stores.

Bue à la pression. Couleur dorée claire parfaitement limpide. Mousse légère et éphémère. Nez sur les grains. Idem en bouche, c'est bien sur les grains, c'est très cripsy. Carbo puissante, amertume légère. Une bière de soif asiatique industrielle parmi tant d'autres. Pas de défaut à signaler, ça se boit facilement.
a hululuba csapattuk, a pale lagerek között igazán kiemelkedő. pho mellé pedig eccerűen tökélentes.
When bought in Singapore something in the atmosphere (maybe the humidity) makes this beer actually drinkable, outside that not really worth it

Bottle brewed in UK, 640ml, 4.8%. Smallish head with mostly small bubbles, a few large in patches. Yellowy-golden colour. Generic hop aroma. Moderate carbonation. Almost tasteless to begin with, but with a malty, sweet aftertaste with overtones of bitterness that lasts, though not especially long, much longer than the up-front taste of this beer. Ingredients: Water, Malted Barley, Glucose Syrup, Hop Extract. That should clue you in on what this beer is like...! Not bad, as long as you like glucose syrup and hop extract in your fizzy malted barley water. Otherwise there are better ways to get your malty hit or that refreshing wetness.

Very light and easy. A good beer to have with some Asian noodles.
It wouldn´t be my first choice sitting infront of the TV, or meeting up with friends.

Pours a clear golden with white head. Light malt aroma and taste, fairly clean. 

Notes: bottle at Edinburgh Airport, Jun ‘19
It doesn't even taste like beer. It's more like some type of sugary water; very disappointing.
Light aroma, almost no taste, carbonated water to quench thirst on a hot day)
This is a terrible beer. It now appears to be brewed in Edinburgh by Heineken and almost tastes as bad as Heineken.
Light clear orange color, small foam size. Aroma is with yeast and bread notes. Taste is absolutely usual for lager.
Bottle from Beerwulf. Sweetish malt aroma with sugary notes, cereal. Flavour is pretty sweetish with a mild bitterness. Body is medium. Too sweet and sugary, not enjoyable.

Very plain beer with no outstanding features.
Pour, smell, color, and taste are underwhelming.

Bière asiatique achetée au LCBO. Belle mousse sur un liquide blond, pâle, translucide. Nez de sucre et de maïs. En bouche, rien de bien particulier mais c'est tout de même une bonne bière de soif. Pas mauvaise malgré tout! Cheers!
Clear golden colour. Some aroma of grains bu basically not much aroma. Very sweet.
This beer taste like Heineken, just a simple beer. Nothing special about it!

330 ml bottle. Pours medium golden yellow color with white head. Good lacing, with a moderate degree of carbonation. The aroma of bread, lightly toasted biscuit, light honey. Taste lightly toasted biscuits and light honey. Light aftertaste moderate grass-pepper bitterness.

Brilliant white tight bubbly head stayed on an ultra clear, pale straw coloured still body.
Light malt & oats aroma.
Medium to thin bodied & wishy-washy over the palate.
Flavoured water tastes.
That is awful stuff.

Can sample at a tasting at Tom's place. Thanks Lior. Clear pale yellow with white head. The aroma has notes of malt, lager-ish, butter and corn. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, metallic, corn, watery. Light-bodied.
12 oz poured into lager glass, pale gold clear with white head.  Medium body.  Aroma taste and finish are dominated by corn.  Finish lingers and is mildly bitter.

Аромат сололдовый, но при этом с хмелевым и жесткими пропорциями. Цвет обычный но слегка темнее чем обычно для лагера, пена мыльная, крупнопузырчатая.Вкус по началу неплохой, солодовый, легкая кислинка при глотке. Легкие хмелевые нотки, а также странная сладость. Имеющиеся легкие тошнотно-сладкое послевкусие после 30 секунд. Если без этого то умеренно жесткий- сладкий лагер. Бывало хуже.

DATE: February 16, 2019... OCCASION: the house is undergoing its pre-showing facelift...GLASSWARE: Samuel Smith lager... pours an active, glistening light golden body that teems with bubbles--so much so that parts of the glass are obscured by its clusters... the head is a sudsy, frothy uneven clump of arcs and crests--actually, attractive from the waist up... beefy metallic hose aroma, with sweet flowery hops and corn bread malts...  rather weak overall... rinsing and repeating with a buttery finish... thin, slick, dry and brief... corn syrup, thin cracker malts, sweet lemony dish detergent, and vegetable matter... cannot say that this one claws like a fierce tiger, but it cloys like a faux lager... this one would be best served with peanuts and pretzels...
A very watery, boring lager beer, with not distinct smell or taste. Even for a lager quite bland.
A long time since I've tasted this beer. A 330 ml bottle in a hotel restaurant in the beer desert of Oman. Tastes passable & satisfies me another evening.

330 ml bottle into lager glass, 6259702 bottle code. Pours crystal clear medium golden yellow color with a 1 finger dense and rocky off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light honey/pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Touch of fruity aromas, but not overwhelming. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malts and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light honey/pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, floral, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, white bread dough, lightly toasted biscuit, light honey/pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great robustness and balance of pale malts and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and no cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with no fruity/yeasty notes. Light-moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium-plus carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, moderately bready/grainy, and fairly sticky mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is a delicious Euro pale lager. All around nice robustness and balance of pale malts and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Great clean pils malt showcase, and nice noble hop presence/balance for the style. A very enjoyable offering, and outstanding style example. One of the best generic import lagers I've had.
0,33l bottle. Pours super clear pale golden with white head. Aroma of sweet malt, grass, grain, hint of citrus. Taste is malt, grassy hops, lemon. As far as pale lagers go, not too bad actually.

AR: Getreide, Brotteig, Malz (alles nur zu erahnen)
TA: klares helles goldgelb
TA: säuerlich, wässrig,

330 ml bottle. Clear yellow color with minimal white head. Smells grass and old corn. Taste are some corn notes with little grass and dust. Taste are not as horrible as smells. Short time aftertaste corn and grass. Nothing special
Bottle in a Bangkok restaurant. As usual, a drinkable lager, this one perhaps slightly on the sweeter side, but hardly distinguishable from the other similar brands on offer in most Bangkok bars.

0,33 bottle. Kitöltve egy nagyon  tiszta szép aranysárga lager, tömör szép viszonylag tartós fehér habbal. Illata visszafogott, édeskés, virágos. Ízre egy nagyon jól szénsavazott kifejezetten édeskés, számomra elfogadható, jó minőségű világmárkákhoz képest. Pici édeskés kukoricás lecsengés érződik, de komlós, illatos, finom, frissítő sör.  A kukoricacsíra a dara helyett jobban működik, bár nekem nem hiányzik.
***
Filled with a very clean beautiful golden yellow lager, solid beautiful with relatively durable white head. Aroma is restrained, sweet, floral. It tastes like a very well-carbonated, especially sweet, acceptable to me, compared to good quality world brands. It has a tiny sweet corn finish, but it is a hop, fragrant, delicious, refreshing beer. Corn germ works better than groats, though I don’t miss it.

From the bottle. Gold with a white, foamy head that soon fades. Grass nail varnish in the aroma. Taste is mildly sweet up front with hints of corn, ends mildly bitter and grainy in a short and lifeless finish. Medium to light body, a touch watery. Nothing interesting.

I really only tried this one because it turns up in novels by people like Graham Greene. So in my mind, it established itself as *the* beer for travellers in the tropics. But actually, it's just thin and grassy and bland.

0,33 l bottle. Pours crystal clear light golden yellow, one can actually see through it. A finger of dense medium lasting head with some minor lacing. Mild bready and somewhat stronger wet cardboard aroma. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is medium, texture slick anc carbonation average. Finish is medium long, herbal like bitterness accompanied with wet cardboard. Not as bland as some other industrial beer, unfortunately it's not the most pleasant one...
Heineken’s Aziatische biertje. 5%. Waterig goedje. Beetje mediterraans. Geen voldoende.
In tropical climate and when its ice cold, then this beer is very good, specially draught

Color amarillo dorado, cristalina. Dos dedos de espuma con retención media. Aroma prácticamente inexistente. Gusto discreto a cereal y ligero amargor. Cuerpo acuoso. Cerveza que en condiciones normales no tiene sentido pedirla, pero que si te encuentras en el sudeste asiático con un calor que flipas y sin más elección te puede llegar a saber gloria, jajajaja.

Õlle on selline jook, et iga uus kord kui klaasi või pudeli suule tõstad, siis leiad midagi uut, sõltuvalt tuhandest-miljonist pisiasjast, mis hetke olukorda mõjutavad. Seega piirdun iga õlle juures selle tekstiga.

Tiger Asian lager 4.6%% bottle 0.333
Smell - weak to medium hops, citrus maybe.
Foam - whitez medium large, thin, to watery side, large in mouth.
Appearance - clear, carbonated, yellow light amber.
Taste - sweetish, some more aftersweetness, weak citrus, no bitterness, maybe bit in aftertaste for tongue, refreshing fine lager.

Es una cerveza de cuerpo ligero y carbonatación media. El aroma es desagradable, como si fuera maíz quemado. Al pasar por la boca, es un poco, solo un poco mas agradable. Predomina el amargor sobre una pequeña pizca dulce.
Ein einfaches Helles, das einfach nach nicht viel schmeckt. Für die meisten Europäer einfach fade und wässrig.

From a 330 ml bottle in Sapa Town. Pours a clear pale gold with a white head. Bready aroma. Flavors typical of the style. Moderate sweetness and minimal bitterness. Okay it you’re desperate for beer or a tick.

Friday, October 12, 2018	
12 ounce bottle poured to pint glass cold beer 	
Sight: Light pale yellow, big foam, a lot of lacing	
Aroma: not a lot, malty aroma	
Taste: watery, not a lot of taste	
Mouth feel: very carbonated	
Overall: good beer for the hot weather
Goud geel bier met weinig schuim. Met een zoetige mout smaak en iets van hop. -backlog de BierApp-
Flasa z nejakeho obchodu v londyne. Slabosladova vona. Farba zlatista. Chut nevyrazna na konci trochu horka.
Bottle at home, koszi anya! Good for a country tick, but nothing more really. Crappy macro lager.

Bouteille trouvée chez Beerwulf avec belle étiquette et belle capsule. Couleur et mousse 'pils'. nez assez rudimentaire type "pils". Bouche douce mais légèrement piquante tout de même, malts et quelques houblons. Pas de corps. Commercial pas plus mauvais qu'une H.

Bottle, 330 ml. I was waiting to taste this beer, so when i found it i bought a 6 pack. Light golden, decent foam and medium carbo. Sweet malt and hay on the nose. Taste is pretty average, like a normal decent lager: more bitter than sweet, dry, medium aftertaste. Nothing special (i have to compare it to Heineken later), but absolutely enjoyable.
nice foam top.pale, cloudy, sparkling, aroma : fruits, wet box, taste : alcohol,
Typical Asian style lager. Ok appearance nicely carbonated. Not bad for what it is
Fles thuis geprobeerd. Het is een goedgeel bier met een wit schuim. Het heeft een moutige geur en smaak, best waterig.
Ein erfrischendes Bier. Kleine Schaumkrone. Sehr helle goldene Farbe. Ein milder hopfig, zitrusartiger Geschmack. Im Abgang ist es ein eher wässriges leichtes Bier

After warm day bike ride. Pours clear straw, big white head. Off musty corn aroma (slightly stale popcorn?) Over light biscuit. Taste is typical pale lager, only modest hint of buttered corn, some off flavor. Hops? Light mouthfeel. There better beers, even in this style.
Bottle served with an ice cold mug. Light big brewery malt aroma. Sweet taste. It is light and clean.

Pours a very weak and watery yellow with a small white head. The nose is bready, grainy, and metallic, with some minor notes of grass. The taste is dry. There isn't a whole lot of flavor within, but what I do find isn't pleasant. I'd say the metallic elements are stronger than the graininess. There are some very light yeast, corn, and grass, but this isn't nearly enough to compensate for the negativity that overwhelms this one. Short metallic aftertaste. Light in body and thin in texture. Simply put, this was bad.
12 ounce can bought in a shop in Hanoi. Light malt body and not much taste but it was cold.

Le tigre se révèle être un tigreau (que j'ai eu dans les bras …
expérience unique .. si cela vous est proposé, surtout ne ratez pas).
A noter que des tigres à Singapour, je n'en ai jamais vu beaucoup !!
Mais enfin, le marketing n'est pas à cela près …
Nous apprenons, par l'étiquette bien sûr, que cette bière est une 
" world acclaimed " .. c'est le minimum, bien entendu ..
Ensuite c'est une " award winning " .. ben oui, ma sœur aussi …
Enfin, c'est une " full-bodied beer " .. alors là, je dois dire que ça 
m'en bouche un coin .. parce que des bières, je n'en ai pas bu 
beaucoup dans ma vie (!!??), mais si celle-là est " full-bodied ", 
alors ma sœur sera bientôt " miss monde " … ça me fait plaisir.
Mais vous ne savez pas encore tout, parce que nous avons ici,
accrochez-vous, un " tropical lagering process " !!
Oh innocents que vous étiez, vous ne connaissiez pas encore ce
procédé qui transforme le tigre en moule à gaufre … vous êtes
vraiment les derniers tarés de la planète.
Niveau abv de 5 %.
Mon exemplaire était à 5 mois avant sa date.
Couleur jaune brillant, aux bulles assez calmes (elles viennent 
de voir passer le tigre dans les rues de Singapour !! ).
Liquide plat comme un iguane qui fait la sieste.
Nez de maïs, riz à l'eau, eau de riz.
1ère bouche qui ferait fuir un tigre (d'ailleurs, il n'y en a plus 
un seul à Singapour …).
Arrière-bouche qui donne envie d'un bon plat de riz (un vrai ..).
La suite .. c'est fait !!
CONCLUSION : comme dit le brasseur " enjoy tiger responsibly " ..
oui, mais, si vous le voyez, fuyez d'abord ...
Standardowy lager gaszacy pragnienie w upalne dni. Nie doszukiwalbym sie niczego specjalnego w tym piwie :)

Tap @ Sukhumvit, Bangkok XI 2019. Vlak van smaak en wat waterig. Kortom beetje flauw van smaak, qua uiterlijk helder licht geel bier met een witte schuimkraag. Lichte bitter. Weinig mout flauw van geur, typisch Aziatisch biertje. Uiterlijk is nog zijn sterkste punt. Wel een ideaal biertje om thuis bij Thai’s eten in sfeer te komen. En dan doet het goed wat het moet doen. Namelijk het veels te hete Thaise eten blussen 🥵 Proef & Origineel glas

Tiger Beer er en international pilsner på 5%. Den skiller sig lidt ud fra mængden af pilsnere ved sin honning- og blomsteragtige duft og ved en smag der er mere sød end normalt. Ganske svag humlebitter eftersmag.
A rather forgettable beer.  It doesn’t have a taste that screams it’s name, disappointing.

Botella de 330ml servida en tarro. Color amarillo pálido, con carbonatación vivaz y una inestable corona de espuma blanca de burbujas abiertas que se difuminan rápidamente. Su aroma es casi nulo, a granos, maíz y lúpulos herbales. Su sabor es inicialmente a granos y luego un amargor herbal que deja un desagradable retrogusto que persiste. Su cuerpo es muy aguado y con mucha carbonatación.
0.33 l bottle at 🇻🇳 🍴 in Berlin. Clear pale golden, lasting small white head. Grainy, herbal, fake. Light. High carbonation. Boring.
Aroma malt, høy, brød. Utseende klar lys gul med hvitt skum. Smak i samme leia. Ei tynn og lett øl. Flaske smakt Juni 2012, 33cl 5%

Clear golden with a white head. Lots of pale malt, straw, cornbread, mate, lemon, slight metal. Pretty watery. Light to medium bitterness and sweetness, light sourness. Soft carbonation, thin feel, astringent finish.
Clear gold. Aroma is pale malt straw gummy bears. Taste is some bitter mustiness with sweet pale malt. A bit ash in the finish but quite drinkable. Ok.

Picked up a six pack of this at a World Market, appeared to be fresh and in good condition with a best by date almost 3 months away. Even so, I have been roundly disappointed with this beer as it tastes to be of very poor quality ingredients and does not leave the palate clean and refreshed. Served ice cold it's not bad, and it does have a decent full golden appearance that pours with a solid top of white foam, but otherwise there are no redeeming qualities to this brew. The aroma is a stagnant grainy flavor with some boiled vegetal hops, with notes of syrupy honey and lemon juice, tastes comparable to other inferior African and Asian macro-lagers. It did pair alright with some authentic Indian biryani and samosas this evening, but I remember Kingfisher lager tasting substantially better. I will be sure to avoid drinking this beer in the future. Oh and of course the brewery is owned by / affiliated with Heineken... my advice is don't fall for the advertising and skip this beer, there are much better pale lagers out there.

Bottle at Spice Gallery, North Petherton, Somerset accompany an Indian meal. Pours clear pale golden with a white head. Aroma: sweetish malts, hints of citrus & grass. Taste: light sweet, watery pale malts, pinch of hops. LIght body, average carb, lightly dry finish. Not great
Blik 33cl thuis. Drogige bijsmaak, zoetige hoppigesmaak. Wat klef zoetig, droppig. (11-2013).

Golden color with a small head, disappearing very fast. Aroma is malty. Taste is malty too, even some little bitterness in the end. I didn't feel any particular mistakes/problems, as often happens with this kind of beers. Dry aftertaste, even if very short. Nothing special, but drinkable in a hot day.
One of the worst beer you can get in Singapore. The taste is not nice at all. It a national beer of Singapore and also the worst. Skip this and drink other beers instead
On tap at Disney. Poured a yellow color with a small sized head. Typical pale lager profile all the way through and through.

On can. 
Pours clear yellow-ish, with white head.
Scent: Low hops, malts, rather sweet.
Taste: Watery, malts, low bitterness.
Texture: Watery.

Bottle pours clear light golden yellow with a fizzy white head. The aroma is grainy, metallic, uninteresting. The flavor is typical pale lager, cardboard, grain, not much hop to speak of. Thin, light, high carbonation. Meh.

330ml bb09/2018, BLsampler. - - bref: maltier than many an international light lager & not the worst spent malt infusion to come out of Asia. - Ar: Mildly sulphurous heavy cardboard malts with a whiff of more natural popcorn, then cooked vegetable. P: sleek like oozed-through cardboard box. T: the tannins of cornflakes, well-soaked, forgotton on the kitchen counter top. The sweet second runnings thereof. Not all bad. Singapore & Malaysia got the better ingredient end of the Heineken franchisestick.
Butelka. Złoty kolor.Piana biała,dość obfita opada szybko. Słodowe akcenty, mało przeszkadzająca kukurydza ,mokry karton.

Pours pale yellow with white foamy head. Mild and malty aroma. Taste is rather similar. Mild, malty and watery .  A good thirst quencher but nothing special. (Poured from a 330 ml can @ BA Galleries Lounge at LHR)

Thick white head on top of a clear, golden body. It’ smells of bread, with a hint of corn. It is rather bland despite the style. No bizarre aftertaste to speak of. It doesn’t stand above any of the American pale lagers readily on the market. It’s not a bad beer, it just isn’t giving me a reasons to go out of my way to buy it again.
Can. Pours a pale golden color with frothy white head. Grainy aroma with some yeast. Slightly sweet with some sharp metallic notes. Thin bodied. Not great.

(bottle) clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of weak wasabi and pale malts, heavily vegetal, with some notes of pumpernickel and yeast slurry. flavour is mostly salted popcorn and old malts, with lots of yeast and an empty finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Et ganske godt øl, passer til det meste av mat. Også behagelig som tørstedrikk. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Prakticky tady přidávám tento komentář, jen aby tady něco bylo, protože zpětně dopisuji 900 piv z mého seznamu a asi bych se musel u toho zbláznit.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso propende per l'orzo. L'olfatto viene sollecitato in maniera normale e la continuità olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello di schiuma ha una scarsa tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è a grana media. Il liquido è di consistenza limpida. Poche bollicine medio-fini costituiscono la forma della frizzantezza. Il colore è giallo dorato. Il corpo è medio. L'amaro è moderato. L'intensità gustativa è normale. La costanza gustativa è sufficiente. Le sensazioni boccali che permangono sono di facile beva. Il finale è semplice e dissetante. Il retrogusto è di media intensità. In bocca l'aroma porta note di pane e cereali.
Обычный светлый лагер без изысков. Для жары и острых блюд, ничего запоминающегося.

Bottle. Surprised I haven't rated this yet as I know I've had it. Now closer to the source, my bottle brewed in Thailand. All the expected descriptors apply. Pale yellow, corny, clean. Bit heavier than some macros, but ordinary. (#6963, 3/2018)

500ml can from LCBO. Pours a clear pale straw colour with one finger of white head. Malty aroma with notes of bread, hay, citrus, and a whiff of champagne. Taste matches the aroma. Refreshing beer with a medium body and moderate carbonation.
In Muscat , Oman at the Radisson Blu with Josh, pour a light golden color, Flat nose. Taste is grainy, light and flat...typical of most lagers, but no choice. Quaff Score 3 / 10

Bottle at Arriba Mexican restaurant in Plymouth. Pours light amber with a fizzy white head. High carbonation. Very mild aroma. I used to drink a lot of this when I lived in South East Asia, before I discovered craft beer. It’s light citrus, quite malty, but it’s lager, bland, flavourless lager!
Can from Sri Lanka. hay, golden, clear, minimal head, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel,

Can@ DTU w friends/Nissen + mr spark. Appearance: pours clear pale yellow with ok white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: bread, barley, grass and light citrus. palette: light hoppy aroma, average carbonation, light to medium body, medium sweetness, somewhat balanced by a light to medium bitterness, short duration and a watery texture. Overall: standard lager

Very clean pale golden straw color with a lively, dense head of soapy white foam. Honey Nut Cheerios, crisp and subtly dry grain husk, and some soda cracker going on. Also glad to know I helped fund a cause pointed toward saving tigers.

From the 16 oz. can with an expiration date of Mar 2018. It pours like a pale lager should with its straw yellow appearance and boisterous, foamy white head. Good clarity. The aroma is bread, biscuit, corn, toast and grass. The body is light to medium. Refreshing. The taste has a clean sweetness about it with a mild, bitterness and crispness to finish it off. As far as the style goes, this is fairly decent.
0,33l Flasche.  Gelbes Bier mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Leicht malziges Aroma,  im Geschmack wässrig,  zum Abschluss unangenehm bitter.
Pours pale golden with heavy head. Aroma is caramel and hops. Taste is first sweet caramel moving to slight hoppiness. Finish is not noticeable. An uninteresting lager
Medium yellow color with good froth.  Light and mainly balanced, between malt sweetness and hop bitterness, crisp with a European flavor.
Nice light pale lager. Malty. Corn but not corny. Would be nice in summer. Tasted at nudos.

Tap at Beakers, Berlin - it was happy hour time, so I chose Tiger. Actually, I expected far worse. It has a pleasant floral odor, taste is medium hoppy. body is a bit thin, aftertaste is weirdly grainy. overall, I'd say, an okay pale lager.

Bottle at Hai Hai. Fond memories of drinking this often in Singapore. From memory, it's basically pale golden in color with not a lot of distinguishing characteristics. Aroma is grainy and has a slight skunky note. Taste is your standard lager with plenty of grain. This is the type of beer you seek out when it's humid and sweltering. Easy to drink and honestly on the better end of the lager spectrum. Memories push this score higher.

Das Tiger Lager Beer aus Singapur, vom Heineken Konzern. Geprägte Flasche, Etikett ist gut. Helles Goldgelb im Glas plus Minikrone. Zutatenliste: Wasser, Gerstenmalz, Maisgrieß und Hopfenextrakt. Gebraut in der EU unter Lizenz von Heineken Asia Pacific. Säuerlicher Antrunk, sehr wässrig süsser Körper, unangenehme Extraktbittere im Abgang. Nix für mich.

"The beer is clear golden in colour with a minimal amount of white foam on top. It tastes sweet and malty with a hint of citrus. The end is rather short and malty." - beersoftheworldproject.wordpress.com

Date: 17/01/2015

Bought at: Meny Bogstadveien in Oslo, Norway.

Bottle with a Thai dinner. Pours a crystal clear deep gold, decent looking low head. Corn starch aroma clears, sweet malt, cookie, light lemon. Sweet malt-forward flavour, light floral hopping, has a little more pleasant character than most of its ilk. Light and a tad watery, maintains its malt sweetness through to the end. Ok.

Farbe: klares gold
Schaum: schnell weg
Nase: ein Stück Goldhopfen, aber vor allem: Benzin?!
Geschmack: kohlensauer, dann bitter auf der Zunge. Vom Goldhopfen und dann leicht Gerste merkt man was, aber dann eher wässrig Richtung Nachgeschmack. Wird schnell lack. Wofür hat der Mist ne Goldmedaille gewonnen?
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts water hops and some cardboard flavor malts water citrus cardboard spicy and hops
From backlog. 0,3 litre Can from Taxfree store at Kiel ferry. Clear Golden with white head. Malty, Sweet.

A fairly typical lager from a warm country. A bit more bite than a lot of its neighbours, to me it seemed not to be quite the rice bland beer I tasted in beers from Thailand, Combodia and Vietnam. Not really my go-to beer, but it doesn't stand in the shade of your Heineken or Carlsberg, and as such, I'd rather go for this at an Asian restaurant than many others. One real bonus is the fact that this beer doesn't taste cardboard of metal.
Asian pilsner with a long tradition and a Europpean taste. Good foaming beer with a bitter taste.

Bottle 0,33L. Courtesy of Kita. Clear, pale golden color with average big, long lasting, frothy, white head. Aroma of grain and bread. Light sweet at start, light bitter at the end and nothing in between. At least adding a new country in my beer map...
Malty lager, historic rating taken from 1001 Beers book where I’ve made a note of the score. No tasting notes.

Nothing special, one for the numbers. Not much of a unique flavour. Had in Coogee, Sydney 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear golden yellow beer with a small white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of hay, grain, bread, grass and banana. Flavor is spicy with notes of hay, grain, rice and grass. Well balanced.

Well, let's say it is ok if you drink it quick enough.
Since the hot Malaysian weather it warms quickly and then it becomes bad (like most pilsners).
On a hot Malaysian day, it did taste superb but a try later at home did reveal an average sweet pilsner.
pale gold in colour. Thin white head , with a metallic , corn taste .  thin body

Bottle from some Asian fast food in fresh market. 
Classic Asian corn lager mixed with decent amount of metal and nastiness. 
Singapore, check.

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Andover Liquors. Appearance is clear golden yellow with nice sparkle, ephemeral white fizzy head and no lacing. Aroma is musty, cracker, lightly sweet--fusels? Taste is lightly sweet, cardboard, slightly off. Palate is light bodied with thin texture, soft carbonation and finish as taste with slightly off character. Overall, I'm glad I've now had a beer from Singapore but am glad my wife offered to finish this.
Had this on fligt from Frankfurt to Singapore. Similar to all other pale lagers in Asia. But still an okay beer.

Malty sweet with low backing bitternesss. Light and refreshing and would make a good summer beer, or drinking in singapore for that matter. Not any exiting tastes or aromas but not a bad beer, no off flavours except for maybe low hints of canned corn in the aroma. Could do with a bit more bitterness as well

Can 33 cl from Systembolaget. Very clear golden with a thin white head. Corn, light malt, hint of fruits (apples and pears). Quite sweet, not much bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation, sweet finish. Very refreshing but a bit too sweet for my taste.

Typisches Massenbier des asiatischen Marktes. Sehr wässrig mit einem nicht unangenehmen Mix aus grasigem Hopfen und süßem Malz. Beides aber eher zu erahnen. Leicht pappiger Geschmack im Abgang. Trinkbar aber kein Geschmackserlebnis.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung der englischen Lizenzversion). Trinkbar aber kein Brüller.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle from 'Jumbo' (Maastricht), bottled in April 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Sweetish, slightly grassy and a little skunky aroma of grains and some straw. Moderately sweet, slightly bitter, moderately grassy taste of grains, cardboard and some straw, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly grassy, a bit metallic and quite papery finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Not very good.
Quite good light beer with standart aromatic taste, nothing more, nothing less.

On tap at bar in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Pours a biscuity clear gold with a white head. Aroma: sweet malt, grass, mild caramel, very mild citrus. Taste: sweet malt, mild citrus. Not much else to this beer. Thin bodied. High carbonation. Mild bitterness. This is good by macro standards, but it is still quite generic and over carbonated.
Very frothy and creamy with a nose of crushed beetle and washing up liquid. Best season beer ever.

Well, the UK brewed version of this great Asian lager is not going to win any gold awards. Thanks Heineken but I won't be buying this brew. Can't fault the original Tiger though, one of the best of its type. Shame that is not the Tiger now available in the UK.

During my time in SIngapore there was nothing to beat a cool Tiger. Also in Thailand and other Southeast Asian countries it is widely distributed, very often available on tap. While I would agree that it ranks among the better in the region, it cannot stand a test with real beers/ales. After all it is a standard Lager with a relatively flat taste.

Tiger Beer not a strong contender for beer of the year, actually it’s aimed at Southern Softies

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can.
Pours light yellow with a big head. No retention, no foam to write home about.
Aroma has faint pissoir.
Taste is artificial sweet and cloying with some metal notes.
Medium body, low carbonation, round thick mouthfeel.
Sweet aftertaste.


Sweetness all over and pretty much nothing more. If this is what "World acclaimed lager beer" tastes like, I'm not having it. This is the worst beer I've had to date. Bleaurgh!

Golden color, white head that quickly disappears. Aroma has notes of corn, light maltiness and butter. Flavor is slightly sweet with some cardboard hints. Light maltiness in the final with corny hints.

330ml can from Systembolaget, Sweden. Clear pale yellow with two finger white head fading to form a small white lid. Aroma is sweet malts, very light citrus and light metallic notes. Taste is metallic, sweet doughy malts and a light but odd bitterness. Light mouthfeel, medium carbonation and non-descript aftertasre.
UK version at 4.8%. Nice golden with a thin head, medium carbonation. Taste is difficult to place some peach or apricot, lime, lemon and a dry hoppy malted aftertaste. Fairly pleasant session lager.

330ml can from Systembolaget. Clear, pale golden. Lasting large white head, some lacing. Sweet grainy and sweet white bread aroma. Light, thin and soft mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Sweet grainy taste, some bread. Lacks bitterness for sure.
Underwhelming fizzy drink, some malty flavours and aromas of bread and biscuits
From old tasting notes. Brassy gold hue. Clear with a robust head. Malty nose has a hint of fruitiness. Very flavorful malty character some hops in middle and finish. Drinkable, though non distinct.
Bottle. Oh boy, where to begin. Budget grain, malt, and corn highlights. Below average body and mouthfeel. Pretty much no redeeming qualities.

De gode gamle tyskerne mener at smaken av øl kommer fra maltet, og her, på en 4,6%, har de brukt rørsukker i ølet. Det skal enkelt gjøres å få til 4,6 på bare malt, og med rørsukker blir der så vidt plass til malt og det vises i smaken. 
Ekstremt enkel og nøytral øl. Men den smaker ikke vondt. 
4/10
Bottle at Mimosa restaurant, Aldershot. Standard pale lager. Sweet but not overly so. Light and fizzy. Goes easily enoughl but lacks any substance.
Tap in Singapore. Pale yellow colour with good head foam, malt taste and no specific aroma. Easy drinking beer, not the best lager
Watery pale lager. Easy going beer for evening with friends. No contemplation of it required.

Golden color with medium white foam. Aromas of pale malt, straw dust and like other generic pale lagers. Palate, medium body with smooth texture rather flat and leaving sweet finish. Taste, sweet, light malts and generic lager. Overall, okay lager, nice palate and no off flavours.

640 ml bottle @home,bb 31/05/2018.
Golden,clear. Faint hay aroma.
Taste is malt-ish water. Fizzy.
Clear golden color with white head. Aroma of malt, grain and hay. Taste is little sweet with light bitter finish. Notes of citrus. Normal lager beer.
330ml bottle. Clear yellow, thinnest white cap. Nose is malt, honey, corn, grass. Flavors follow with a touch of skunk on the sweetish finish. Ok.
Ook deze regelmatig gedronken in ZO Azië. Met name in Maleisië. Ook daar door de warmte een prettig bier. Uit fles, klein en groot, maar ook van de tap.
Bottle in pai, thailand. Common lager, could be from anywhere, refreshing, crispy.

Bottled as Tiger Asian Lager, from Total Wine, South Richmond. Pours clear pale golden with a large white head. Aroma is sweet corn and grass. Flavor is sweet grasses, grain, very bitter green leaves. Nothing I’d choose to drink again.

Clear golden pour, nice frothy white head, comes down and leaves decent lacings. Nose is just grainy, crisp malts and a bit of wet cardboard. Taste has sweet malty grains as well, some sewage, usual Asian lager messiness. Bitterness subdued, somewhat limp sweetish finish. I guess the only way to drink this is chilled and during a hot day when you just chug this down, without contemplating on how it tastes.
Bland and inoffensive I guess. Tinny aftertaste. A bad Budweiser with bitter corn syrup and rice. Refreshing when you’ve sweated your pants off but offensive once it warms up
Bottle. Typical generic mass produced lager. Light body, crisp though lacking any great flavours, bit of malt and light bitterness.
Bottle. Clear golden color with white head. Aroma - Grain, malt, some fruit. Taste - Lightly bitter, lightly fruity, cereals, grain.

Light aroma of pale malts and hops. 

Pours golden with a white head. 

Taste is crispy and malty. Some sweet notes.
640ml bottle from Campus Central, Reading University. Sweet malt, metallic notes, grain, vegetable oil.

A solid lager with a mildly sweet maltiness and a smooth finish. Pours a light golden with a medium-frothy head. Bottle at my local Vietnamese restaurant. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ampolla a la fira B-Delicious. Cervesa rossa i cristalina amb força escuma blanca. Aromes discrets de cereal i mel. Una mica plana. Cos baix, carbonatació mitja-alta. Final sec. Està be.
Clear golden coloured poured from the tap. Very light malt flavour. Little to no bitterness. Medium carbonation. What you’d expected from a macro lager.

Pale yella. Macro malt water metal aroma and taste. Odd sweetness that reminds me of American Budweiser. Bitter finish. Thirst quenching and welcoming next to some spicy pad thai, but run of the mill otherwise.
Thai version, hostel in Koh Chang. Bottle. Light yellow with white head. Malty and bready. Refreshing finish.
Thai version, bottle at the hotel in Phuket. Clear yellow with white head. Sweet malt, hay, bread. Thirst quenching.
33cl bottle purchased @ Casino. Lager rafraichissante mais sans originalité.

Can 323ml - tasted metallic as though some beer reacted with the inner can, flat and smelled like piss after left half drunk for 30 minutes.

Bottle 640ml - slightly better, given the sight of the voluptuous beer promoter. Took her time to pour, with substantial head. Aroma - flowery or was that her shampoo?

Draft - served ice cold as promised but disappointing flat. S$15 for the damage per pint. Would have better luck roaming the alleys in Geylang.
Botella 0,33L. Color dorado claro, espuma fina, de larga duracion, bastante buena.Aroma malta, miel. sabor malta con un toque de miel, dulce, sin amargor.Gases media.Un poco acuosa.
Light, pale yellow. Head is a bit soapy in appearance but recedes instantaneously. Corny taste. Let’s be honest, folks: we’re here for the Singaporean tick.
Very nice label and cover art which I’m sure draws most people in, I know it did me. Otherwise quite a bad tasting beer, much worse than other Asian beers including Tsing Tao and Kingfisher. Avoid.

I ran into Tiger in various places as I bicycled around Southern Asia, and generally avoided it. It’s really quite noticeably an adjunct beer, and god knows what goes in it. Of course, you expect that most Asian beers have a lot of rice in the mix, as that is what’s cheap and available. But Budweiser also has rice, and maintains its inoffensive flavorlessness. 

Tiger, on the other hand, tastes like something has gone terribly wrong in the adjunct department, kind of like too much corn really spoils a lot of American adjuncts and it has a distressingly metallic flavor. Mostly saw this in Malaysia, but also in Indonesia and elsewhere. Avoid it!

This lager poured a clear medium yellow with a bright white head. Not bad lacing. Scents include corn, hay and ginger ale? First swig was quite watery. Flavours of corn and hops most prominent. Finish is a little sweet with that hay taste lingering.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at David Lloyd club Eastbourne. Pretty awful as lagers go but hey ho. I swear it tastes so much better in Singapore!!
A rather dull Pale Lager. They try to sell it off as a special ale over here...
Konsumpcja z butelek w Bangkoku. Piwoo jasnym żółtym kolorze, w smaku czuć słód. Standardowy lager

Pours gold with a quickly disapating head. Aroma is fruity like a Belgian ale. Taste is smooth but not very strong. Overall easy beer to drink but not much to it. Bottle from World Of Beers Middleton Wi.

Flasche 0,33l: Golden, glasklar, etwas mittelporiger Schaum; in der Nase malzig, Getreide, Brotteig, leichte malzige Süße, sehr mild; sehr leichter Körper, malzig, Getreide, Brotteig, spritzig, etwas Kohlensäure, sehr dezente Hopfennoten, recht dünn, wässrig; milder unspektakulärer Nachgang
Clear yellow color. Super grain/grass smell. In your face. Flavor is crisp and short. Some spice.
Looks like a corona...tastes like a corona. Not bad for a pale lager. The finish is smooth.

Golden, clear pour with thin, quick white foam. Sweet cereal malt in the nose with some bitter notes. Watery body with active fizz and slightly bitter finish. Some corn in the taste. A hot weather beer.
At the Nomad Lounge, Animal Kingdom, Walt Disney World.

0,64l bottle at Hotel in Sigiriya, Sri Lanka. BB 03/2017. light yellow clear colour, small white head. smells lightly fruity, cardboard, light grains. Medium body, soft carbonation, bit light mouthfeel. tastes lightly fruity, light plums, grainy, lightly grassy. finishes lightly bitter with notes of grains and malty notes. Not the biggest fan of this one.
330ml bottle. Pours pale with little head. Sweet peach, floral, lemon, golden syrup. Bit too sweet, but ultimately not the worst lager you’ll come across.

Actually not a disaster I expected. Bit husky honeyish malts, some corn, light grassy hops, watery, but as I drink it cold - decent. Moderate sweet with light bitterness.
Nothing enjoyable, but quite decent macro "cold one"
Неплохой солодовый аромат. Насыщенный солодовый вкус. Немного похоже на Хеллес.
This is light and malty. Not bad, in fact it is good. However, there is nothing remarkable or unique about it.

Can at 4.7% ABV. Brewed by Heineken Russia. Pours clear gold with medium fluffy white head. Poor retention. Typical lageresque aroma. Malts, hay, paper, metal, spicy hop. Light to medium body. Full honey malts on tongue. Rather clean. Light spicy bitterness finishing all. Drinkable
Bottle. A very sweet and weak lager with low bitterness and a metallic finish.

Draft at Maldives resort.
Clear, pale, almost no head 
Aroma of honey boiled veggies
Taste of sweet, honey some bitterness, thin.

A bottle at the Season Seafood Restaurant on Pulau Ubin, while on holiday in Singapore. Aroma: sweet, hay, Appearance: clear, light amber, generous foamy head. Palate: light-bodied, thin, very well-carbonated, bitter with an abrupt finish. Taste: a hint of pepper from the alcohol, otherwise nothing to surprise. I’ve had this from the can, and the bottle tastes noticably livelier. Singapore’s iconic lager, preferably drunk with a plate of seafood and the sound of waves lapping the shore.
Dorada limpia, clara, un dedo de espuma blanca. Aroma escaso, malteado. En boca es cereal, aguada, dulzona... nada que aportar

Blah!!! This tastes like a stale lager with water. Really boring, but drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Niepijalne piwo o barwie slomkowej, niskiej wrecz zerowej pianie. Zapach slodowy ciezko wyczuwalny, smak mega sztuczny
bottle. Light golden with higher white head. Aroma: malt, caramel. Taste: sweet, malt, syrup. Light body, soft carbonation. Watery texture.
Another awful waste of time and water. Metallic, acidic, medium carbonation.
Kicsi, gyorsan elillanó hab, borostyán szín. Enyhe, lágeres, édeskés-gabonás illat. Halványan édeskés, gabonás, enyhén komlós, kesernyés ízvilág. Erősen szénsavas, közepesen testes tucatláger.
earthy, toast, golden, sparkling, white foam, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour,

F: white, thing, not long lasting.
C: gold, clear.
A: malty, cereal, grassy, honey.
T: malty, cereal, hint of grassy, caramel, hint of honey, quite easy drinking, medium body, good carbonation, reminds me some Polish lagers, not bad at all, 33cl bottle from Kam Yuen Supermarket in Brussels.
nie wiem jak takie piwo zdobywa nagrody, ale jest bardzo kiepskie, zwykły koncerniak, płaskie w smaku i nudne

33 cl bottle. Had this one in Mien Tay, London, back in 2013 (July 8th, to be precise). Don’t remember anything special about it, neither good nor particularly bad. Your standard pale lager, just as hundreds more. 



2nd review: Ibis Styles Kensington, London, May 31st, 2017: Pours pale golden, short-lived whitish head. Aroma is toast, Spanish lime mamoncillo, dry lemon. Mouth is rancid, dry, short-lived. Not really bitter. Bad, forgettable, blah.
[backlog] 11-06-15 // 680ml bottle in Georgetown, Penang, Malaysia. Pale yellow. white lacing. Standard macro lager. Grainy sweet. Malty.
Can on the BA flight to Tokyo. Slightly sweet and malty. Rather lacking in flavour. Thin body. Medium carbonation.

Can from Meny, Amager, Copenhagen (Thanks for the heads up on country tick to Niller) :) - pours a clear golden yellow colour with a thin dissipating white head. Grassy and grainy, straw, very sweet with notes of corn, some cardboard, light metallic, very basic pale lager.

Originally rated on 10/2/2008. Tiger was better than I expected for an asian beer. It poured a golden yellow body with lots of carbonation, a decent sized head left moderate lace. Aroma of sweet malts, and a little grassy, flavor was similar to the aroma with the grassy taste quickly leaving, no aftertaste to speak of.
Can from Netto. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, herbal notes, grain. A bit watery. Light body. Soft carbonation. Bittersweet finish.
Bottle. Pours clear golden with fading white head. Aroma is light malty with some light skunky sweetness. Taste is light malty and semi-sweet with some skunky flatness. Pretty ordinary asian.

630ml bottle in Mae Kasa, Thailand. Pale Golden pour, minimal white head. Faint aroma of rice. Rice and corn to taste; quite sweet. Light body with medium carbonation. Fair Asian style lager but unsurprising.

0.5l can from a supermarket in moscow, brewed by heineken in russia (n.novgorod). pours a clear pale golden with a small white head and some lacing. aroma of hay, grains, rice. flavour of sweet grains, corn, grass, slightly metallic.

650ml bottle BB 19/4/17
Subdued grainy fruity aroma.
Poured light golden straw with good head and lacing.
Medium bitterness is followed by a crisp clean finish.
There’s nothing complex here - a refreshing session lager never the less. 
A tick for Singapore.
Golden clear lager with some white head. Hints of bitter and malty in aroma and taste. Typical mass production lager, nothing special, but drinkable.

Aroma: cereal, caramel
Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head, white foam, 
Taste: lightly bitter, rice
Palate: light body, thin feel, average carbonation,
0.33l bottle. Malty aroma with hopy notes. Clear pale yellow color, low head. Taste is malty. Light body, watery texture, higher carbonation and malty and bitter finish.

33cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Subtle bitterness with quite some sweetness. Honey, citrus, caramel, grass and malts. A tad too sweet lager.
Prima pils om Hong Kong mee af te sluiten. Lekker op ’t strand on de ondergaande zon.
bottle @ supermarket (budapest) pale colour, normal body, medium carbonated, semi bitter, average lager beer, nothing special

Poured from a bottle. An easy drinking lager, sweetish taste and not uber-carbonated. A nice golden colour but not much more than that. Nowhere near as good as a European lager but good enough for a hot summer day.
Bottle of 33cl. Pale golden colour. Medium bodied, rather sweet, some bitterness. OK.

Pours a medium golden color. About two fingers white head. Doesn’t last long. No retention, very light lacing.

Aroma is corn and rice, probably mostly rice. Sweet and grapeskin. Hops, maybe floral. Smells sorts like malt liquor.

Taste is pretty good. A little bitter all the way through, but very light. Mostly sweet, maybe some honey. Sorta tastes like malt liquor. Not a whole lot of descriptives for it.

Mouthfeel is light medium, and watery. It’s enjoyable and easy to drink.

Overall, it’s okay. It reminds me of Bud Light. I would probably not buy it again, but I might if it were offered in an Asian restaurant. But otherwise, I wouldn’t buy it. I might recommend it, but probably not.
500ml can. Pours golden with medium sized white head. Basic lager with aroma of malts and hint of herbal hops.
Pale orange/golden, clear, dense white foam. Light malt aroma. This has some residual sweetness in the finish which I prefer.

Bottle at Beijing 8. 
Pours clear yellow with a bubbly head. 
Light, fizzy with some grains.
Can at restaurant. Bubbly on the palate but flat on the mouth, a kind of dull ricy metallic aftertaste.
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden, nose is bland toffee, lemon, taste is similar, floral.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Lager glass; from the fridge.

Nice little lager, with a blond pale colour, and a little white head. The aroma is lager yeast and malt. No great taste, but little, subtles notes of spices.
Tunn och alkoholsmakande lager. Konstigt att kunna missa en sådan enkel bryggd.
Straw color, small head. Light malt aroma. Light bitter and sweet. Astringent finish with some sour notes.
On tap @ The Grafton, Cork, Ireland. This is rice based average macro swill. There is just no substance here at all. Unless you’re tasting it to rate it I’d pass on this.
Aus der Flasche bei einem asiatischen Restaurant. Üblich unauffällig für ein Pale Lager, süßlich im Aroma, etwas herber als erwartet.
Papier papier i jeszcze raz papier. Jedno z najgorszych piw jakie piłem

I drank this beer yesterday in Beijing, during a hot night. It is a beer with nothing extraordinary, big group and poor quality. The body is yellow, gold, normal carbonation and the typical lager foam. The taste is malty, probably corn, almost no hop, there is side metalic, unpleasant sensation at the tongue, not well balanced.
Archiwum. W aromacie głównie słodowe, trochę mokrego zboża. Piwo barwy złotej, piana niska. W smaku zaskakująco pełne, słodowe. Goryczki w zasadzie brak, jednak dobry ugaszacz pragnienia.

Comes out very thin yellow, like a real beer that’s been filtered too much. Has a thin head that leaves a suspect lacing. Tastes like beer poured on a corn chip with a minor hop bite. Nothing usual if you like cheap beer.
Can. Locally made in Russia by Heineken Breweries. Pale amber color. Nose is sweet - corn and apricots. Light-bodied and quite carbonated. Malty in taste. Quite refreshing on a warm day.
09-May-2016-0,33L Flasche. Goldgelb, klar, weisser Schaum.Aroma: Getreide, Metall.Antrunk:Maischig, getreidig.

Clear yellow body with a scarce white head. Somewhat sweet nose with notes of corn, hay and cardboard. Fairly dry taste with a moderate hoppy bitterness on the finish. Medium carbonation and light palate. Decent basic macro lager.
330ml bottle @ Panacea, Shrewsbury. Pours clear gold, white head. Aroma is nondeScript, lightly sweet pale malts. Taste is rather bland, pale malts, grain. A refresher I guess.
It goes great with a curry and it is a little bit of a tradition. However, drinking more than one (and without a curry) just becomes dull.
Grain, malty, pale golden, white head not persistant, taste of grain, quite sweet, light body, medium carbonation...the tiger doesn’t roar this time.

Can. Golden, small and mostly diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty - some corn and sweetish aroma, light metal and really faint hoppyness. Body is light, malty – some corn and lightly sweetish flavor, light metal. Finish is short, malty - some corn and lightly sweetish - sweetish, light - some metal. Watery and sweetish lager with sharp notes of metal - lacks bitterness and character.

Keg at O’Leary’s Changi Airport. Pours golden amber with thin white head. Aroma is of corn and malts. Tastes really malt forward, a little grass and corn. Quite carbonated but refreshing in stuffy airport. Another pale lager!
Aroma not great, chemical twang! :/ smooth taste rolls over the tongue, great beer this drink anytime, with or without food. Sweet flourish.
Aroma is sweet grains, some corn and some hops. Taste is much of the same. A slightly bitter ending.

Canette 500ml. Nez de malt pâle et léger de maïs sucré et de miel avec des notes de houblon floral et des effluves herbeuses. Plutôt mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen. Goût moyennement croustillant de malt pâle avec de très faibles notes de citron lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi d’un léger goût malté herbeux et sucré du genre maïs sucré puis finalement un léger goût amer de houblon floral vient se rajouter au tout. Arrière-goût court aux notes sèches, légèrement amer de houblon floral avec de très faibles notes métalliques. [notes 2005]

Bottle thanks to YH for picking this up for me. I didn’t have the hart to tell him we can get it in Boise. Its’s the thought that counts. Pours out a clear crisp golden topped with a white head. Nose is corn and sweet wet wheat. taste is more of the sweetness a odd metalic note on the end.
Clean gold. Medium head, medium retention. Regular lager. Hay aroma and taste. Light body

Light straw color with average activity. White 2 finger head lasting around 3 minutes with average legs.

Faint aromas and flavors of corn, grains, citrus, herbal spices. More sweet than bitter with an undertone of apples. Strong artificial sugary feel.

Light body with prickly carbonation. Faint and short finish ending with an faint herbal grassy feel.

Overall the Tiger beer is quite bland with a rather unpleasant adjunct taste and nose, while the freshness if relatively good while being overly accessible.
From the Bottle while vacationing in Limerick. Only grabbed this because I needed a Singapore beer rating.

Muy suave y ligera con un toque miel o a algo dulce que no puedo describir pero que a diferencia del resto de lagers industriales consiguió llamar mi atención. Me bebería otra y todo! pero dos ya no...
Can. Clear golden colour, very unstable white head. Aroma grainy, corn, hops. Empty taste, mostly grain. Empty body. Low to moderate bitter aftertaste. Quite low carbonation. Standard euro-lager.
Tiger Beer 5% ABV 실제로 호치민에서 관광객들이 가장 많이 마시는 맥주. 하이네켄 소유의 싱가폴 브루어리에서 만든다. 크리미한 거품이 괜찮은 차분한 페일라거. 살짝 도는 꽃 아로마와 매우 가볍지만 확실히 존재하는 몰티한 바디. 나쁘지않은 맥주. 미지근하지 않은이상 절대로 얼음에 타먹는 것을 추천하진 않는다.
Pours yellow with small top. Nose can feel some malts, grain, piss. Taste is better - some corn, bitterness, metal, flour, malt, a bit earth. Some hops reveal in after. Drinkable.

Cab aboard BA flight from Stockholm Arlanda to London Heathrow. Clear golden liquid with medium egg shell white head. Aroma of grain, light corn, bread, light earth and light metal. Taste is very light sweet and light bitter with notes of grain, bread, light sweet fatty malt, light corn, earth and light noble hops. Light to medium bodied with high carbonation. Run of the mill SE Asian lager. Bit watery.

Denne pilsner har et klart gyldent udseende med et svagt hvidt skum. Øllen har en maltet aroma og smager af traditionel maltet pilsner, men dog lidt vandet med en bitter eftersmag. Medium karbonering.

This is probably my least favorite style. With that being said, this was actually not that bad. This was my first beer on a 2 day plane trip to Indonesia, so was just happy to be out of the airport and sitting down to relax. That made this beer seem better than what it is I’m sure, but was drinkable and had some flavor. It is what it is though, and maybe a slightly higher rating than if I bought this and sampled at home. Either way though, better than most of the pale lagers in America.
Average pils beer, golden color and light taste, light on alcohol as well. Had both can and bottle, not much difference.

The best commercial beer from Singapore

sweet pilsner style, gold color, strong carbonation, not much taste but somehow refreshing. One of the cheapest Malaysia commercial beer.

Popular among local Chinese wedding dinner. Yum Seng!
A slightly metallic malt aroma, pours a clear golden color not much head and light carbonation tastes somewhat flat with note of grass, nuts and malt. A light body with a metallic malt finish.
more flavour than the average yellow-water-with-bubbles, but not an especially great flavour. sweetness to the fore, slight biscuit taste, lightly cardboard finish
Pale yellow color with small head. Aroma is not much, standard lager. Taste has some extra spices and maltiness. Easy drinking, nothing wrong with it really, but just boring.
On tap at Shady Palms, Stones Corner. A fairly standard lager, easy drinking. Hints of caramel distinguish it a bit from its European cousins.

Pours clear pale golden. Fairly malty, some paper. An OK lager. Low bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sweet grainy malt with grassy notes, fairly classic macro-lager. Pairs ok with seafood curry and other Singaporean dishes.
A pleasant Singaporese lager. Nothing much to say, it has everything you’d expect from a lager.

Bottle at home. Pale yellow golden coloured pour with a fading white head. Aroma is corn, adjunct, leafy hop, slight honey. Flavour is composed of light semi sweet grains, some sweet corn, hint of apple , adjunct. Palate is light, highish carbonation, carbonic acid bite. Pretty boring industrial lager.
Tasting bij Maakun. Kauwgomballenwater met slootluchtje. Avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid avoid! Backlog from 2015/09/08.
Flaske. Farven er gylden gul med hvidt skum, aromaen er lys malt og en smule humle. Smagen er ligeså. Den er en gennemsnitlig øl.

0.5 can from K-Supermarket Ruoholahti, Helsinki. Pale clear colour with buttles and nice head. This is a thirst quencher and nothing else. I didn’t expect nothing else. Taste is quite sweet. Does not matter after you’ve had too much spicy food in a jungle heat. In any other environment you should forget this.

Barwa jasnozłota, klarowne. Biała piana, niezbyt obfita, dość szybko znika. W aromacie słodowość, zbożowość, generalnie coś tam się dzieje. W smaku nijaka słodowość, dość niska treść, goryczka niska, delikatnie w kierunku średniej, wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, całkiem niezła pijalność. Typowy wodnisty lager na ugaszenie pragnienia, wodnisty, chociaż da się jakoś wypić. Nie oferuje większych doznań.

Better than I expected. I drank this room temperature and slightly shaken up. But still, decent lager. Slightly skunky and/or funky, which is always a touch to make your lager stick out. Otherwise, your basic mild sweetness all around

12 Oz bottle poured as part of my "why not?" series. Clear golden pour with a thin oily head. Grassy aroma, grain and soft hop. More flavor than expected. Grassy, but a lot of sweetness as well. None offensive pale lager here. Tick was cool. The cap was cooler.

Look; light pearl white smooth top, pale hay golden body. 
Aroma; pale malts, sweet grains, hay n cardboard. 
Taste; pale malts, cardboard mashed in pale caramel water 
 - leading to a sweet
finish.
Standard macro on palate.
Overall; easy to drink, too much paper. 
[33cl brown btl, abv4.6%, BB.27.MAY.2016, b@Eurospar Tomasjord - Pivoteka #1]
Bottle. Crisp basic lager. Almost no nose, golden colour, medium head, medium bitterness, and crisp tangy finish on the tongue. Not winning any awards with me.
Pours a clear golden body with a thin head. Typical lager aroma. Taste without any big surprise, light hops and a malty body.

Niet teveel woorden gebruiken voor pils van de tap, terwijl je er genietend van slurpt op een dakterras van de 29ste verdieping van je hotel in Singapore. Wat zoetbitter, het uitzicht was iig met gemak beter. Rating alleen te vergelijken met pils.

Bottle. Gold with an inch of white head. Aroma is grainy with some boiled fruit, grass, some flowers. Light bodied. Taste is sweet and a bit muddled with those odd fruit notes and grain where you’d hope for clean hay or a little bread. But there is decent bitterness. Had this many times in various parts of Asia last century, but it no longer tastes like holidays.
Bottle 640 ml. Now one from Singapore. It’s all basically the same and 640 ml is too much for such a poor beer.

From bottle on board Fridtjofen 14.11.15. Clear pale straw colour. Bright white, quickly disappearing, head. Slightly sweet aroma of fresh grass, hops and succade. Refreshing taste, with grass and moderate bitterness that lingers on for a bit. Good drinkability and no off-tastes.. A bit waterish.
Shared 16 oz. can. Pale straw, clear, with small white head which rapidly dissipated. Not much aroma and weak tasting.

Aroma: very faintly skunky; Appearance: pale golden, clear, minimal head; Taste: sweet, slightly better than Miller Lite, watery; Palate: light, thin, little carbonation, slightly skunky finish; Overall: good only for drinking after working outside on a hot day
Fairly bland tasting pale macro lager, washes down Asian food, but no real appeal .

* Bottle. Pours pale golden, clear, with white head. 
* Aroma is medium sweet malt, straw & pineapple. 
* Palate is light body, medium carbonation, very fine bubbles. 
* Taste is sweet malt, corn & straw. 
* Finish is moist & refreshing. 
* Overall sweet malt, corn & straw.
Bottle at a local Indian restaurant. Pours clear golden colour with a white head. Not much of an aroma. Taste of light hops and malts. Average.
0,33l Flasche. Typischer etwas fader Lagerbier Duft. Goldgelbe farbe, wenig Schaum. Geschmack auch fade.

From a 12oz bottle into a Deschutes stem glass. Pours gold with head and lace. Aroma of rich grains, light malt, floral hops, minerals, slight butterscotch. Medium carbonation and mouthfee. Flavors of grains, light malt, minerals, light straw hops. Overall light, refreshing, a tad biscuity but easy drinking for a near water beer!

33 cl bottle. 4,6% ABV. This one seems to be brewed in Singapore. Beeing a multi-million-gallon lager, expectations is kind of low. Light, Clear, yellowish golden, thin head for a second, then only at the rim. Faint aroma of citrus and adjuncts. Nice bitter sting at first, then leaving room for a light grassy aftertaste. Thin, but far from the worst pale lagers I’ve tasted.

Bottle and draft in Singapore. Pale yellow macro suds. Mild and inoffensive other than the offense of bland flavorlessness. Fine for washing out the acrid burning sensation from haze pollution in your throat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Kolor słomkowy, ciemnawy. Aromat zaskoczył, słodowy, lekko chmielowy. W smaku lekkie i słodkawe.
Bottle at restaurant. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, toast, biscuit and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, toast, malts and grass. Bulk lager.
This beer finish is dry, medium fullness and so I think that it has a slightly salty taste. It is fine for festive occasions or just as a thirst quencher.

On tap in SE Asia I gotta say this ain’t the worst lager in the region. Sweet and certainly adjunct laden, but fuller body and probably minuscule more hoppy than your standard Asian lager makes this passable in the heat. Not a huge fan, but could be worse.
Bottle. Golden color. Smells like sweet malt, grain and rice-ish. Taste of bitter grain and some malt. Just a simple asian lager.
Bottle at Raj in Bristol. Poured clear light yellow with white head. Aroma sweet malt. Light carb med bod. Light sweet fruity taste.
Een pils dat qua geur mouterig aandoet. In de smaak is duidelijk hop en mout te herkennen. Redelijk zoet, maar wel fris.

Bottle from Chinese supermarket, shared. Clear light golden with white head. Chewing gum, skunky, honey, lots of grains, sugary. Taste is sweet. Almost medium bodied with under medium carbonation. Very sweet and not good at all.
Malty bit sweet but soft aroma. Clear colour, little white head. Lots of car onation. Not much taste. Wstery, malty a bit sweet, almost no bitterness. Tickling watery aftertaste.

Basically water. 
Almost no aroma. Bitterness very low. 
Rather frothy palate.
Meh.
Big bomber. Poured a hazy golden color. Aroma was faint hay and malt. Flavor was very light. Over all I think the cool-looking bottle is probably the best part.
12oz bottle pours a clear pale golden with a medium off-white head. Sweet malt and grain aroma. Taste of grain malt and dirt, lightly bitter.

.33l bottle from Supermarket Lutakko. Pours clear golden with low head. Aroma is malts, some citrus and hay. Flavor is mostly same. Boring as ffffuuuu----

Bulklager, nothing more.
Lys lager med tett, hvitt skum. Lukter strå og brøddeig. Tydelig maltkarakter i smaken. Avslutter med en markant bitterhet.

APPEARANCE- golden blond - almost clear. white head.
NOSE- nothing.
FLAVOR- pretty poor lager.
NOTES- not too flavorful. When i was in Singapore drinking this down, it was pretty delish!
Flaska motala stadsfest. Klar orange vätska. Fuktig doft med lite äpple. Söt och lätt brödig smak med halm.
Bottle from systembolaget. A birght, macro south east asian lager, taste like the rest of them

Bottled. 
Yellow coloured with no hard.
 Aroma no. 
Thin watery flavour . No aftertaste. 
One of the most tasteless beers I’ve had.
