Clear yellow color with thin foam head. The smell is mostly ignorable. The taste little malty, little bitter and massively carbonated. This beer works fine when it’s cold and fresh. Otherwise it’s not special.
Meh, what can I say, it’ll do to refresh the mouth after a curry but that’s about it.
640ml bottle, drank at home. Very pale lager with slight head. Not much on the aroma front. Or taste. Slightly yeasty, but refreshing. Perfect accompaniment to crisps or nuts.
Quite decent pale lager, a best seller in Asia. Good golden pour, plain aroma as all lagers, a bit hoppy, refreshing. Perfect in the hot weather.

Golden, thick white froth, not very persistent. 
Refreshing, a little sweet, a little tannic. 
Nothing special, but nice and refreshing.

Puszka 0,3l. CIężko napisać cokolwiek pozytywnego i cokolwiek w ogóle. Płyn niemal pozbawiony smaku i aromatu, nieco kwaskowości w zapachu, typowej dla korpolagerów. Ledwo wyczuwalna słodowość w smaku. Kolor odpowiedni dla pale lagerów. Wodniste, nawet bez wyczuwalnego alkoholu.
Pint can from happy village. Extremely thin. Lots of carbonation. Smells pretty terrible, urine. Rice? Thin in the mouth. No real flavor. I would hesitate to drink it when it isn’t ice cold.

Clear yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is fairly skunky. Taste is grassy and a touch bitter and sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Saigon Green, Berlin 18/6-15. Sweet malty with medium body. Dry and malty finish.
Aroma: alcohol, metallic. Appearance: pale, clear, white foam, minimal head. Taste: medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: oily feel, thin feel, average carbonation, light bitter finish.
Bottle at thai restaurant. Clear golden with white head. Grain and a little yeast. Semi dry with low bitterness and medium carbonation.

"Pale Lager" is all you need to know really. Pours yellow and fizzy, not much in the way of head. Aroma is corn and grain with pale malt, not too bad as far as this type of thing goes. No complexity in flavour but it serves it’s purpose and is quite drinkable on a warm sunny day, especially from the fridge.
Had a few of these with my Chinese food at Yangtze. For what it is not bad, no bad aftertastes goes down well with spicy food.
Basically a bud or miller with a tiny bit more hops and orange flavoring. Award winning for something standard and mass produced I guess. Bottle in London
Beer with light color, good taste, lightly bitter, average carbonation, served in bottle.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with white foam. Aroma has yeast and hoppy notes. Taste is a bit sweet and metallic, not complex at all, some malts and hops, gentle bitterness, watery. Boring but thirst quenching.

Malaysia Version.
Aroma: Medium-light grainy-sweet, light sweet corn. Light floral hops.
Appearance: Brilliant, light gold. Medium white head, fair retention.
Flavour: Medium-light sweetness, grainy. Light bitterness. Dry finish with light lingering bitterness. Crisp
Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium-high carbonation. Light carbonic sting.
Overall: Crisp and refreshing.

330 ml can, poured. Thanks Andre
1C. Premium American Lager
A dull, uninspired beer which tastes alright and is best suited to washing down a meal.

Niewiele da się o tym piwie napisać, poza tym, że jest nijakie. I na szczęście dla niego - w swojej nijakości nie jest wadliwe ;) Złote, klarowne, ze sporą, białą pianą. Aromat słodowy, delikatny. W smaku wodniste, lekko słodowe. I tyle...

The beer has a simple pale lager appearance, with a nice clear golden color and perfect clarity. On top a lot of rough white foam is formed. Foam retention ain’t bad, but after a while most foam has collapsed.
The smell is also simple. Nice malty base, giving rather sweet aromas. and on top a more bitter hop touch. The beer is a bit sweeter than most pale alters. Not bad, but definitely not special.
The same goes for the taste. It is bitter and a little bit sweet. It has a little bit more taste than most pilsners. Nice basic malts and a nice bitter hop twist. There is also a nice fruity twist. Not bad.
The palate is good. Medium light body, rather smooth and a nice high carbonation. The finish is nice. Nice fruity hop bitterness is there. Not bad.
Koncernowy lager. Nieważne czy z polskiego borwaru czy z tajlandzkiego - gwarantują stałą niską jakość.
330ml bottle. Pours pale golden with a medium head. Typical industrial nose, boring. Slightly sweet taste, but almost no noticable hops.
Puszka 0,33l Kolor jasny, słomkowy, piana drobna szybko znika. Aromat słodka trawa. Smak wodnisty, piwo bez wyrazu

Bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma of sweet grain, some bread, straw and grassy, floral hops. Taste of grain, straw and grassy hops. Light bodied and a moderate carbonation. A sweet grainy finish but an unpleasant plastic taste in the aftertaste. Nothing special about this lager, unpleasant aftertaste.
Canned, 330 ml from Lidl, Zagreb. Clear golden with small white head. Sweetish and grainy, bit metallic. Light bodied. Bland.

Can in a BA airplane 150415.
Typical light amber lager with nice head. 
Not much taste but easily drunk. Don't understand it's reputation, but it's probably better when in the Tropics. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Some beers have special places and memories so criticism has no place. I’m sitting in Maxwell Road food centre in Singapore with a mug full of ice and a long neck of Tiger. It’s hot, the beer is cold. I do this every time I’m in Singapore. Get some chicken rice and drink beer with ice. I love it. So will you.
Can. Weak aroma of sweet malt and diacetyl. Taste is dry, light bitter, flavor of diacetyl, malt, corn. Like flavored water.

Soft pale lager without ant i teresting point to tell.
Much like a soda than a beer...
Flaska från SEN Street Kitchen Örebro. Klar gyllengul med vit skumkrona. Söt maltig doft. Söt lätt kropp. Smak av söt limpa och ljus malt. Svag efterbeska. Funkar ok till stark asiatisk mat.
Bottle from b&m, Team Valley, Gateshead. Very pale straw coloured with a sweet malty, toffee and sugary corn flavour followed by a slight grassy, smooth thin finish.
For a mass-produced later, this is pretty nice. A great selection for the summer or spicy food.

Puszka 330ml z Lidla. Po przelaniu do szkła tworzy się drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa piana, szybko zanikająca do obrączki. Barwa złota, klarowna. Aromat typowy dla komercyjnego euro lagera - słodowy, lekko słodki, trawiasto-łodygowy. W smaku dokładnie to samo - słodowość, lekki karmel i biszkopty, piwo bardzo wodniste, praktycznie bez goryczki...
NOt too bad beer for a hot day if well chilled. Light golden color, balanced aroma and a fresh hoppy (yet a little watery) taste.

large frothy fizzy White head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. sparkling thin clear yellow body. aroma: light bread, moderate yeasty. if: light bitter very light sweet and salty. ff: light bitter plus salty hints; average duration. palate: metallic finish, light médium body, watery/oily texture and lively carbonation. pao liquido com toque salgado surgindo como diferencial. sem defeitos. 4s
Draft. Pours clear gold with a fizzy white head. Tastes like sweet malt, some musky corn, cereal. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet corn, musky malt, and maybe a light citrus.

Bottle. Pale body, medium tall stable head. Weak aroma with metallic notes. Taste has aluminium and some sweet grass. Not pleasant. Semi-metallic finish. Well, it’s a new country tick for me but from the perspective of a non-beer nerd I don’t see why such a poor beer should be imported from 9000 kilometers away across the globe (the label claims it’s brewed and bottled in Singapore, not contract brewed like many other Asian lagers). Utter waste of resources - we already have plenty of similar swill here.

Bottle from Masuyo’s. Not much aroma to speak of outside of a hint of grain. Tastes grainy with a slight metallic flavor. Good carbonation. Light and refreshing. Paired good with curry I guess. Sweet on the palate.

0,33L bottle (as Tiger Lager Beer from Stockmann, Tallinn). Pours clear golden with white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, sour, grains, malt, and some alcohol. Flavor is very sweet, grains, malt, metallic, and hint of alcohol. Body is watery. Overall: I have had worse and it’s a Singapore tick!
Decent beer. $3.00 pint special, so worth the price.....................................

11.2 ounce bottle. (A side note: could probably drop the bottle from an airplane and it wouldn’t be damaged the glass is so thick) Pours typical straw yellow with slight head as found at your typical neighborhood bar. Minimal nose, slight bitter. Minimal taste. Possible rice or corn in there. Not great, but would be my "getting drunk beer" if I lived in Singapore.
Bottle. Dark clear gold with a little white head. Aroma is green apple, caramel and lager yeast. Taste follows. Very sweet. Medium spritzy mouthfeel. Not good.

Piana: biała, średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko zanikająca.
Kolor: złoto, klarowne.
Aromat: słodowy, trawa.
Smak: słodowy, wodnisty, goryczka brak.

Schöne, goldene Farbe, dicke Perlen, Schaum bricht gleich weg. Riecht wie ein typisches Lager, immerhin. Wieder im Trunk so ein kurzer "Vorgeschmack", bevor es bitter wird - Heu? Irgendsowas. Weiß noch nicht, ob mir das gefällt.

Aroma: hay, caramel, bread. Appearance: clear golden liquid with white foam which dissapears fast. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: light body, creamy feel, average carbonation, long bitter finish.
Pours clear golden with medium white head, dissappears quickly. Aroma is yeasty, malty, some cow shit. Taste is malty, paper, bitter finish.Light body. Not bad for a pale lager. Medium carbonisation.

Kolor - złocisty, klarowny. 
Piana - drobniutka, średnio wysoka, średnio trwała. 
Zapach - słodowy z lekkim chmielem. 
Smak - wyraźny słodowy, lekki chmiel i słodycz, lekki kwasek, delikatna goryczka. Tylko do gaszenia pragnienia.

500 ml and 330 ml cans (with revision from May 2015 can). 
Fizzy yellow-gold beer with a large sudsy head. 
Medium body seems heavy for style despite high carbonation. Earthy hops. 
Adjunct grain? ... grainy (and not just regular malts) flavor.  Similar to Heineken Light?

330ml can (in China ... I think brewed locally in Sanya. 11.5°, 4.5%). Ok pour. golden yellow color .. a touch darker than your normal cheap lager. Not much head. Light nose, has the basic lager smell. Flavor is limited. Nothing bad, just not much there. Some sweetness, grain, nuts, some lingering bitterness. Okay on the palate. Even though a bit flat, feels fresh and sparkly in the mouth, with residual flavor/bitterness on the cheeks and tongue. I’ve had this on draft, seemed a bit better then. The beer is drinkable, but not much going on with it.

Bewertung importiert von bier index: 
 7	/	6	/	6	/	6	/	5	/	4	/	4	/	7	/	63

330cc Canned. 5. head is thin and weak. Color is clear and golden. Grassy aroma. 
Light body. The flavour has a low bitterness and metallic taste. Finish is malt and a hint of frutiness. There is no crispness which is supposed to be in Lager. One of the most boring Lager I ever had.
Can. Pours pale straw with small white head. Aroma of corn and green apple. Sweet taste, a bit bready or grainy.

Nicer lager than most default choice if out for a chinese/Thai meal at 5% its around the ideal strength for a lager for my tastes but suffers the same fate as most lagers as in its just not special best enjoyedbice cold in a frosted glass
12oz bottle. Pale straw color. No flavor at all of any kind at all in any way. Is that 75 characters?

Piana drobna, biała, obfita. Opada powoli, ozdabiając szkło. 
Kolor jasnego złota. Klarowne. 
W aromacie nuty słodowe plus lekki chmiel. 
Typowy lager. Choć pachnie mniej intensywnie niż nasze. 
Po zapachu dość lekkie piwo. 
W smaku lekkie, ale nie wodniste. Głownie nuty słodowe. Ale tez wyczuwalny chmiel. 
Nie jest szlachetny, ale przyjemnie smakuje. 
Nie jest w smaku aż tak lekkie jak sugeruje kolor. 
Jak na koncernowego lagera dość przyjemne.

Copenhagen 1/2 2015. 33 cl bottle from Netto. Pours clear yellow with white head - quickly subsiding. Very faint aroma. A little malts and a little sourness. Medium carbonation. Taste is sweet and bready and a little sourness in the after taste. Not as dangerous as the cat.
Bottle from Exotic World, Leuven. Very pale colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Sweet malty. Also hints of corn and cardboard. Very artificial. Disgusting beer.

50cl pint at Loca in Dubai. Advertised as Super Cold. Joy. Pours a fizzy, clear gold with some fading white head. Nose has not much too it, pissy, dried grass, stale malt, skunky. Flavor follows, rotting lemon rinds, white flour, trash. Watery finish.

bottle 330 mL. pours clear yellow color with white head, aroma r mostly malts and hops... taste is quite watery, slight malty taste, hops and some metallic aftertaste, barely better than most macros lagers.
Can at Chulia Mansion, Georgetown, Malaysia. Pours clear light golden with no head. Light malty aroma. Taste is malty, slightly hoppy. Quite watery.
Can. Straight out of the can. O.K Thai lager some hints of hops some grains some sweetness some hints of taste. Nice on a beach in Thailand. Saccharine aftertaste.
Can at sats lounge, singapore airport. Clear golden color, white head. Sweet malty body, some hints of hops. Basic lager.
Clear yellow, carbonated with a small head. Aroma of malt and a little bit of barley. Bland, typical of the style - refreshing.
Clear golden copper color with medium to small head head. Aroma is malt, some hay. Flavor is malt, sweet, not that great after taste.
A light yellow pilsner with white head. Aroma is light malty, hoppy, fruity. Taste is light bitter sweet. Pearly.
The ol post mahi bev, lingers on the pallet with a dancing mettalic nature. Somewhat sessionable but not your impress-your-father-in-law sunday roast dozen.

Blonde un peu pâle, claire. Bonne mousse, disparait vite.
Au nez vraiment bof, conventionnel avec un poil d’houblonnage épicé.
Pareil en bouche, plutôt sucrée et ensuite sèche avec un peu d’amertume.
Pours golden yellow with no head. Little aroma, very little taste to speak of. Not unpleasant, just not memorable

Bottle. Pours light yellow color whith medium white head which fall really fast. Has a classic smell of commercial lager: some metallic, grassy and grainy notes. In flavor, hmmm, there is maybe more character and fullness than other commercial examples of style. Overall: just microscopic better than other macrobrews. But still pretty much the same.
How: Bottle Apperance: Clear yellow. Aroma: floral, citrus Palate: thin body, medium carbonation

Typical international lager. Weak aroma with some citrus. Light gold color with high carbonation and extremly quickly disappearing head. Good when you’re very thirsty during hot day. Not a perfect beer but resembles great moments during holiday in Singapore :)
Een pilsbier dat heel goudblond eruitziet als je het inschenkt en goed ruikt. Maar er is niet veel smaak aan.
Clear golden, huge frothy white head. Grainy, grassy, malty, lagery aroma and flavour. Some sweetness and low bitterness. Pretty anonymous.
Average Lager. Clear and golden color. Minimal head. Few flavor, thin body. Nothing special, but drinkable.
How: Bottle Apperance: Clear yellow. Aroma: floral, citrus Palate: thin body, medium carbonation
Lager standard quelconque, buvable. Bue je ne sais plus où dans un restaurant asiatique.

Pours clear and pale, golden, with weak head reduced quickly to a small ring. In aroma mostly malts. In taste light sweet. Light body, thin texture, average to high carbonation. Nothing special, nothing disturbing. It could be nice water replacement in Thailand’s climate.

No head on pour, smell is a little hoppy almost like a pilsner but sweet and light, taste is more similar to a pilsner but not quite as strong, a little bitter but crisp finish, smooth, slightly sweet finish
Bottle. Clear yellow color, nice staying and lacing white head. Floral, grassy nose. Light sweet, bitter taste. Aftertaste is interesting grassy, Malty. Thin texture, flat to medium carbonation.

Can. Typical lager look. Yellow clear poor with a creamy white head on top. Aroma is very skunky and malty. Flavor is moderately sweet and just another typical lager. Decent enough for a lager though and fun country tick.
Its an average beer goes down smooth. non offensive. Its an ok lager. given to me as x mas present from the father in law. Thanks Neil.

Poured from an 11.2 OZ bottle into a "Boulevard" Tulip glass.
Aroma- almost non-existent, barely has a beer odor
Appearance- this is a pale yellow color with a very weak head
Taste- Not how I remember "Tiger" from my military experiences overseas. This brew is extremely weak flavored and has a faint hops flavor
Feel- Highly carbonated, light bodied brew
Overall- a complete disappointment! I have had this overseas many times in the 90’s and when I picked up a sixer of this I was hoping to relive some good times from years back. That is not the case, I am not sure if my palate has changed or the beer doesn’t travel overseas very well when imported. But this beer has a world class bottle cap, very cool.

Clear yellow color, no head. Sweet and malty aroma and taste. Watery, average to even lively carbonation. Some cheap hops. Ae, passable. 
(Lidl 0,33l can)
Singapore’s first locally brewed beer. Its drinkable... Lager. Not a craft beer
Bottle, 640ml. Straw colour with a decent white head. Aroma of musty hops with grass notes. Flavour is sweet with hops and lime. High carbonation. Refreshing and not bad at all.
0,33l can on a Virgin Atlantic flight. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma and flavor are mostly malts. Weak aroma, stronger flavor. Decent.

Bottle at The Crutherland House Hotel. Clear golden body with a thin white head. Lively carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of lemon, shortbread and straw. Flavour of sorrel, herbs and cereal. Thin body with a watery texture. Fizzy. There’s not much to it but it’s one of the least offensive macro Lagers.

33cl can @ home from a local supermarket.
Body is clear pale golden,
Head is very small, white, fizzy, fully diminishing, fair lacing.
Nose is sweet watery,
Aroma is metallic, light malty.
Taste is medium sweet, hint of bitter.
Finish is light watery bittersweet.
Light body, thin texture, average carbonation.
Easy, refreshing, boring.

Sampled on draught in a hotel in Shanghai. Typical lager in appearance, with a pale golden colour and a frothy white head. Malty and slightly floral aroma. The taste is slightly sweet, but quite pleasant, and well-balanced with floral, grassy hops. Much better than many oriental beers, possibly because it has a slightly higher ABV. A good hot-climate thirst quencher.
Bottle from Total Wine, Sacramento. Pours clear golden with a modest white head and a mild floral aroma. There is a watery light malt flavor with little else. Might be refreshing on a hot day.

Whenever you visit Thailand (or South-East Asia), you won’t escape the typical Tiger logo. And having a Tiger at 33°C and a humidity above 90%, you will love this beer. Not only becoause it’s served at nerly 0°C, but also because it’s a refreshing beer. Sure, it’s an "please everybody" beer, but that makes it pleasant to drink. The hops are there, but discrete, you can detect a light malty body and the carbonation is well balanced. This beer got several gold medals and there is nothing wrong with it. But don’t look for a beer with character or complex taste - you will be dissapointed!
Golden lager steady tight head. Aroma fairly sweet, taste is quite sweet with mild bitter balance. Tasty and refreshing.
Can, British Airways flight Arlanda Heathrow. A bit too carbonated and hoppy.
a light citrus aroma, appear pale without any head. taste light bitter. lively carbonation, light bodied, without any aftertaste.

Can 0.33l.
Appearance: Clear sunflower yellow liquid with a small white head. 
Aroma: cereals,corn , light skunky
Taste: low bitterness, alcohol, cereals, sweet, corn, a bit artificial, faint hops in the finish.
Thin body, slightly below average carbonation.
Draft. Clear dark yellow, sweet corn aroma. Light and smooth taste with a buttery creamy mouthfeel. Low prickly carb with honey on the finish. Clean and dry. Decent for a light lager. I’ve had worse.
Clear golden color, average sized white head. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Aroma of malt and something like rice. Medium sweet taste, no bitterness. Lame pale lager.

Have drank this various times in the UK and Thailand, but am only rating it after finding an almost out-of-date can here in Moscow. Appearance - very pale (piss) yellow with no head. Aroma of rice. Taste is corn and grain. Blah. Before this I drank Aventinus Weizen-Eisbock. :-)
Yellow color with tin head. Light carbonation. Watery taste of grain. Not good.

Bottle @ home. Giallo dorato, limpida con schiuma beige fine ma di scarissima persistenza. malto, cereali, e miele all’aroma. Gusto maltato, stucchevole.tra il miele ed il caramello. poco corposa appiccicosa, abbastanza equilibrata tipica lager industriale.

Can 0.33l. Clear sunflower yellow liquid, small white head. Light body and carbonation. Sweet and alcoholy taste, bitter alcohol finish. Aroma of ground corn for chickens with something artificial and rotten. Pretty bad.

Its cause wasn’t helped by being served up to me in a can on a British Airways flight from Dubrovnik, bog standard Heineken being the only alternative. What do I say? Skunky? Grainy? Thin? Typical industrial product that has thirst quenching properties but little else to commend it. I should have gone for the cheap red wine.
Tasted this beer multiple times in Malaysia. Excellent lager beer, noting special but goes well with some Asian food!

Can from The Garnet. Quickly dissipating to nothing on the head over a transparent straw body with medium effervescence. Some cereal on the nose and not much else. Some hop presence on the nose with some subtle skunkyness. Quite unpleasent.
Wow, dit is pas een pils zeg. Mooi etiket op de fles, mooi gouden kleur en weinig smaak. Drinkt heel makkelijk, zo niet TE makkelijk weg.
750ml bottle, standard macro lager pours pale gold with brief frothy head, aroma is mild malty grainy, taste is crisp slightly bitter bland finishes dryish quite sweet

light golden. clear, medium white foam; weak malty aroma; light(+) bitterness, very lightly sweet; light(+) body, thin but not watery feel, average carbonation, moderately long bitter and slightly metallic finish;
Overall: not bad, not good, drinkable when cold

"i’d be curious to see what awards it’s won, as the label brags, but that’s for another time. had it with thai food, and it went with our spicy food well enough. smelled and tastes somewhere between Budweiser and a micro lager. liked it ok at first, by the end it was a little too bitter/pee beer smelling. overall, about what i expected."

330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
A: Very clear and light yellow color. Most probably the lighter yellow I’ve seen. One finger white and fluffy head which dissipates quickly leaving a few bubbles around the glass
S: Extremely simple. Malts and cereals, basically. Not much hops in the nose, a pity
T: Pretty much like the smell. Very light and malty. Very light "hoppy" end
M: Very light body with a reasonable carbonation
D: Not bad. Extremely watery beer, should come with a bit more hops
[ BA Review @ 6/27/2010 ]
Average lager. Golden color , medium head. Malty aroma with hay notes. Malty taste with moderate bitterness. It’s hard to write down more about beers like this.
Está mala. No hay más que decir. La compré en el Lidl para hacer la gracia y nunca mais.
Disappointing lager with lots of unclean hops, cheap malts, and a tartness in the finish that is less than pleasant.
Clear golden colour medium white head, malty sweet some honey like smell, medium carbonation low bitter sweet corn some malts refreshing notting more
0,33 L can. Pours gold with a white head. Aroma is light sweet malt with some fruit notes. Taste is rather bland with malt and some hop bitterness to finish, a bit thin and watery. Nothing special.

Can
Aroma-floral, artificial flavor
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, thin feel, lively, abrupt finish
Overall-poor

Pale golden golor with medium white head. Aroma is corny and sugary, with sweet malts, cardboard and a slightly hoppy presence. Light body with medium carbonation. Taste is corny, cerealy, with sweet malts, but a bit watery. Soft aftertaste.
330ml bottle at some sushi joint. Pale blonde with a frothy white head. Flavors are corn, sugar, honey and cardboard. Light body, fizzy carbonation, smooth texture.
Kupljeno u lidla ...neznam zasto nema vise ocijena ...ali ovo je to pivo ???... malo gorkasto ...zanimljivo sta sam ga uspio naci u hrvatskoj ..

A: creamy head/ clear piss
S: NONE
T: simple malt/ metallic
Body: slick/ thin

bad mass produced beer...

Can 0,33 l, Lidl, Zielona Góra, Poland.
Jasnozłote piwo o cienkiej, szybko znikającej pianie i sztucznym, słodowym zapachu. W smaku słodowe, lekko ryżowe (w składzie nie ma ryżu ale jest cukier trzcinowy - może to on sprawia takie wrażenie) z łagodną goryczką na finiszu.
Can. Light yellow color with small white head. Weak malty aroma with some sulphury tones. Winous flavor. Thin body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Subtle bitterness.
Can. Aroma pineapple, honeyish malt, very light hops. Clear yellow colour. Taste is watery, metallic, very light pineapple, stale hops. Drinkable but poor nonetheless.
Wygląd: Ładna szybkoopadająca piana. Aromat silnie utlenione, mokry karton. Smak: lekko słodowe z wadami. Im dalej tym gorzej pijalne.
Somewhat fuller and maltier/sweeter than other commecial type lagers this isn’t unpleasant but I can imagine that it might get cloying on a session. Easy drinking though, and enjoyable.

light yellow clear
low-medium bitterness 
foam drops down quickly
probably the worst of Lidl asia package (sapporo kingfisher chang Tsingtao)

Pours a pale straw with one finger of loose white head diminishing rapidly to nothing, no lacing. Nose is typical adjunct lager, pale malt rice, corn, maybe a little apple. Taste follows suit, with very faint hops on the finish. Light body, moderate sustained carbonation, and a fairly abrupt dry finish.

Well, I’ve had worse - a lot worse. (I’m looking at you, PBR!) But to be honest, after an afternoon digging holes in the back yard and filling them back in, it does the job. Aside from crappy adjuncts, there are no off flavours, and the finish is actually not unpleasant.
On tap. Golden color with one finger head. Slightly grassy aroma. Grassy, almost ricey taste. Alright.
Bardzo jasny kolor. Nie do końca klarowne, bardzo małe drobiny unoszą się w piwie. Smak wadliwy, chemiczny, zapach podobnie.
Bottle. Aromat piwnicy, chemiczne spory. Kolor i piana bardzo dobre. W smaku gorzej, czuć wady straszne i ciężko pic.
330 can from a supermarket in Xiamen on 7 Sep 2014. Pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of funky cardboard and vanilla. Sweet finish.

Aroma: malty, some strange herbal notes, rice.
Appearance: clear straw color, white head.
Taste: low bitterness, alcohol, sweet, corn, artificial and pharmaceutical notes.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, pharmaceutical aftertaste.
Overall: Ugly beer.
Pale yellow color, white thin head. Aromas of grains, some sweet maltiness. Same taste, with nice aftertaste. Light to medium body with medium carbonation.
Little to note in truth. An OK lager, but nothing to distinguish it from a million others.

Ein kompakter weisser Schaum sitzt auf dem goldgelben klaren Bier. Ein milder Duft steigt in die Nase. Der erste Schluck verspricht zwar grosses, doch bleiben die Erwartungen unerfüllt. Was sich grossmundig ankündigt fliesst leicht bitter die Kehle hinunter. Was jedoch hervosticht sind die feinen Aromen, ganz hinten im Gaumen, das dem Bier zu einer guten Punktzahl verhilft!

Classic, heavily exported Asian lager, popular in Indian restaurants and the like. Cream white, not very stable head, golden blonde colour, cristal clear. Simple malt sweetness, some rice, vague floral hops in the finish. Bland like most standard lagers but quenches the thirst after a spicy Asian meal.

Aroma: spicy, hay; Appearance: clear urine, minimal head; Taste: medium sweetness, slight sourness, slight bitterness; Palate: abrupt finish, slick texture, average carbonation, medium body 

Just a lager- nice maltiness though.
Pale golden color with small white disappearing head. Malty aroma. Sweat taste with almost no bitterness. It’s drinkable, but nothing special.

Singapore tick pours like @singaporeair first class closed suite. LOL j/k. Out of the shiny 16 oz can. minimal nose, you really have to dig hard to get the wet sloppy grains in yer nostrils. taste also is basically nothing, some mile sweetness, grain. pretty much balanced in terms of sweetness, finish lingers with wet slope grains. light to medium body.
Grandes recuerdos de viaje por el sudeste asiático en cada sorbo. Una lager de supermercado decentilla. Muy fácil de beber, como agua, vamos.
Golden colour, white top. A slight taste of malts but otherwise a very light, almost watery taste.

blikje 33cl, ziet er leuk uit, heeft vast veel te verbloemen op eerste indruk.

schenkt helder gouden met volle witte kraag.

aroma is pilsmoutig en komt best redelijk over

smaken zijn initiëel glad en zacht, maar dan komen de metalige en vooral medicinale tonen naar boven welke ook doorwerken in de afdronk.

conclusie ronduit smerig ! bah !
Helder geel bier met schuim. Smaak is hoppig bitter en niet zoet. Heeft een goede smaak zonder verdere bijsmaak die vaak wel aanwezig is. Uitstekend bier.

Goudgeel helder met weinig schuim. Aroma heeft wat zoetigs. Smaak is zoals pils, niet bijzonder.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pale yellow with small white foamy head that dissipates quickly, sweetish doughy aroma, low carbonation, slightly bitter yeast flavored sweetish taste, abrupt finish. Generic and uninteresting lager.

Can 0,33ltr: Golden colored clear brew with an tingle on the tongue and almost no bitter taste, but very refreshing beer will works well in a tropical environment and ofcourse with an hot South-East Asia meal.
Bottle 33 cl. Clear golden colour, white foam. Malt aroma with light spices. Similar taste: malt, fruits, lightly sour, light body. Refreshing drink for summer.

Can: Served in a taster:
Medium to smaller sized white head on top of a clear yellow colored beer.
Aromas of pilsmalts, green herbs, grass, grains, hay, some oat, green branches and light fruity.
Flavour is herbal, glue, grass, light fruity, bitter, some green grass and green branches, green leaves and green malts...
Aftertaste is hay, grains, herbs, bitters and lots of green tones.
Low carbo, low to medium bodied and a light creamy mouthfeel and texture.

Bottle, pours gold with a white head, aroma is light sweet malt with some fruit notes, taste is rather bland with malt and some hop bitterness to finish, a bit thin and watery, not sure how this won any awards

Had this many times. tbh im just rating it to get me to 100. dont give a fuckkkkk. its alright tho, i mean its slightly better than most other cheap pale lagers you get. its yellow and has a foamy short lived head. faintly citrus aroma. taste is fairly sweet with a bitter citrus tinny aftertaste
Bottle in a Thai restaurant in Copenhagen, Denmark. Pours pale yellow with thin, short-lived white head. Aroma of malts, some caramel, mostly sweet in the taste. Watery, drinkable.
Citrus and melon. White short lived head. Watery. Ok for a mass produced lager. Nothing special. Not sure why all the awards.

330 ml bottle. Pours a clear pale golden colour with a thin, short lived white head. Weak aroma of malt and hops. Sweet flavour of malt, fruit and a hint of caramel with a dry, bitter finish. Light body with a watery texture and soft carbonation.

Had a 120z bottle, from the bottle, at some 5-Spice Asian place in Boca Raton. Not sure of the color or head since I chugged from a bottle. Smelled like rice and corn and the taste was similar. Nothing exciting. Kind of a metallic-alkaline taste. No finish notes. Boring. (My food sucked also.)
Cheap beer if you’re on a budget, 4 bottles for £3.50 at the co-op. Fairly bland, slight bitterness with dirty aftertaste. Ok as a summer quencher but no real satisfaction.
From a 500 ml can. No aroma. Flavor is metallic rice. Below average, even for an Asian macro-lager.

Singapore, check. Another tropical pale lager, check. Almost no aroma, points for it not smelling bad. Appearance, drab and lifeless, golden water. Taste, some malt and grains, very light, no finish or aftertaste. Hot weather thirst quencher, period.
Bottle in the Thai Cafe, Ripon. As expected there is very little to note about this beer. A lager with a hint of sweetness but nothing in the way of character. Drinkable but nothing more.
Pours pale golden,small white head. Aroma is corn,sweet tea. Taste is light,bread,hay,slight hops,quite watery and plain overall. Overall decent amongst the summer supermarket beers.

Bottle pour. Clear golden with white head. Corn and light citrus aroma. Light body. Watery with almost no flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
0,5l can. Citrus and hops. Not much else. Little flavor. Easy to drink. Tiny white head, clear and golden, slightly sour.
Tap. Clear straw. Average. Nasty metallic aroma and flavours. Unpleasant malts.
Pours a light golden color with white head. Cereal grains mostly on the nose without much else; follows onto the palate. Finishes somewhat dirty.
Pale yellow with minimal head. Corn, straw, grain, honey, light grass, some caramel. A hint of hops show up. Pretty sweet. Ive had worse..
Very strong corn, straw, grainy aroma and taste. A little flat, some hops in there. Decent whatever beer, but nothing special.
I like Tiger beer. Not spectacular but does the job. Good on a hot day. Malt, a little yeast and bread. More distinctive than the average Asian lager.
Bottle at 3. Pivní minifest Břeclav, courtesy of Cuso. Country #63. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty, sugary. Taste is malty, caramel, sugary.
Typical lager with no aroma and no bitterness. It’s quite refreshing in south pacific asian countries, when the heat and humidity is killing you.
A standard mass produced lager taste, nothing special. Sampled in Ireland and Singapore, tastes equally bad in both places.

The body has a pale light golden color with very good clarity. Its head is fairly thick, frothy and bright white in color. The head hangs on well as it slowly fades down to just a thin cap and makes some lacing on the glass along the way. Its aroma is light and simple with notes of light grain, hay and grassy hops. The flavor is similar its aroma, not sweet and not too bitter. It has a clean and mellow grainy malt character with just a light grassy hop taste on the finish. The palate is very drinkable with a medium body, smooth wet texture and average carbonation.
A bit malty/corny with a peppery effervescence on the nose. Similar to some Indian beers I’ve had. Not bad

Bottle from Lidl. Extra Pale with Not much head. Not much aroma or taste. Medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 16 oz can into a plastic cup. The aroma is overwhelmingly corn and dry grains with a bit of citrus. It pours a clear, ripe corn-yellow color with a white head. A sparse surface sprinkle of head is retained with a thin ring consisting of random small to medium sized bubbles. This also leaves behind a messy web like lacing. The taste is a medium sweet with a light bitterness at the finish. It’s a slick texture with a fizzy carbonation and a medium body. The taste is primarily warm corn bread with butter and honey. It has a light spiciness (coriander?) and lemon at the finish. A grainy, muffin like character lingers for a short time in the aftertaste.
Wildly overrated simple lager with some notes of yeast and bread. Not exceptional.

Bottle. Clear, yellow. Medium quickly vaporating white head. Aroma has hay, citrus, dust. 

Taste has grain, little citrus. A decent lager.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en Aeon Mall Nagoya Dome Mae en Nagoya, Japon. Color dorado. Sabor a malta, ligeramente dulce. Lager industrial.

Clear pale golden, white head
Cereals, light hops, a hint of metallic
Cereal, gentle hoppy bitterness
Clear yellow appearance, medium head. Malty aroma, low hops. Refreshing pale lager.

Bottle. Unpleasant aroma of light malt covered by a layer of green apples. It redeems itself by way of its taste, sweetish, crisp, light malty with a pleasant bitterness and a light metallic note in the finish. Not bad, not bad for a macrolager indeed.
Bottle. Clear, golden, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, & light body.

Can. Pale yellow pour with a quickly dissipating white head. Sweet grains and light fruit in the aroma, a touch of apple. Flavour is the same, with a light hoppy bite and a lot of carbonation. One of the more refreshing lagers I've tried and not bad, but there is no real character here.

Probably like everyone else, I bought it due to the tiger. For shame. I wasn’t expecting much after I got past that cool label, so it didn’t surprise me it tasted like it did. Metallic bread, with corn and water. No body to be found. I always wonder if brewers just make up their own awards to put on the bottle, as this one is world acclaimed, perhaps it is not of this world.
Bottle. Clear yellow pour, fizzy white head. Cheap malt, corn, vegetable, and a bit metallic. Not good.

The appearance in the bottle is AWESOME and considering the labelling is part of a subconscious draw towards any beer I had to take this into account for my scoring. Tigers are fucking bad-ass. This beer however, is for pussies, not hybrid tiger-men looking to sate their desires. Sweetish vegetables, bread and hay with a watery backbone that lets down the few remaining tigers left on earth.

Tiger sieht gut aus hat aber nicht die Krone des Jahres. Einstieg und Geruch sind relativ hopfig und bitter. Ein angenehmer Geschmack für ein Asia Bier - es ist relativ einseitig und eintönig aber das was es hat, ist gut und süffig. Etwas ähnlich zu Heineken. Fazit: Manchmal sind Biere die nur eine Richtung haben einfach nur gut.
Straw yellow color with white foam. Corny flavor. Taste is very sweet for a Lager. Almost no bitterness.

Bottle (330 ml). Clear yellow/golden with a small white head and little lacing. Aroma is of corn and grass along light sweetness and solvent. Taste is also of solvent along corn, grass, light sweetness and a metallic/solvent finish. Light body. Watery. Moderate carbonation. As bad as you can expect when you pick a beer because it’s a country tick.

Bottle. Clear pale yellow pour with thin white head. Aroma is kind of solvanty, honey, dusty hops, light alcohol. Taste is very watery, almost no flavor, ever so subtly honey malt sweetness with a lingering metallic aftertaste. Palate is light and watery.
Bottle from Sainsburys Team Valley. Pours light golden colour - middling head which fades fast. Reasonably crisp, quite refreshing. Not a bad example of a decent mass produced lager

On tap @ DXB. Pours pale golden with medium fizzy white head that fades quickly. Aroma is rich pale malt, with heavy corn notes. Taste is similar - nice lightly toasted pale malt, lots of corn flavor, very little hops to bitter. Finishes with a bit of an off flavor. Still, for a light lager like this, you could do worse.
Golden lager that does not retain a head for long. Flavour is not complex. Slightly sweet and very refreshing. A great warm-weather lager, served cold of course.
Can. Golden color with huge fast-disappearing head. Light aroma of malt. Sweet taste with no hops at all. Great when it's hot weather, but lousy as lager beer.
Bottle with curry from off license; clear straw yellow pour with a frothy white head, grassy aroma, taste has strong malts, sweet caramel, quite refreshing.

Classica lager industriale con aggiunta di sciroppo di glucosio e caramello come colorante. Colore biondo ed schiuma bianca poco persistente. Al naso note molto leggere di caramello e malto. In bocca frizzantezza giusta ma scarica di sapore. Birra per niente amara. Molto dissetante.
Tap in Singapore - an awkward sweetness in the mouth detracts from the taste - which is as neutral as lager gets - I not a lager lover.

Hey, when it’s 95 degrees and you can feel the humidity three inches away from your face, an ice-cold Tiger can be very satisfying. Tiger is not a beer to think about and rate; it’s a pale lager beer to get down in three gulps to cool off your fiery body under the Malaysian sun.

Bottle. Appearance- golden, pure white head, leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma- some corn, cereals, spice hints, slight hoppiness. Taste- a bit creamy, carbonation, some fruit and hops, smooth, quite well balanced. Ok lager.

12oz bottle. Dark yellow beer, small head, plenty carbonated, clear. Nice lagered aroma. Taste is a little less than great, it’s just okay for the style. The beer is well-carbonated & stuff, okay palate. Pretty refreshing, fine with food. Joins the pantheon of uninteresting bland lagers.

Bouteille de 500 ml achetée dans une LCBO de Cornwall. Dégustée le 19 juillet 2005. Bière blonde pâle limpide. Mousse peu, col mince et éphémère. Assez effervescente, grosses bulles. Odeur de céréales et de houblon. Très douce, assez sucrée, amère en finale. Goût de céréales ressort bien. Rafraichissante et assez savoureuse. Par contre un peu mince, manque de complexité.

33cl bottle, UK version brewed by heineken. Industry standard sweet lager. Yellow color (caramel as colouring) with some particles in suspension, big white head, decent lacing. Aroma is grainy, taste is flat a bit sweetish. Anonymous, smooth tho.
Tastes like absolutely nothing for the first half. then thin corn and meh. Distinct quaff ring with droopy U shaped lacing. No nose other than aluminum from can. Wooo!

Can, 50cl. Pours pale light golden, transparent in the glass with a small white head. Grain and malty nose. Light sweet malty taste. Grain and hobs in the middle and finish. Light bodied, soft carbonation, bit watery. Thats about everything to say. Lower-average tier of lagers.

50 cl. dåse. 5,0% Købt i Super Brugsen.
En god lys pilsner som af den lette type som nok er bedst på en varm sommerdag

Poured from a 33cl bottle. Clear medium yellow with a white cap and large bubbles cascading. The smell is light sweet malt, grain, grass. The taste is similar to nose. Fairly sweet ending with just a bit of dryness. Light in body quite fizzy. Better than I remember when I had it about 15 years ago in Singapore but still not very good.

Appearance: Clear golden color with a fine white head. Ok lacing.
Aroma: Plain mild malty and mild hoppy.
Palate: Medium body. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Average carbonation.
Taste: Mild caramel malty, some grassy notes and mild hoppy.
Overall impression: Plain dull lager.
Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden
Bottle supermarket. Amber colour. Aroma is pale malts. Taste is pale malts sweet grain. Medium body prickly carbonated. Ok lager
this is an ok lager not a really strong taste but on a hot day i think it would be good for when you are sitting in the garden needing to cool down
Backlog. Tried it bottled. Just your standard mass-produced lager. Nothing to get excited about.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Belle couleur, mousse aérienne. CO2 modéré, Arômes maltés, finale correcte. Une bonne surprise ;)
hay, alcohol, golden, clear, light sweetness, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body,

Old rating rerated 24.03.2014, 0,33l bottle @ hotel room in Oslo:

Big creamy longlasting head, beer looks like the piss that comes out again when you’ve been drinking beer and lots of water for a while, very diluted. Aroma is slightly sweet, sugar, hay, grain, caramel malts. Taste is harsh and sweet, sugar, hay, harsh grain, caramel malts, paper. Little bitterness, watery mouthfeel. Next!!
Moderate carbonation with one finger head. Toasted maltiness, medium body. Medium malty finish. Typical lager.
Flaske fra Ica. Gul/brun med medium hvitt skum. Lukter malt og sitrus, bra med kullsyre og litt bitter smak. En helt ok lager.
clear golden with a fine head. aroma of grain. well-balanced taste. alright.

Bottle pour light gold. Nose very faint crystal malt and maybe a hint of banana. Taste some bitter up front, then generic sweetness. Really not very skunky. Mild metallic finish. Perhaps the least offensive macro lager of recent tastes. Went well with my sushi.
Bottle. Clear golden pour. Grass, hay, grain. Light body with decent carbonation. Syrupy.

Work with a guy from Singapore, said this was one of the mainstays back home. It poured a clear yellow/gold color with a small white head. The aroma was of grain, cut grass, hay and hops. The taste was sweet in the beginning before a crisp hop bite comes in with a touch of lemon.

(Bottle 0,33l)
Light grainy aroma. Clear yellow color. Quickly done, white head. Light sweet, light grainy. Light astringent finish. Just another international lager.
Gul farge med hvitt skum. Aroma av malt og sitrus. Meget lettdrikkelig lager. Godt karbonert. Enkel og grei partyøl.

Aroma is faint, little malty and yeasty.
Flavor is sweet, cardboardy and malty.
Fizzy.

Pours a clear, golden yellow with a two finger bright white head. Aroma is of lager yeast notes with light earthy hops. Very unmemorable nose. Tastes of grains and light malts with a slight lemon tartness. Mouth feel is light and dry with medium carbonation. Overall just another nondescript adjunct lager like beer.
Bottle brewed under licence in UK. Pours pale golden, thin white head that quickly disappears. Malty aroma, cardboard, kind of unpleasant. Overwhelmingly carbonated and watery, not very much to it.

In larger 640ml bottle from UK supermarket. Says brewed in Edinburgh by Heineken UK at 4.8% so not sure this is this same beer. I hope so!

Clear golden beer with little head. Aroma is very nothingy but some hop, a light but almost stale taste, dull but drinkable.
Pours a light golden yellow. Smells like a typical pale lager, but tastes slightly better than average.

Had too many of these while in the Navy and heading out to the South Pacific every couple of weeks. One of the only beers I’ve ever had that gave me a hangover before I was done drinking. Bland, watery, corn, cereal, bread, would rather forget about it.

Pours pale yellow with almost no head. Aromacis rye bread, watered-down malts, slight yeast. Taste is rye bread, citrus, and not much else. Very bland.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma : some smells of dough but mostly of dry malts and some slight grassiness 

Taste : very pale maltiness with some subtle bitterness to finish. Pretty basic overall

Appearance : clear gold body with medium head retention
A bit above average for what it is. Super drinkable with no skunky notes. Very refreshing, light with a little hop bite.

Another day, another lager.
Pours a clear golden color. The head is average, white with medium retention.
There is the familiar malty aroma with grains.
As well as the sweet taste at the beginning, followed by grainy body, coming together with nice bittery finish.
Drinkable, light with enough bittereness to freshen you up. Thumbs up.
Draft in Thailand. Wheat and hop aroma. Well carbonated, medium body, a little more bitter than other SEA beers.

An average lager, the malt flavor is quite regular all the time but disappear fast, the hops are just felt at the end with a medium bitterness, the color is Golden pale and the foam head is just seen.
Poured straw with a disappearing white head. Aroma of sweet grainy malt. Light body, flavour is sweet, corn, grassy.

330ml can on a flight from London to Boston. Pours a pale golden, nice holding white head with good lacing. Aroma is metallic, lightly grainy and rice, grass and light floral. Taste is light grassy sweetness, light bitterness. Quite watery. Lightly perfumed aftertaste, even lively carbonation, quite light. Poor enough brew, but for a macro lager, it does have some redeemable and interesting qualities. Would drink it if it was offered to me on a plane again.

From a can into a glass in Thailand. This can brewed by Thai Asia Pacific Brewery. 
Aroma has a light graininess and medium light adjunct character. Light sulfur note and a moderate skunkiness, which is surprising as its from a can. Light grassy hop notes. Faint floral notes. 
Pours a very clear, pale yellow gold with a fairly large, pillowy white head of moderate thickness that recedes pretty quickly. Light lacing and no legs. 
Flavor has a faint sweetness with a light grain note and medium light adjunct character. Light sulfur note along with some light grassy hop character. Faint floral esters and medium light bitterness. A touch of an odd twang in the finish. 
Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall one of the poorer lagers in Thailand. The hop character isn't great and the odd twang doesn't help the beer. Light sulfur and some skunk notes in the aroma. At least there was no diacetyl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml bottle bought at Market Place by Jason’s in Langham Place, Mong Kok.



Clear golden yellow colour; One finger head and soapy white foam which fades in 30 seconds; Small lacing with slight carbonation; Quite pungent smell of malt, with rice, apple juice, apple cider, sugar, hint of wet cardboard, unknown chemical, very light lemon and faint grass; Sweet taste of malt, with light metallic, sugar syrup, wet cardboard, soggy bread, light grains, light lemon and bitter grass; Mid to light body. Thick and quite oily palate; Mouth feel is wort-like, thick and oily, syrupy sweet and cloying to throat. Maltyness is there but is drowned by metallic and sweetness. Yuck… Hoppiness is light lemony nose, more citrus and grass taste. Raw and unsavory bitterness did nothing to quell the worty sweetness, which led to an awful sweet and bitter finish; Wet after taste. Cloying to mouth.



Comments: Been too lazy for this easy country tick as it’s available everywhere just like many Asian macros, and now I regret ticking this: worty and raw, cloying sweetness, some weird chemical smell, metallic and paper to accompany bad bitterness. Drain pours and never again!

Bottle 33 cl.

Pours pale, sparkling, with a small diminishing white head. Weak aroma. Just a bit of malt, and a hint of hops. Taste to match it.



Music:
The Baseballs – Umbrella

CAN thx to Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small rather stable white head.
NOSE: grains, somewhat fruity, some hops? metallic.
TASTE: grains, bad aftertaste.
Very bad beer in general.
330ml Flasche. Goldgelbes Bier mit wenig Schaum. Geruch leicht malzig, muffig. Geschmack wässrig malzig, getreidig, minimal herb im Abgang.

Tiger Lager is a pale golden clear beer with an active thin head of small white bubbles. Nose is faint watery scent of grain. Taste is sweet and more than a little metallic. body is thin and watery. Finish is metal and cloyingly sweet. Not a very good beer.
Nice clean lager. Best drank cold. Reasonably priced. Bought from dan murphys.............

Pours a clear yellow color with a medium sized head that dissipates very quick and leaves a small amount of lacing around the glass. The aroma is extremely sweet malts and some slight breadiness. The taste is very sweet just like the aroma. There is a minimal bitterness from the hops to balance the beer out. This beer will not blow you away by any means but it is still worth a try.
not a beer at all! more like sparkling water with some acidic notes and bread...really disgusting; I really sorry those people who believe that it is a beer...
Bottle. Pours like a lager, but slightly deeper yellow. Slightly sour but very faint aroma. Taste is surprisingly malty - not bad! Watery palette disappoints. Verdict: ok and perfectly drinkable.

0,33 l bottle.Pale golden in the glass, big white head. More rice than malt on the nose. High carbonated. Tastes very neutral, flat, little bit to apple, hints of citrus. Cardboard. Very very low herb.
Light yellow, white foam that lasts somewhat. Sweet malty aroma, with a hint of metal. Sweet malt, with sweet bitter metalic aftertaste. High in carbon.

Draught at Intercontinental Hotel, Shanghai. Pale gold, tiny weak head. Thin hops and straw on the nose. Dull carbonation. Sharp, somewhat metallic flavours of dust and bread. If I'm desperate, maybe.

Appearance: pours a 1" white head that recedes quickly. Color is a light gold with abundant streaming carbonation.
Aroma: some grassy and herbal hop aroma. biscuit and lightly toasted barley.
Mouthfeel: light, watery, fairly crisp with a dry finish.
Flavor: white bread dough, sweet barley malt, biscuit, cracker, with some mild herbal hop flavor
Overall: very nice lager. More complex than many pale lagers.

Bottle.

A- Grains.

A- Golden orange color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Grains, malty, grassy.

P- Light body, average texture, medium carbonation, crisp dry finish.

O- Not sure why it’s world acclaimed. Seems pretty standard at best to me. Nothing special about it.

Aroma: fresh hops, light though not much else. Appearance: clear golden, big foamy head. Taste: light sweetness. Palate: some malts, not too unpleasant. Overall: Lager, boring but drinkable. Can flying BA from ZRH to LHR.
Golden body, nearly non-existent head and lacing. Light grains and not much else. Light bodied, medium carbonation, thins out towards the finish. No good. Y

Pour from can, the liquid is clear gold in color. Head flattens very fast and it’s only moderately fizzy. Body light and texture thin, it smells alcohol and tastes somewhat metal, bitter. It leaves a bitter aftertaste.

@ Lanta Casuarina Beach Resort, Koh Lanta, Thailand. Flaska från lokalt hak. Den här ölen finns förmodligen bara för att släcka törst när det är riktigt varm och då funkar den naturligtvis, men om man ska njuta av smaken ska man välja något annat. Beskan är ganska ok i alla fall.

Aontaíonn tú gan aon ábhar atá mídhleathach nó gráiniúil nó a sháraíonn aon chearta tríú páirtí a chur suas ná ceangal a dhéanamh leis. Aontaíonn tú gan aon ní a dhéanamh a chuirfidh isteach ar úsáideoirí eile leas a bhaint as an Suíomh nó a d’fhéadfadh difear a dhéanamh d’oibriú nó do shlándáil an tSuímh. Aontaíonn tú gan iarracht a dhéanamh rochtain a fháil ar fhaisnéis phearsanta Úsáideoirí eile.

Can, 5%. Dusty aroma, weak hay. Clear golden colour. Small white head. The mouthfeel is good for the style. The flavour has a faint flowery hoppiness and low bitterness. Quite clean and a lot better than I expected.
Superior in taste to Leo, Chang and Singh. Bought in Thailand and Laos. Pours a typical lager yellow. Smells like Purina One. A bit chocolatey for a lager.

33cl glass bottle. Golden in the glass, a bit sharp in the beginning. Old cardboard, not much aroma. The mainpart is a bit sweet and grainy, slightly bitter. The aftertaste is long, unround, malty and grainy, not too sweet. 
 --> 6/8/5/6
Pale yellow colour, one finger rocky white head. Aroma of sugar syrup, hay. Taste is quite sweet. Light body, thin texture, fizzy carbonation. Not very pleasent.
Regular pale lager, taste is pure but totally unremarkable. Quite refreshing.
had this at a restaurant. A basic import lager. Nothing super special about it. It was good and I would get it again if I went out to a Vietnamese restaurant.
Golden body, nearly non-existent head and lacing. Light grains and not much else. Light bodied, medium carbonation, thins out towards the finish.
Another boring pale lager. You know what to expect, pale yellow pour, soapy white head. Watery malt aroma. I thought it would be skunkier than it was. How’s that for a glowing review?

Bought it at the local bar in Malaysia Kuching, because there was option to choose from Heineken and Tiger. I think it’s typical lager style, like Heineken, very watery, some bitterness. Wouldn’t buy anymore, better drink water.
Bought at an Esso petrol station in Hong Kong because it was on discount and a big umbrella as free gift. Watery and too alcoholic. Could be used to marinate pork to make the meat tender.
Lager de base. Petit nez.Gout assez doux, tres legère amertume en fin de bouche. Rafraichissante.
Not that flash, drink it super cold to hide the lack of flavour. Bland and watery, drink it if you have to.
Bottle. Pretty typical pale lager. This was a little less sweet than many varieties. OK and drinkable but nothing special.

Drank at totaly creepy bar Cheers in Penang, Malysia. I don’t speak Malaysian but either a hooker offered me weed, or a bartender offered me a hooker; I chose only Tiger. Very weak aroma, probably due to too low serving temperature. Almost no head, it probably was too afraid to show itself, because of this place atmosphere. Clear golden body, I’m not totally sure, it was almost completly dark in this place in the middle of the day. Malty taste with delicate hoppy bitterness and noticeable lack of acidity so common in beers available in Malaysia. Very drinkable, or I just wanted to leave this bar as soon as possible.
tiger beer kicks ass. stop believing in your own hyped-up beer culture. light lagers are okay to like!
~This review was made some time ago via another application, and thus the specific details (beyond numerical scores) are no longer available~
Sweet commercial lager metal to no aroma. Light head. Taste is light malt and metal.

Pours pale yellow, with no head, looks like soda in the glass. Aromas are corn, cereals, grass. Taste is sweet. Aftertaste is not noticeable. Palate is thin and fizzy. As it warms up it turns really skunky. ugh.
Light aroma of hops. No head jo lace. Very pale. Corny, malty, watery. Weak finish full of alcohol. Another mediocre mainstream lager.

Pours yellow with a thin white head. Smells a bit corn-like. Typical lager. Sweet, malty. Boring.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had a lot of those while I lived in Thailand. My favorite beer in Thailand, even though it's not Thai. Less boozy than the others.
Have had this one from a can, bottle, and draft. The taste still remains the same. Tastes horrible. One a scale of one to ten, it’s not good

330ml bottle from supermarket in Helsinki, 4.6 abv, clear gold colour, small white head. Aroma of grain, hay and floral hops with a hint of citrus. Taste is balanced and fairly dry. noticeably bitter finish, light body, medium carbonation. Well above most supermarket lagers but not really interesting at all,
Licorice flavored lager. I like the sweetness, but as it warms it gets a little skanky, So drink it fast.

Kleur mooi zoals een pilsje hoort te zijn. Smaak kan ik kort over zijn. Is niet het beste uit het oosten het eten is beter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0.33 l @ home. Pours light golden with small head. Aroma is sweet, and some grass. Tastes watery and sweet. (Drank this a couple of months ago, therfore I’m using notes from then on this one)
Served a little warm. Smells horrible but has a decent flavor of sweetness, malts, and a bit of citrus. Epcot Food & Wine Festival

Tasty and refreshing lager. Great daily beer that can be enjoyed all the time.



---Rated via Beer Buddy

From 330 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellow-gold with a small but persistent white head. Aromas of grain, cut grass, hay and noble hops. Taste is sweetish at the front before a crisp hop bite comes in with a touch of lemon. Aqueous body and virtually no finish to speak of. A pretty standard lager.
Tiger time; pours clear light golden. Light malty, grassy aroma. Taste of wet, sweet malt. Short finish. Once I enjoyed this..

Bottle 330 ml, at home. Poured into a stemmed glass. ABV 5%. New country tick.
Golden yellow colur on the body, with a white soapy head on top, collapsing slowly but steadily., leaving light lacing on the glass. 
Heavy aroma of malts, you can tell this is going to taste sweet. Little bit of dirty hay too.
Indeed quite sweet but better than the aroma led me to believe. Just malts and a little hay, but cleaner.
Thin body, low carbonation. Little dryness on the palate.
Nothing interesting here, just another pale lager but goes down easily and smoothly.
33cl bottle. This isn’t one of the better international lagers. Not refreshing at all and if a lager doesn’t refresh then it really doesn’t have a lot of places to go.

Bottle @ home 
Pours clear blonde , rather small white foam 
Soapy smell 
Taste is sweet ( in a very unnatural way ) taste is doable , carbo is good , but i cant help thinking this is very arteficial

Can 33cl. @restaurant in Battambang [6/2/2017] poured into a lager glass. Clear pale golden, small frothy white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma malts, corn, light grass; taste medium sweet and light to medium bitter, malty, grainy, bittersweet aftertaste; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation; nothing special just a decent lager.

640ml bottle at home, with a curry. Certainly looks like a pale lager, pale yellow with thin white head, good lacing and retention. Goes downhill from there though. Cooked corn aroma, cereal taste. Astringent, chemically bitterness.
My favourite beer. Light, refreshing, nice bitterness, holds a good head. Not watery, goes great with Asian food. Nice anytime but really good on a hot humid day.
12oz bottle thanks to ygtbsm94. Pours a clear yellow with white. Taste of wheat. That’s it
Ah Tiger lager! Brings back memories of Singapore where a buddy and I were chased out of a cat house by 4 guys. Good times!

Brad and I are having fun acquiring and drinking beers from around the globe lately. Fun little project going on here. So here goes my first beer from Singapore.

The beer is clear and light golden with an inch or more of pure white head. Mild effervescence. The aroma offers lager yeast, adjunct character, cereal grains, mild sweetness. The flavor pretty much follows suit. 

Adjunct lagers are certainly not the most complex or refined beers around, but for the style, this one is alright. Clean and refreshing. Delicate sweetness with a bit of a fruit candy finish. I wish the finish was drier.

Overall, this was inoffensive, though uneventful as well.
Helt lys øl. Noe blomsterlukt. Litt søtlig. kjenner et hint av bitterhet. medium kullsyre.
can. Poured clear gold with a chunky bleach white head. Aroma of sweet grainy malt. Light body with typical carbonation. Flavour of grassy malt, sweet with a tart touch at the finish.

Bottle at a restaurant in Manchester. Pale gold colour, with a white head. Aroma of malt, straw, and grass. Light body, medium carbonation. Fairly typical pale lager, though a little better than average.

11.2floz/330ml bottle into a shaker glass. Served cold.

Aroma: Malty. Maybe the tiniest bit of hop.

Appearance: Clear bright yellow body with a thin white head.

Taste: White-bread type malt with just a little bit of hop bitterness to round it out.

Palate: Pretty light bodied and a little watery. Abrupt slightly bitter finish.

Overall: I mean it’s not bad or anything, but it isn’t anything to write home about.
330ml bottle. Pale yellow color. Tiny to almost no head. Corny, cardboard in aroma. Papery, metallic, corny flavor. Watery palate. Never again.
33cl bottle at asian restaurant. Gold color. Medium carbonation. Crispy texture. Cereal, light malt aroma.

330ml brown bottle poured into a pint glass. Appearance is pale yellow with a large beige head. Aroma of cornflakes, cereal and a hint of wet grass. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Palate is light-medium bodied, watery texture and soft carbonation. There is nothing distinct about Tiger Beer, just a generic poorly carbonated standard cheap lager. 

Re-rating:
330ml can poured into a tulip glass. The same as the last time I tried it, but this time in a can the beer had a medium carbonation. Other than for the novelty of drinking a beer originating from Singapore, it is still just a generic lager.
33 cl bottle. Pours golden with a white head. Grassy flavour with hints of citrus. Average lager.
It has the aroma of stagnant creek grasses. The color is golden with a head that dissipates quickly. The grasses are a bit too tart and don’t really work well with the carbonation.

Bottle. Pours clear straw colored with a big, fast disappearing white head. Aroma of stale grassy hops. Taste is moderate sweet grainy, with a stale bitterness at finish, not at all undrinkable, but bordering.
Bottle 0.33l at home. BBE 28 DEC 2013. Colour is yellow with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, malts and some sweetness.

Pale lager typically drank in Indian restaurants with spicy food. Not too much going on here, usual lager appearance with a reducing white head. Taste is grassy, hoppy, thin bodied, watery and smooth. It even has a slight sweetness in the after taste but it doesn’t last long. Although nothing special this beer tastes inoffensive and is a step above your average lager. Ensure it is served super cool ideally with food.
This has a pale blond colour. It has a plain taste with some straw, grass. Quite smooth.
can on an airplane. The other choice was heineken. The beer is not anything special, but i think I made the right choice.

Bona però no molt, es una mica cara. La sapporo es millor. Està es massa torrada per al meu gust.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On British Airways from a can. Pale blond colour, creamy white head. Aroma is slightly floral, corn, plastic and chemicals. Lovely... Tastes similar, plastic and chemical again with an artificial sweetness. Normally I don’t slam these macros so much as they are normally not horrible, just very boring, but this one was pretty bad. I finished the can, but definitely wouldn’t have another. Pretty sure this would give you a stinking hangover. Maybe it is worse at altitude.
Bottled. Yellow, smal white head. Bitter aroma of hops, with hints of malt. Very tasteless. Works on the beaches of Asia but not at home.
Bottle into shaker. Standard macrobrew. Skunk taste with hint of malt. Over carbonated. Winner of awards? Interesting
Bottle: Just another lager with tons of medals and awards. Food Pairing: Coconut Shrimp.
33 cl can, 5.0% abv.  Pale golden lager. Smooth mouthfeel, but overall tastes like most other asian lagers: grainy, watery and utterly boring.

Bottle. Pale yellow golden colour, foam white head leaving some lacing and aroma of malt, straw, grassy. Taste is crisp malt & grain, watery mouth feel, light body & medium carbonation. Bland lager, OK chilled.

I've had it before but drunk this on a virgin atlantic flight. Pale middle of the road Asian lager. They're all the same aren't they? Drinkable but very un interesting and bland. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Épaisse mousse blanche qui s’évapore rapidement, sur un liquide ambre plutôt pétillant. Au nez, sucre et maïs. Le goût sucré du malt est assez retenu, Dieu merci, mais c’est son côté aqueux qui prend le dessus. Ceci dit, on goûte assez bien les céréales blondes, et elle est désaltérante. Bière asiatique qui est bien loin de briser les conventions, ou même les stéréotypes trop souvent véridiques sur les bières ayant cette provenance, mais elle possède quelques qualités qui la rachètent un peu.
Clear yellow with white head. Aroma is musty stale. Taste is cheesy and stale. drinkable but not something to look for.
Had on a BA flight from Amman to London. Tastes ok. More flavor than most in its style. Had to drink in a plastic cup. Looked like a urine sample.
4.6 % version. Smell of starch and malt. Golden colour, white head. Aroma of alcohol, starch, some sugar and plastic. Mildly sweet. Boring as hell.
(can) clear pale yellow with a tall white head; aromas of grain, hint of noble hops; slightly bitter and chemical flavour; nothing to get excited about but better than many other Asian lagers
Bottle. Pale yellow with a short white head. Corn, malt and yeast aromas. A bit of hops somwhere, but really just another example of a mass-produced lager.
Its a good beer...drank a lore of it when i was in Indonesia and Singapore...nice lager
Depending on your taste buds.... you may or may nit like this. but this is a light beer in Singapore.
Actually tastes like a crap Pale Lager, but it’s got a cool logo, so I feel like it should be better.
nothing special except its origin and the appearance which is unusual for our place :-)
Bottle. Pours slightly cloudy yellow with white head. Nose and taste of corn, skunk, barley and light metal. Lighter bodied.
A beer that for some reason I thought might be a bit more interesting. However still not much taste to this beer. Rather bland, nothing interesting about it. Its a macro beer!
Slight floral aroma. Typical pale lager look to it. It’s crisp and drinkable, acceptable for camping, the beach or camping at the beach.

Can on BA0559 from Roma to LHR, 23/06/13.
Clear pale blonde with a thin white head.
Nose is pale malts, cereals, light spice, citrus, pear drops, touch of banana and yeast.
Taste comprises grass, pale malts, apple skin, cereals.
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation with a little spritz, dryish finish.
Dull and whilst not at the bottom of the heap, towards the lower end of the macro range.
While sitting curbside on a street in Saigon, heat and humidity hungrily sucking life force from your pores, cycles passing noisily in waves and droves... a mug of Tiger on ice is simply divine.

33 cL bottle. Light yellow pour, with a small, foamy, white head. The aroma is hay, lemon rindes, a little rye bread, faint floral notes, and an unfortunate hint of cheese. The flavor is light bitterness, and good citrusy sweetness. Relatively well balanced, too. Medium body, crisp, and clingy. Overall, this is a surprisingly good lager. Well balanced, assertive, and flavorful.

Super clear brew with a yellow colour and lots of carbonation. Muted aroma, with lots of corn syrup, some noble hops and pislner all the way aroma. bland flavour, fast brew with a watery body and little bite. wow bad beer.
0,64L bottle. Light hop aroma. Good carbonating. Light hop, yeast taste. Little alcohol taste and light bitter on end.

Blonde pâle et claire, pétillance moyenne, mousse très fine. Petite amertume, légère sécheresse sur la fin. Une lager banale qui dessoiffe mais ne convainc pas un habitué de la pils belge qui remplit le même rôle.
Bottle from an asian restaurant.  Nothing really special. Grains with some light hops. Drinkable and enjoyable, but totally not special.

Poured from 500mL can.  Clear pale yellow with dissipating foamy white head. Corn aroma with mild banana notes.  Very slight sweetness, but mostly just watery with no finish.  I seem to remember it tasting better in Vietnam for some reason (for a macro pale lager).

Poured from a bottle.  Clear straw color; big fizzy head, disappears quickly leaving no lacing. Actually a bit pleasantly surpised - I was expecting worse.  Aroma is sweet malt - maybe a bit of banana mixed in.  Similar taste.  Body is light and pretty flat.  OK for a hot day.
Watery, over-sweet, cloying, under-bittered.. oh, just a normal mass-produced lager, really.
33cl bottle. Pours clear golden with a big white head.  Lighy malty aroma. Flavour is sweet malty with some bitterness in the end.
floral, citrus aroma, pale without head.   slight bitter averrage carbonation,   no aftertaste.

Pours a three finger white head that fades slowly leaving some lace. Crystal clear pale straw color. Light carbonation and very light bodied.  sweet grainy nose, flavor is sweet corn and light hops. Good lawnmower beer, not much else. 12oz bottle from Gift Specialists Oceanside, California.

Tasted 26/4/2013 draught "Malones", Singapore. Poured a clear pale golden amber with a one-finger white foamy head that diminished quickly and laced poorly. Smooth, light, soft with a mildly sweet and mildly bitter finish. A very nice ber as presented at this bar.
33CL bottle at home, bought in Germany. Clear golden, aroma has a hint of lemon. Nothing special but its refreshing, overall sort of good.

Tasted in Bangkok, April 2013 as part of personal Asia beer sampling.  Honestly, this beer wasn’t fantastic, but it was the best of the 5 Asian beers I tasted.  Why?  First of all the nose was neutral, which in this case was a plus.  Clear gold pour which was true to style.  light but bubbly mouthfeel.  a bit of bread on the tongue, sweet, but also with a little bit of hopping that made this a fairly decent Asian beer.
0,33l bottle. Golden color. Aroma is mostly malt. Taste is malt and some fruity notes. Pretty watery lager. It’s refreshing, but not really good.

Bottled ; Devon ; UK ; Light malt and hops aroma ; Yellow color with minimal head ; Sweeter taste with light bitter finish ; Watery ; Not good.

bottle. clear pale gold, fizzy white head. a ton of apple juice and plastic and chemicals and candy popcorn in the nose. it’s astounding how bad this beer is even when I good shape. it’s not light struck or overly oxidized, but full of harsh husky grains, fizzy, loose carbonation, watery, thin body and saccharine sweetened apple juice and acetone. truly horrible.

Bottle. Golden clear color. White head. Typical BMC taste. No odor. Tangy aftertaste.

This beer has that clear piss water look common to macro lagers and it shares some other characteristics too, most notably that corn syrup flavour. But, to its credit, there’s a little bit more to keep one interested, notably some mild hops in both the aroma and taste. An easy drinking Summer beer.
Poured a clear golden with a white fluffy fast disapating head. Aroma is skunky with grass and weed, but it has a butter hint as well. Taste is wet water with light grain and sliver of malt.

I didn’t have high expectations for this beer, but I wasn’t that upset with it. It has a basic aroma with some sweet notes creeping in, and the rice really comes through in the mouthfeel. This is a very popular beer in Singapore, and would paid nicely with spicy foods like Thai and Indian. I wouldn’t buy this again unless food was involved.

(Can 08/01-2013) Medium white fast fading head, clear pale yellow color, light malty aroma, high co2, thin body, slightly sweet taste. BB date apr 2013.

Appearance:  Light gold with creamy white head which dissipates but leaves a nice lacing, visible carbonation.
Aroma:  Green apple peel, lightly toasted bread, slight buttery aroma.
Flavour:  Bready flavour profile, no hop bitterness, notes of corn on the cob.
Mouthfeel:  Spritzy, refreshing, not much balance, mainly sweet, although the carbonation lifts the sweetness a little.  Finish moderately dry followed by a lingering sweetness.
Overall:  For what it is, not too bad, not my preferred style but I don’t see how the score of 7 out of 100 is justified.
330 ml can. Aroma faint of corn and citrus. Tastes bland of hay with notes of malt. Low carbonization.

330ml bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow with a fizzy one finger head. A few clumps of foam remain on top of the beer but otherwise nothing to speak of.

Aroma is grassy with a little bit of bready malt but it is all very light. Some cooked vegetable and creamed corn too.

Taste has tons of vegetable up front. with a bready background. Wet grass comes in fleetingly along with a light, somewhat drying bitterness. Mouthfeel is quite sticky and sweet and feels under attenuated.

Overall, a way below average lager. I tend to enjoy most foreign pale lagers but not this one. Dial back the DMS and sweetness and it would be tolerable.
