It has a nice balance to it but nothing really stands out in the flavor.  It’s light and drinkable which I guess is pretty much the standard for a pale lager.  Just blah to me - nothing special.

Bottle shared at a tasting at kerenmk’s place. Thanks Hansen & Zita for this bottle! Pours yellow with a white head, aroma is sweet with vanilla, malt and butter, flavor of malt, bread, caramel, light bitterness, light bodied

Bottle. Pours light golden with a big creamy head. The aroma is not too exciting, with a fairly boring orange hoppiness and some fruits as well as cardboard, toffee and caramel malt. Flavour is sour with a lemon-ish citrus, some fruit and notes of sweet malt.

Bottle. Pours pale yellow with a large white head that dissipates with good lacing. Aroma is faint corn syrup, grain, and caramel. Flavor is grainy with lightly sweet corn and a light grassy bitter finish.
Bottle. Pale gold in colour, little or no aroma. There is a little bit more bitterness in this than other lagers. Otherwise nothing much to say.
330 ml bottle. This beer has an average level on both taste, body and level of bitterness, and gives me in general an ok experience.

Bottle at a tasting, thanks, clear light yellow colour, aroma of citrus and solvent, sickening combination of sweetness and bitterness diminishing to a very kught unpleasant bitter aftertaste. Blah...

Bottle shared at a tasting at kerenmk’s place. Thanks Hansen & Zita for this bottle! Clear golden. Aroma of skunk and DMS. Sweetish grainy flavor with a drier finish with light bitterness. Light-bodied.

Pale golden beer with small white head.  Aroma is very weak. Nice malty flavour with some good hops, but the aftertaste is somewhat metallic. Thin to medium texture. Not so good except for the flavour.

Bottle  shared at a tasting in our place. Thanks Hansen & Zita!  Pours clear, pale gold, with a quick dissolving white head. Corn and artificial sweetener aroma, artificial, overly sweet taste. Sticky feeling, light body. Quite bad.
Clear yellow pour with white diminishing head, very cheap tasting but acceptable thirst quencher, smells of grain, a bit bitter and skunky but does the jib
Bottle. Standard pale lager that was an acceptale accompiament to my curry.

Rating a 500ml can. Pours with no head. Attractive dark straw colour. Light carbonation. Hoppy aroma. Mild taste. Quaffable but nothing remarkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Slight hops and malt in the aroma, but pretty weak.  Tastes like a decent chips and salsa beer, I’m liking it pretty well.  Guess depends on what you’re expecting or eating with it, but it’s not so awful all things considered. 5% abv.

First Singaporean beer for me. Pours a crystal clear pale golden color with light amounts of visible carbonation.
It has flavours of sweet corn malts and some rice malts. This was one of better asian beers. It’s really refreshing.
Poured from can. Pours pale yellow.  Nose of earthy grains and citrus. A little skunky on the taste. Reminds me of Heineken. Nothing special.

Draft at the Green Man, Kuala Lumpur. Light amber pour, highly carbonated with a frothy head and some lacing. Served cold, which to be honest it probably needs. It won’t get any better the warmer it becomes! There is almost no aroma and if I’m really honest not a lot of taste either! There is a slight malty, hoppy bitterness in the taste and palate. It really is a bad beer, but it will quench your thirst on a hot day, but then so will water, which this beer is pretty close to! What were Heineken thinking of when they bought the company! Ah, but given their own track record they probably thought this was a very drinkable beer :-)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clean flavours and aromas. Nothing that stands out as bad flavours, nothing that really excites.

A-- Poured a clear straw yellow color. Medium carbonation, short living bright white head the became film. Left lacing through drinking the beer.

S-- Smelled more like a European Lager crossed with a Adjunct. Had a skunky corn smell with faint hops and touches of sweetness. Nothing that stood out though.

T-- Thought closer to Heniken than anything else. Had a metallic taste and very thin and watery. More skunky as it got warmer.

M-- Well carbonated and had a decent backbone to it. More hops in this than I thought and did stick to my teeth. Still a lot of sweetness to it.

D-- As Asian lagers go this is workable. Good for a hot day and want to quench your thirst quickly. One is good enough to suffice. A little too much sweetness to do more than 2 though, as would get an upset stomach from the sugar and corn. Best way to go with this beer is pair it with stuff like salt and pepper squid, crab or some spicy Asian dish. Much better beer when paired with food and far more sessionable with the right foods. Also a half to a full letter grade better when paired with the right foods.

While many will be inclined to fob this off as "macroswill" or some such, Tiger’s actually not a bad lager, and it’s very drinkable. While certainly not a sophisticated drink, it’s nice to have a few big 500ml bottles about for a film or a game session. Sweet, light, and just the right amount of fizz.
0,33 l bottle shared with McTapps. A bit too carbonated but decent lager. Sweet aroma of sugar mixed with malt. Not bad at all.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. A light headed lager beer. Not bitter at all and easy to drink. Good balance between hops and barley.
Buena cerveza aunque algo suave para mi gusto.  Pero debe ser la mejor de las suaves que he probado
Light aroma: corn, hay, wet laundry. Clear golden with short white head. Taste has bit harsh hay, corn. Dry and bit bitter, standard carbonation. Short finish is dry. Quite boring really.

Pours a light, soft lemon yellow color, with a big but quickly vanishing, fluffy white head. The aroma is unfortunately typical of the style, with little but a musty, light bready aroma. The flavor is likewise thin and common, with a light grainy sweetness predominating. Overall, this is a decent alternative to other fizzy yellow lagers, but it doesn’t provide much pleasure beyond that.

Pale yellow clear body with white somewhat lacing head. Aroma is sweet malts, grains, rice. Palate is thin watery, with medium lively carbonation and mouth feel. Taste is malty sweet and little papery with vague dry finish. Decent lager, drinkable, nothing special but no off-flavors etc either.
Oh god. Somebody help me. Why is it such a plethora of totally godawful beers are out there. What a wretched drink this is.
Nice aroma and great lite beer best drunk in the heat/sun. Easy to nock back and great with hot food.
Bottle. Half finger foam. Clear light yellow. Faint malty aromas. Vers bitter fresh. Light body. Beach beer.
500 ml can. Pours a clear gold with lots of carbonation and little head. Cereal to the nose. Can’t really taste anything. Maybe a little honey and cereal. Water substitute.

11.2oz bottle. Pour was a nice light golden yellow color with a good amount of head. Aroma is sweet. Taste is same with a small hop bitterness character. Light to medium body. To me. it’s a good lager.

This is just a crappy cheap export lager from yet another Asian country, same as so many others. It’s cold, and that’s the best thing I can say. Standard gold color, minimal head, almost skunky taste. Not very good.
Ganska typisk asiatisk lager. Smakar och doftar inte så mycket, ok som törstsläckare eller för att dämpa kryddstark mat.

As Tiger beer, Asia Pacific Breweries Vietnam. Not sure if it was an import to Vietnam, or locally brewed.

Clear golden colour, small dissipating head. Aroma of adjunct, light grass, some cloves. Flavour of sweet corn, adjunct, light bitter hops, dough, rather sweet. Quite sticky, finish malts and dough.

Not the best lager ever.

(From 33cL can @ tderoeck’s place. Thanks for sharing!)
very solid pale lager.  clean.  gold medal clean dough malts.   high carbonation.  nice body.  nice.

This blond beer with champagne-finesee bubbles, leaves a deep & mallowed taste. Heads can disappear quickly. Served in all Singapore Airlines flights. Some versions of the beer (China & HK) some could have been flat, due to poor transportation & heat in the stores.  Otherwise, that is a must have in Asia.
Very pale. Light head. The aroma is grainy, lightly fruity. Watery, swilly, grainy taste. Pretty weak.
Some head, pale yellow. nose is a little sour maize. Soft and with a medium body and some length. Taste is very light with a faint sweetness.

3/VI/2012 - 33cl can as Asia Pacific Breweries Vietnam @ home (2012-594) Thanks to Thomas and Annelies for the can!


Clear light blond beer, unstable, white fizzy head, little adhesive. Aroma: bit of grassy hops, sugar, sweet corn, cloves. MF: ok carbon, light body. Taste: bit sweet, citric, bread dough, yeast. Aftertaste: chemical bitterness and cloves. Didn’t finish...

50cl bottle. Pours a clear yellow straw colour with a minimal white head which dissipates quickly. Aroma is grain and skunk. Taste is grass, steel, grain and skunk. Lively carbonated. Definitely avoid if you can.
0,33 boks hjemført av min gode venn Børge: atskillig tydeligere malt- og humleprofil enn de andre thailandske øl vi har prøvd. Kortvarig skum.
Lovely foam and a good bitter, although this is a very light beer. This beer works in many different contexts, hence the high rating.

In Dubai at the Crown Plaza.  Basic lager beer.  Grassy notes with metallic aftertaste.  This was good enough after not having a beer for a couple of months, but nothing to write home about, no pun intended.  Golden color with no head.
pale golden with one finger head. another flavor-lacking lager. nothing objectionable, but quite boring.
500ml can. A clear golden body, medium white head with low retention. Aroma of grassy hops, cereal, a tad sour. Taste is a mix of moderate hop bitterness and some sourness, cardboard, cereal.
330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with average frothy white head. Strawy aroma, hints of bitter hop. Monotonous more strawy than malty taste, a hint of bitter hop, hoppy finish on the edge to soapy.

12 oz. bottle pours golden with a white head.  This is just a basic lager malt and a subtle sweetness.

ok for style.
mild malt flavour and a decent hop palate.
fairly standard macro brew.

Tastes balanced but unremarkable, really. Fairly creamy palate - much softer carbonation than I expected from the appearance. Good, but nothing great. Easy drinking.

Can 320 ml bought in the plane back from Malaysia. A clear yellow beer with low head, nose has some over-riped fruit notes. Aroma is on dry grains, corn sugar, dusty and peppery hops, body is low, finish has some light hops notes. A very basic lager, happy anyway to got this can !

Bottle 33cl, a clear yellow beer with head that goes quickly. Nose is on wet paper. Aroma is caramel like with wet paper and low malty body, very boring and classic lager, dusty hops.

Drank both bottles and cans during my stay in cambodia during christmas.Pale yellow lager.Difficult to dislike.Commercial lager.I like it and will probably buy it again all over the world when on holiday.
Can. pours clear golden yellow with a weak foamy head. Aroma of malt and light hops and corn. taste is sweet with mild bitterness. Boring. Very similar to other lagers of the region.

330ml bottle. Your run of the mill lager. Not much aroma on the nose. Rather bland all the way through and not much hop bitterness on the finish.

Oct 2006 from BA: 330ml brown bottle, imported into the UK by ’Tiger Beer UK Ltd’. 

Pours fine, looks good. 

Smells of dirty washing, without my pants in the mix. That is a little unfair, dirty malt and dirty water aroma is more correct. 

Tastes OK, a little dry and a bit watery for 5%, but a standard lager non the less. 

Lightwieght mouthfeel, although the dryness lingers for a while. 

A drink for hot sunny days, not much call for it in Great Britain, so I shall not be looking out for it, unless we have a heatwave or global warming starts to mess with my town!
On tap @The Running Bull, Chch, NZ. Strong malty taste, agressive sparkling. Not too bad for a mass-production pale lager
This is popular amongst many of the expats in SEA but I’ve never seen the appeal... to me it tastes like you fed a tiger a mixture of lemongrass and chile and drank its urine.

Clear golden wheat with a bright white head and light lacing.  Too bad looks aren’t everything.  Smell is sour grain...not appealing.  Taste opens with off-grain, maybe rice, moves to wet cardboard.  Reminds me a little of the paper mill odor that one encounters several miles inland along the Southeast coast.  Finsih is slightly sour.  Not much.
Looks great in its tall glass. Yeasty aroma. cardboard and paper in the taste, awful aftertaste. Watery and fizzy, not great.
Pours yellow..not much aroma.. Taste is kinda blah.. Nothing special...not horrible but wont do again

500ml can at a Sri Lankan restaurant. Not one of the better beers I’ve had but luckily this wasn’t not mine to drink - just had a sample. Thin yellow with a white head. Stale caramel, cardboard, maybe light hops, high carbonation and light body with not the greatest aftertaste although probably more drinkable if it was colder.
From can. Clear pale golden with a good head. Nose and taste of corn and malt. Not much bitterness. Nothing else was available.

500ml can poured into pint glass. 1cm white head fades to thin ring with no lacing. Colour is pale yellow with good carbonation. Aroma is part sweet grass part hops a little skunky. Taste is exactly as it smells, first sweet but earthy with bread hops finish. Wet to oily palate. Clean finish with little aftertaste.

11.2oz bottle - pours very clear yellow with quickly disappearing white head and thin lacing.  Nose is malty.  Flavor is light caramel, and slightly hoppy.  Taste is mildly sweet with a bitter finish.  watery to lightly sticky texture.  Better than the averages pale lager.

Originally rated May 2005. This Singapore lager pour a golden colour with a head that dissapears rather quickly and harldy leaves any lace. The aroma is not that bad, kind of grain malt and sweet a bit. So is the taste - mild in malt and grain. Nothing mind-renching. Refreshing though.

One of my favourite beer memories was while hanging out down the back streets of Singapore having a few Tigers.  When ever the bar tenders saw the beer was getting empty they would top it up with ice, if you were finnished they were quick to ask if you wanted another.  Ice and beer I don’t usually go for but in that humidity it was awesome.

Not good.  Might be a skunk beer.  Looks like bud light. Taste horrible.  Might pour it out. Better beers here

Bottle from Tesco - but it’s not exactly hard to find here in the UK.  It’s certainly uninspiring to look at - a clear, very pale yellow with no head and an enormous amount of carbonation.  The mouthfeel is poor - too much fizz for my tastes.  It’s saved from a terrible score by a taste that is crisp and initially bitter but well balanced with slight sweetness.  A short finish but this really isn’t too bad for a mass-produced pale lager.

Think this beer would taste better when in Thailand, at an airport lounge it is just another pilsener.

Pours clear straw yellow with a quickly diminishing white head.  Nose is cardboard, faint malt, and an unpleasant unidentifiable astringency.  Faintly sweet and musky taste.  Watery.  No mouthfeel.  Slightly grainy aftertaste.  Terrible.

Bottle   pours golden yellow with white head that dissipates away .  not much aroma - a bit grainy and grassy . Taste has a touch of sweetness that improves it a little over most asian pale lagers .  Medium carbonation . Drinkable - unlike some  .

Don’t know what it is but I quite like Tiger Beer. Pours very yellow with minimal white head. Aroma is pleasantly sweet and bready with a light floral touch. Taste is malty and sweet with bread and hay up front, and only a hint of bitterness in the end. Finish is quite abrupt but that’s to be expected. Body is light but carbonation is fairly soft which makes for a pleasant experience. All in all, a beer you can drink quite a few of.

Rerate: This is for the canned version. I am not sure if this version is better or if it’s just fresher but this is a really nice beer and very much a step up by beer geek standards from a typical American cheap lager. It is light and texture but a touch sweet w/ lots of nice lemony hop character. It gets to feeling a bit heavy as it warms so either drink it fast or just put the second half of the can back in the fridge until you are ready for it.



 Original rating (2.5):This headless golden beer is a pretty typical Heineken-ish lager, albeit brown-bottled so not skunked. The nose is grainy and actually pretty nice w/ a hint of earthy herbal hops. Overall, this is a nice and dry beer w/ a pleasant bitterness but there is something just a little off, a sort of exaggerated graininess w/ a sweet grass kind of flavor which is regretfully hard to describe. Really not a terrible beer overall though and almost really good in the vein of a North German pilsener.
Pours golden with foamy white head, good lacing. Sweet perfume aroma. Cardboardy, easy to drink. Slightly acidic and bitter. Bottle 330 ml in long bar Wellington, Nz
earthy, grass, cereal, vanilla, pale, clear, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, light body, slick feel, lively, bitter,

From notes.  First reviewed 1/29/2009.  Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

A pretty standard pour for an Asian lager - a golden yellow color, with a medium sized head that began to vaporize as soon as it had formed. Above average carbonation is present.

A fairly light, mostly adjunct smell. More specifically, I would say it has a slightly sweet corn smell. No real hop or malt to speak of.

A consistent flavor from start to finish. I actually thought the sweetness from the corn in the taste was an improvement over the normally awful tasting beers in this category.

Only a small amount of texture and not entirely smooth. A fair amount of carbonation reminds me that I am drinking a fizzy Asian lager. It is light enough to be ok, though.

Some of the beers I have had in India and Asia are so bad that I can not even finish one. So with a decent level of smoothness and a light, sweet character, I would put this ahead of those in terms of tolerability. That said, it certainly is not a beer I would go out of my way to purchase, and I would probably laugh at anyone drinking it in the U.S. as an "import."
Good easy-drinking beer that’s better on draft than in a bottle.  This is your standard pale lager, don’t expect much, but you can drink these all night with no problem.
Riktigt ljus öl med vitt snabbt försvinande skum. Smakar inte mycket men har i alla fall inga dåliga felsmaker. Skall drickas i 35-gradig värme eller till riktigt kryddstark mat.

33 cl. bottle @ Vietnamese restaurant Saigon, utrecht. Golden yellow with a white head. Grassy aroma. Sweetish malty taste with some hops. Goes well with spicy Vietnamese food, just like any other lager.
Aroma/ligth, Appearance Head/Initial-frothy, Head/Color light, Body/Hue-black, Initial Flavor-acidic light. Finish Flavor-acidic light Palate/Body-medium to full,  beer
33 cl. bottle.  Pours pale gold with a white head.  Aroma of grain and sweet malt.  Taste is grain, malt, and a bit of skunk.  Not offensive.

Bottled. Pale yellow color starts With a nice whitehead and keeps lacing, aroma has hints of cereal like rice and corn, flavor goes in same direction but refreshing. Mouthfeel is keeps an dry cereal.

Im Glas erstaunlich kräftig goldgelb, allerdings mit wenig schaum und kaum Co2. Der Geruch fällt hopfig säuerlich aus. Der Antrunk ebenso. Hopfig herb, sehr herb. A slight bitterness but not much in flavor. Light yellow in color with a fading white head.

Clear yellowish golden pour thin white head .... aroma is grassy hops and of sweet malts ..... taste is of sweet malts with a little bitter grassy hop to it .... not a bad lager ... this brewery makes some good commercials
Bottle, found it a little watery, but refreshing. Not some thing i would go a long way to get.
A generic beer that is not overly complex.  Not much flavour and the nose is subdued, but it is drinkable.

Pretty standard lager, yet I prefer this over many domestic lagers. Has a rich malty taste and mouth feel, and a good dry hop finish. Carbonation is pretty high, and this is very refreshing when very cold.
Pilskleurig, weinig blijvende kraag. Ruikt metaalachtig. Smaakt zoetig met een beetje mout. Weinig body en weinig nasmaak. Niet voor herhaling vatbaar.

Fairly strong aroma, standard lager.

Clear golden color with a small white head. Malty aroma. Sweet malty taste with some hop bitterness. Drinkable but boring.

Amber-gold colored beer from Asia Pacific. It has a dirty, grainy, straw  aroma. It’s mildly sweet with a bitter finish. Bready aftertaste. Medium carbonation. Contrasted with Cerveza Imperial, an odd corporate cousin. Okay beer, and not the tropical lager one might expect.
Bottle. Yellow. Very carbonated. Malty. A totally quaffable lager. Unimpressive as they come.

Clear lager yellow, receding white head. Sweet malt ang grain aroma. Floral, sweet malty oily taste, grain and corn. Medium bodied, low hopped, average carbs. Cloying sweet finish. Not very good. LF (Lagerboy Friendly)
Had this in a bottle with my dinner at Thai Paradise. A typical below average but drinkable lager. Malty and heavily carbonated. Grab your lawnmowers!
Bottle at Thai Paradise in Pickerington. Poured a pale fizzy yellow. Smelled like fizzy yellow beer. Tasted like fizzy yellow beer. Drinkable. Thats about it.
pours yellow with white. taste is strong, carbonated, and floral. its not subtle, but it has definite character for a lager.
Looks like pee. Tastes a little better. Mild malt nose. Crisp and dry malt water tongue.
I like the awards on the label for this one. It’s funny. Makes me laugh. The rate beerian below me is spot on the money
Aroma of alcohol and some wheat...nice foamy white head. Decent Singapore beer.

Bottle at Baadshah, out of a Kingfisher glass. Pours clear yellow, thick white head, poor lacing. Nose is hoppy and grassy, very surprised how decent this smells. Some light grassiness, lightly skunky. Flavours aren’t as nice, some tealike hops on top of a rather generic lager body. Decent, for a pale lager.

Bottle. 4.8% ABV, Brewed in the UK. Pours a very pale gold with a thick white head with very poor retention. Aroma has notes of rice and corn but is predominantly of wheat. Also notes of fruit, bread dough and alcohol. Rather sweet for a lager, which gives way to a bitter finish. Very crisp and refreshing. Not bad, but too sweet for my tastes.

Bottle: Clear golden beer with a foamy white head. Sweet, subdued malty aroma with notes of cereal and hay. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with sugary notes and a semidry, skunky, slightly bitter finish. Bland...
Bottle. Clear golden/light copper with a minimal white head. Not much aroma, maybe a little of sugary malt with metallic touch. Tastes like any other mass-produced lager.

Can. Brewed in Cambodia although a Singapore branded beer. Typical lager. Grain notes and a sweet finish. Not a lot of hops or body but light and refreshing (if cold) on a hot South East Asian afternoon.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma and taste of weak malt, light grassy hops and spices. Thin body, lively carbonation. 291211

500 ml. can. Enjoyed with a vegetable soup. Clear, golden colour with a medium sized, frothy head, that faded fast. Aroma is grass, floral, and some remote Far-Eastern spices. Taste is light sweet with bread, grasses, weak spices and floral hops. Lively carbonated, light body. Short, bitter refreshing finish. Not bad for the style!

Can (purchased in Liquor store in Marystown, NL, Canada) Pours litle godlen yellow, not much head, slightly bitter, not much taste. Beer flavored water. I Might as well drink a Labatt Blue and put a cup of water in it.
5.0% gold colour with no head, slight malt aroma but not much, not much taste either and rather fizzy, a typical hot country beer, would by ok very cold on a very hot afternoon.

Bottle. Clear golden with a white head. Pretty sweet industrial lager with just a hint of bitterness in the end. Medium carbonation. Pretty tasteless, but works better on a hot summer day or with spicy food.
Tap in Singapore with Constantinos. Good night out, lame beer. Mass produced lager, sweetish, cold, wet. Just about drinkable.
Straw gold.  Hot, cereal grains, corn, vegetal hops. Sweet grainy lager malts, corn, woody/vegetal hop flavor.  Finishes dry and hoppy, with lingering doughy grain.  Slightly slick.
Aroma of yeast, and well a pale lager.  Pours pee yellow.  Has a slight lemongrass taste and a nice sour yeast bite.  Not bland but still a pale lager.  Yawn.

Bottle - Clear golden colour with a heavy carbonation and a white head. Hop and malt nose. Simple light sweet malt taste with a sharp hop bitterness towards the end. Some cardboard and overall heavy bread. Drinkable but not interesting.

33 cl.  bottle @ home – poured into my Hoegaarden glass – last of the 3 Asian macro lagers I got at the local Asian supermarket, probably held onto this one for a bit too long but it was refrigerated the whole time & it was probably not exactly fresh either when I got it A: clear sparkling yellow with a white head – S: sweet with honey, hop oil, floral with sweet adjuncts – T: bitter pale lager taste fills my mouth lots of adjuncts, rice, bitter metallic hops, grass, hay, floral & most of all, lots & lots of aluminium, aluminium rice, aluminium flowers, aluminium pear & dominant aluminium honey melon, adjunct aftertaste – B: light & sparkling (that’s bad) – Got this one on the recommendation of a friend who drank this whilst visiting Singapore claiming that it was a pretty good macro lager, maybe it is a freshness thing but I do doubt it but this simply bad & disappointing even within its category, upside is that I now know how aluminium melon tastes like

500 ml can. Yellow with a foamy white head. Discreet aroma with some notes of fruity esters. Flavour is rather sweet with hints of banana. Medium carbonation. Not very good, but fruitier than your average pale lager.
bottle in Alexandria,VA. average lager, nothing special. Light yellow color, small head.

12 oz bottle.  Aroma is similar to the basic American style lagers.  It pours a nice light gold with good carbonation.  The taste is quite light for my liking.  Light all around with a thin texture.  This beer is easy to drink but not that interesting.  A basic lager.

Draft. Pours gold, with a frothy head. Typical pale lager, with little taste or aroma. There was mainly some light/medium malt flavor and a kick of hops at the end, a tiny bit of sweetness. Pretty full mouth. Had hints of other flavors, both good and bad.
Cannette 500 ml. 5%. Couleur jaune or, mousse blanche. Arôme de maïs et céréales. Goût doux de céréale, malt et peu d’amertume. Finale conformiste...mais j’aime bien cette bière..

640ml bottle at 4.8%.  Pours light gold with a medium frothy head.  Aroma is ginger malt and a touch of soap.  Taste is a bit sweet to start.  Malt and corn in the finish with a sweet aftertaste.  Better then most.

Bottle.  Tried for the novelty of a Singapore beer, presumed it was probably owned by a much larger corporation, and it is, Henieken.  Pours  your standard, crappy mainstream straw-gold pale lager color with a white head.  Very much like Heineken, a bit sweeter than say, the pale lager schlock they push in the States, dull, boring, uninspired, watery, more or less garbage, but didn’t expect much from corporate pablum in the first place.

Now this brew really took me by surprise! It poured up a clear amber-colored body with a nice frothy head that dissipated quickly to thin sheen with minimal lacing. Aromas were of the usual malts/hops (hey, it’s an adjunct!) but nothing overbearing or skunky. It has a sweet malty taste with a nice bite of hops at the end. A crisp, clean finish with no harsh aftertastes. Light bodied and extra smooth on the quaff! I would pick this ANY time over the US mass producers (e.g. Miller, Coors, etc.).
Bottle at Minneapolis Beer Fest. Light pour, bland and boring. Out of all the pale lagers in the world, this is one of them.
best beer in Singapore..although a little light but good for most occasions.

(Bottle, London City Airport, 24 July 2011) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with notes of white bread, grain and hay. Fairly neutral. Malty taste with grain, bread and hints of grass. Neutral and fairly sweet. Medium body, low bitterness. Drinkable but boring.

bottle bought in the UK brewed in Edinburgh. light grain aroma, I cant smell any hopclear, pale, white foam, rocky head, lightly bitter, light sweetness but sweet body rule here., light body, thin feel, average carbonation, classic "eurolager"  nothing special ..drinkable for mass crowd
Pale yellow pour with small head. Typical pale lager corn aroma smell and taste. No bitterness and slight sweet malty taste. Not very memorable, like i said typical pale lager.
one of the asian lagers, very light, innofensive, dry, with a touch of hops, but again, nothing special.

Bland, watery beer without much taste is about all one can say about this beer. It is nice that one can taste the beers of the world without having to go to the source but why something of this quality would get shipped halfway accross the world is beyond me.

Bottle poured pale golden color with white head dissipating quickly and very sporadic lacing.  Aroma is grainy.  Taste is light malt sweetness with a mild hop presence.  Light to medium body and lively carbonation give this beer an easy drinkability.
500ml can. Another generic Asian style lager, which is to say that it is nice in warm weather and with spicy food, but nothing terribly unique or interesting here.
Bottle. Nothing distinct  here. Clear and crisp, probably refreshing on a hot day.

Pale yellow body with a small, short-lived head. Fair lacing. Sweet fruity aroma with some canned corn. Medium plus sweet malty taste, very light bitterness. Flavours are sweet malty, but in a much more pleasant way than the aroma led me to believe. Lively carbonation, thin plus body, close to oily texture. Not that bad, actually. 

[33 cl bottle, from ICA Hasle, Oslo]
Drank in Thailand-- Tiger is somewhere between Leo and Beer Lao in drinkability. Not a terrible chemical taste like Chang or Singha, but it is still there. Had it on draft and it wasn’t terrible.
Not much in the aroma really, it has a slight industrial edge to it, other than that not horrendous, just a pale lager.
Average pilsener in every way: yellow / golden color, ok smell and taste and nothing special. Ordinary lager: taste, rate, forget.

Das Aroma hält sich etwas zurück, dennoch ist es sehr ausgewogen, sehr süffig. 	 
Test vom 14.9.2004, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 9,9,13,12,10,11 - 10,90

Bottle at Lebowski’s. Blonde lager with a decent white head. Bitter caramel and malt aroma. Flavours of malt, caramel and yeast. Mild bitterness with a lingering yeasty bitter finish. Moderate carbonation. Not too bad.

The best beer in thailand.
Taste: good, better than others you can find in the region.
Expensive than the other, more than the quality.

The beer pours a pale yellow color with a white head. The aroma is very faint. I get a little bit of unattractive grain notes in the aroma but that is about it. The flavor is very sweet with some malt and grain notes. Not real hops character, but at least there are not any real "off" flavors. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Not a beer I will try again.

Yeah my rating is all over the place. I don’t really understand this beer. The smell can only be described by different. I can’t really explain why I like it but I really like the malt taste and the finish is just bitter enough to enjoy.
Probably the best beer that’s readily available in Thailand.  Instead of an ill aftertaste, it just has no taste at all.  Drank in a 355ml bottle in Ko Tao, Thailand
Bottle, brought by someone from Thailand. Golden color with medium white head. hops, grass, grain in aroma. Taste, grain, bitter hops, some fruitiness. Nice bitter finish. Drinkable.

Refrigerated beer poured into a shaker.  Pours a clear pale yellow with one and a half inch head that dissapates fairly quickly.  Very little lacing.light body, and watery texture.  Taste is corn malt.  Won’t seek out again.
Bottle. Standard lager aroma, taste turns dry rather quickly after initial sweet flavour, okay.
a decent beer. would definetly drink it again. tastes similar to most lagers.
Really not happy with this.beer tasted cheap not worth buying so won’t b wasteing my money on it again

Burk. Det är svårt att skriva något meningsfullt om Tiger eftersom den inte är det. Smaken suddas ut från minnet som ett streck i sanden. Den är en provkarta över det medelmåttiga ölets samtliga egenskaper. Skulle säkerligen vinna priser i en tävling för festivalöl.

Flaske: Lysegul klar øl med et pænt skumhoved. Let duft af makro lager, men dog kendelig, og minder mig meget om tiden i Vietnam for 13 år siden, så lidt distinkt er den dog. Fin og drikbar, men kedelig.
Can. A golden yellow colour with a fine white head. A light malt aroma with notes of hops. A medium sweet taste. Light body and medium carbonation. A fresh beer in the sun.
Bottle. Pours a clear yellow with a small disappearing white head. Aroma has notes of malt and grain. Taste is light sweet. Palate is watery, carbonation is soft.

330ml bottle in a Chinese restaurant. Clear, straw yellow with a fair amount of fizz & a small, mostly fading white head. Overall a grain and light fruit aroma. Typical lager characteristics overall, really - quite grainy and directionless. Finishes slightly dry with a light, short bitteress. Light body, medium to full carbonation.
I wasn’t impressed with this Asian beer. More flat then round. I had it at an Asian cuisine restaurant.

Bottle. Pale golden, big creamy head.  Smells mostly of malts with hints of herbs and grass. Taste is quite malty with a little too much sweetness. Some dryness in mouth, Finish is lightly hop bitter. Easy forgettable pale lager

This is a watery, slightly yellow type beer of no real distinguishing characteristics and is similar to the watery, cheap, budget brands of large brewers in the US.  Virtually no aroma.  Is palatable with nothing offensive about it but bland with nothing to really make it stand out.  Similar to Busch Light beer.
Pure Drainpour. Only bought for the tick. Aroma of funky apple juice. Pours slightly darker than urine. No real taste to speak of. Bleh!
No formaldehyde in this beer and that deserves much praise. I liked it for what it is. It has a different taste to it that I can’t quite figure out.

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain and hay. Taste is light sweet. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.
nice appearance and pretty good aroma. Even has lots of flavour. Problem is the flavour isn’t all that great.  Definitely drinkable but not really worth going out of your way to find.
Not bad for the style, an easy drinkable beer.  Nothing really special, typical macro larger.  I know this beer has won some awards in beer tastings.

Can. Mount Albert, Ontario, Canada.
World acclaimed same thing as everything else! In truth, this isn’t such a bad beer. I love it when traveling in Asia, just not a big fan of pale lager when I can have a beer of my choice. Nice orange nose, which is pleasant. Very light pour. Small head. Spicy notes, which make it better than most pale lagers. Ultra smooth, very light. As good or better than most pales.
11.2oz bottle.  Looks light.  Aroma of light toasted malts and a little hops, more than most beers this style.  Flavor decent for a pale lager.  Light texture.  Worth trying.
A pale lager bought on can in Krabi, Thailand. Citrus and grass in taste. Minimal head.

This beer pours a medium orange color with a light orange head that doesn’t last that long.

This smells very orangy, but not overpowering in any way. Has light notes of spice and lemon.

This beer tastes very nice, its smooth to drink but almost too drinkable, like a session beer but I don’t think that’s the intention. This taste is orangy but that goes quickly to some light hopes and a nice bitter end. Overall very good.

Pours with a pale golden color, culminating in a very modest head with very little retention. Overall, the appearance is fair, but nothing worth texting a friend over. The caliber of the nose is about the same as the appearance: fair, but sleepy, with hints of malt and grass. Again, the taste is consistent with the nose and the adjunct flavoring really comes through. That said, it’s not a bad tasting brew – mildly bitter in the front and lightly sweet in the finish – but it is , in reality, nothing at all special and, if I were going to drink a pale lager, there are plenty of others out there that are far better.
Pale beer with a light aroma. Tastes grassy with a somewhat fruity aftertaste.
bottle in Thailand, good normal beer, nice aroma , easy to drink.  very popular in asia.
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet and light malty. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Finished sweetish. Soft and thin bodied. 161210
Pours clear yellow with white head, aroma has notes of grass, floral, and some biscuit.  Taste is some spice, bread, grass and floral hops, and a dry clean finish.  Not bad for the style!
Bottle.  With a Malaysian meal on a hot summer’s day this was the perfect compliment.  Golden lager, crystal clear with big boffy white head.  Crisp ’lagery’ flavour, slightly buttery, dry finish.

A clean, yellow color with a low white head. Aroma has a light fruity and flowery nose to go with the mild graininess. Flavor has a light sweet grainy flavor and mild grassy hops bite to it. Crisp feeling, very bubbly and finishes slightly dry. Honestly not too bad of a brew as I could see it going good with almost any type of meal.

I was not sure what to expect from this one.  It is a light yellow with moderate white head that has a bit of taying power and medium carbonation.  I picked up some malt tones, but not much more.  There is a little bite to this beer, but something tasted off in the 2 out of the bottle that I had.  The mouthfeel was a bit thin and the flavors faded away rather quickly.

Tiger on keltainen ja läpinäkyvä olut. Sen vaahto on valkoista. Sen tuoksu on maltainen, hedelmäinen ja pahvinen. Maultaan olut on pahvinen, hieman metallinen ja yrttisen humaloitu. Karhea ja vetinen olut.
Meh. There’s little more to say other than that, but the comment needs to contain 75 characters.
Bottle 330ml. Pale yellow colour. Aroma and flavour as to be expected from a mass produced major lager. An average beer.

640 mL bottle at home poured into a pint glass.  Brewed under license so not the real stuff.  Orange/yellow fairly flat lager (not complaining about it being flat).  Ok head.  Typical malty lager aroma.  Tastes plain and metallic on first sip.  Very disappointing bland beer, insipid.  Oh dear.

Pours standard lager yellow.  There is a fizzy white head that forms, and sticks around a little longer than most lagers.  Not much aroma, some wheat, some straw, and a weird sweet sticky rice smell.  Flavor is fresh grains, sweet malts, and a fresh, clean slightly hoppy finish.  There is not much to this beer, as with many lagers - but it’s just a good clean beer.  There is nothing I would rather be drinking while enjoying some Pho.
When me or my friends are forced to chug a beer when it sucks and is undrinkable we consider it "Tigering". That pretty much sums up this one.

(bottle, 4/9/10). Clear gold color. Large white head. Light malty/grain aroma. Sweet biscuit malt flavor. Avg duration. Smooth, light dry finish. Slick/creamy texture. Moderate carbonation. Fair lacing.
Had this beer at tai me kong in Graham. A very good medium beer. Pours great with medium head

Bottle.  Poured a gold color with a robust white head. Nose of grassy hops with a hint of corn.  Thin to medium bodied with light carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Moderate carbonation.  Flavor is pale malt sweetness and light bitter. The finish is  dry, and the bitter remains . Rather clean overall and basically a crisp refreshing drink Best cold of course. .Almost a pilsener,

Clear golden yellow with plenty of tiny bubbles racing up my pilsner glass. Decent bright white head that dissipated to nothing and left no lace. Very modest grainy malt aroma and taste, little hops bitterness. Very bland, but inoffensive, and in the end is actually a bright refreshing drink.

Tiger Beer has a thick, white head and a very clear, golden appearance, with lots of tiny bubbles streaming up the glass.  The aroma is initially of over-ripe fruit, but this quickly dissipates, and is replaced by an ordinary beer smell.  The taste is quite bready, and a light hop spice rounds out the flavor.  Mouth-feel is medium, and Tiger Beer finishes very dry and refreshing.  Overall, this is an interesting and enjoyable lager.  I think it’s worth trying out.

Pours clear golden with a decent fluffy white head leaving some lacing. Aroma is sweet malty, hay and slightly caramel. Crispy perry mouthfeel. Flavor is sweet, hoppy and artificially fruity. Watery perry palate. Finishes watery shortlived bitter.
Earlier Rating: 3/13/2010 Total Score: 1.3
Basic Thai pilsner with some charisma, but nothing to get excited about. OK for a lunch or dinner.

Bottle @ home.  Pours a light pale yellow and clear appearance with an off-white head.  Quite grainy pale malts in the nose, somewhat like the nose of a Budweiser.  Grainy and pretty light body, possibly from the addition of rice.  Smooth, not very bitter and easy drinking.  Good Pale Lager.

24th January 2008 
 An imported bottle from Singapore. Smooth and slightly flat lager. Softish palate. No bitterness. Trace of caramel. Really not that bad!

Can. Pours light golden yellow with average white head.  Aromas of hops and spices. Taste is similar but watery and weak. Also has a clean aftertaste.  Overall it will quench your thirst but doesn’t stand out.

Date: 3/6/2010   Source:Other   Lightly grainy with spicy hop aroma. Clear light golden with small white head. Medium body and mouth feel. Finish is medium and lightly bitter with a touch of honey like notes. Slightly papery but drinkable.
Nice beer from Asia. Bought in a China Town Store. Good beer, one of the better Asia beers. Maybe a little bit sweet an easy drinkable lager.

Pours very clear yellow with medium-small head. Aroma is bready. Taste lightly hoppy and a bit grainy and malty. Some sweet notes. Very little bitterness and very mild. Finish is ok, very mild but slightly pleasant for a lager. Point for being not too watery though. light bodied with light carbonation. Overall a avarage alger. Not bad but not special in any way.
33 cl flaske. Gylden farve med lille hvidt hovede, Aroma af lys malt. Smag sødlig smag af sukker mejs med en lille note af citrus. Afslutning med et minimum af bitterhed.
Clear yellow, malty with some hops, nearly. Not offensive but no standout to me. A little more than usual for a Pale Lager.

Clear golden pour from bottle with very little head.  Aroma and taste is malty, with notes of bread and grain.  Not much else here.  Just like you don’t find your best pizza in Korea or your favorite tacos in Yemen, you can’t expect to find your favorite beer in Singapore!!

Has a light malt & hops scent. Smells like your typical lager with a hint of grain.

A light yellow lager that is very clear & forms an average sized bubbly head that disappears fast. Little evidence of carbonation with this one.

Again a typical lager with a slight grainy taste. It has a nice sweet taste though.

Thin bodied with a very slight tang.

A nice run of the mill lager although it is slightly watery. A good session beer none the less that goes down very easily.

See more at abarwithnoname.wordpress.com

pours clear gold color with white head reminiscent of macro beers.  Aroma is corn malt, but with a light, subtle floral hoppy aspect which is not bad.  Flavor is pretty smooth, clean, and crisp, with a small bitter bite.  Although this beer is wholly uninteresting I couldn’t find any outright bad flavors in it, unlike alot of american macros, so it gets points for that.  However, there is a slight staleness to the finish.
Pours straw with thin white head and minimal lacing.  Notes of hay and grass.  Balanced taste that is weak.  Thin on the palate.
Can. Pours small malty head. Taste is of malt. Wow, malt. mmmm malt. mmmm. Basement aromas.
Very malty, aroma of malt, first thought when tasting is hmm this is malty.

On tap, Rainbar, Papamoa, served very cold.  Medium golden hue with a thin white bubbly quickly diminishing head.  Very little aroma - some maize/grain, hay, stale hops. Medium sweetness, light bitter in the finish. Medium body.  I had this after running around on a hot afternoon so it was quite refreshing.  I have had it previously and thought it was fairly average.
0.33l bottle. Light yellow beer with lots of carbonation. Nose is fresh and fruity. Does not taste much, but its a refreshing lager that knows how to kill your thirst.
birria de singapur - check.  al menos en cantidad de paises creo que ahora si me puedo llevar un premio
On flight avoiding Typhoon, somewhere over South China Sea. Light golden and gassy. Big head that disappears fast.

Superlight colour with a white foam
Aroma; Tropical fruit and corn. Not a very big nose
Flavour; Corn, no hops but a little bitternes. Short and unbalanced

Rating 439, can, gift from Ingerlis 
 


Well, the pouring started out with supporting my impressions of any asian lager, with revealing a pale golden beer at first, but then the head was formed into a relatively dense and long-lasting creation compared to many other macrolagers. Aroma has a bit of spicyness from hops, and not so much of the often overrepresented sour lager malts. On the other hand, I sense a bit of maize in it - I hope this is not shining through in the flavor. Do I smell some caramel too? The beer starts out sweet and more heavy than many other macrolagers, even with traces of caramel, but then a bit maize comes through - not ruining in any way, though. The finish is mild hops and mild caramel. Palate is quite medium, not thin, but not thick either, just as well as it is not creamy, but neither watery. Well, this is the best asian lager I have had, but it is not magnificent in any way.
Light straw color; Light to medium body; Aroma of light malt, & grain; Flavor of slight sweet malt, hops, and some grain; Fairly bland; Overall, average lager with a little character.
Pours pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, butterscotch and DMS. Flavour follows the nose.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a clear and pale yellow beer with a weak white head. The aroma is diacetyl, some vegetables (DMS) and malt. The flavor is close to the nose. The palate is malty and dry. Overall a beer below average.

A - Lightly fruity with hay and cereals
A - Light and clear, with thin white head
T - Light sweetness with dry bitter finish
P - Thin with ample, but soft carbonation
O - A good lager

330 ml bottle. Rated @ 24.9.2009.

Clear yellow colour with a white head. Lager style on the nose and on the flavour. Nothing else. Next.

500 ml can from LCBO.  Pours a clear yellow gold with moderate-sized white head.  Aroma of corn syrup and some grass.  Taste of almost apple juice, quite sweet, with corn and a light grassy bitterness.  Slightly sticky mouthfeel but rather thin body.  Crap.

0.35 bottle. Surprised to find this tasted better than expected after pouring it in the glass, as the head looked like a disaster. A bit bitter taste, which fits well. Nothing more special, an average lager that tastes better than it looks, which I guess is better than the other way around.
0,3 liter fles. Goedbier geen speciale smaak. duidelijk uit de Heineken stal.

Can. Funny thing is its cheaper in Canada then in Singapore.. thought it tastes better there.. I attribute that to the 90%+ humidity.. Deep straw color..  Lots of fizz.. minor head.. a little bit of sweet..Mostly wet hay.. no hops in the taste.. finish is clean and light Very boring.. very below average.. drink only when in Singapore

330 ml can. Pale golden colour. Medium-sized white head that clings to the glass. Floral hop aroma. Crisp malty aromas as well. Light-bodied- Smooth carbonation, but refreshing hop flavours. The hops are perhaps a little heavy on the metal. Pretty much like an average euro-pilsener. Not at all exciting, but a little better than most south-asian pale lagers.
bottle and tap. nothing great about this one, although i do rate a bit higher than a lot of the macro pale lagers. slight hints of honey and spice.

People don’t know what they’re talking about. This is a great beer, and especially a great pale lager. It’s certainly better than Sapporo.

Or maybe I just love it because I grew up drinking it in Singapore...
But then again, it has won over 40 awards and accolades, so I guess some people on here simply don’t recognize a good beer when they come across one. 
Pity.

For what it is, it isn’t that bad. I like the bottle/ label, they put some time into that, wayto go. This is what 90% of the worls drinks, euro-lagers, and this one is about average.
A- light golden, with little to no head.
S - sweet, clean, with a little fizz on the end.
T - easy to drink, your not getting this and showing up at a beer tasting and saying "check me out".
M - easy to drink, once again.
D - very drinkable, that’s why there are so many version of this out there. These beer do what they are set out to do, feed the masses in said country, let marketing do the work. 
I wouldn’t mind having this again, BBQ, picnic, beer promo at a bar.

Clear, yellow, good head.  Aroma is industrial lagerness.  Ugh.  Taste of a beer that has yet to figure out how to use enough rice additives to hide the taste.  Finish that doesn’t go away fast enough.  On one hand, I hate having a beer to tick it off the list.  On the other hand, it’s nice having a beer that makes one reflect on what a good beer actually is.
Pale lager... about the same as most pale lagers.... that’s about all there is
Nice yellow colour, almost no head. Aroma is very light, slightly yeasty. Flavour is very dull and light, tiny hop bite to it. Not much to say typical Aisian lager.

This is fairly plain asian pale lager but the flavour is a bit nicer than most. It’s not great and it’s definately one for the hotter days, but you could do worse. I remember mocking my buddy for proclaiming this an ok beer by the ’gold medals’ on the label, but it might actually have won something back in the day.

500ml can. Pours pale straw yellow, crystal clear with white head that leaves zero lacing. Smells like faintly hoppy apple juice. Tastes like almost nothing with a very slight bitter finish and a little funk in the mix. I wouldn’t even call it refreshing.
Just so frakin boring.  Seriously why would you grab this beer over any of the other lagers at the grocery store?  It just doesn’t offer much at all.
Nothing special but definitely drinkable. The finish has slight hop bitterness which I prefer over the sweetness of some pale lagers. Sampled in Vietnam.

Pale golden pour, small head.
Aroma of corn syrup, grains, caramel.
Flavour is the same, too sweet, artificial and boring.
Bottle. Pale, with a small head. Dry, nothing special. Tasted good with my thai food in Brighton. Should’t drink another one.
paper-thin body and a very watery and highly carbonated feel, nose of lemon and hops, taste of apricot (I think) and malt

A clear light gold pour with frothy fast fading white head. Scent is musty. Taste is crisp but bland cereal. Probably better than Koala urine not that I would know. In all seriousness the more I drink the less I like. What is that aftertaste??

500mL Can from LCBO. Clear pale yellow pour with a bubbly white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is sweet, faint malts, grasses. Taste is initially sweet, apples. Faint malt, zero hoppiness. Medium carbonation Plain Jane euro-style lager, from Singapore.
clear golden body, light and crisp. nice carbonation. not much aroma. some citrus notes. a decent Asian beer.
12 oz Bottle -- Pours gold with a thin white head.  Aromas of hay, honey, and mild hops.  Quite clean and refreshing.  No off flavors or skunk.

Asia Pacific Breweries Pte. Ltd.--Tiger Gold Medal Lager Beer--1999 21.6 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (3.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Clear light bright straw color.  Crisp light hoppy front.  Light textured smooth slightly sweet body.  Light fruit flavor.  Minimal hops in refreshing clean finish.  Flavorful, smooth, and light.  Sampled 10/4/1999.

Asia Pacific Breweries Co., Ltd.--Tiger Gold Medal Lager Beer--Chinese--2003 11.2 oz. Bottle.  4.75% AABV.  (3.5 / 5.0)  Clear thin bright light golden color.  Tangy mild floral hop front.  Smooth mild butter caramel crisp malt body.  Mild hop end.  Adjunct hints.  Thin laceless head.  Mild sweetness.  Flavorful but still quite mild.  Sampled 7/31/2003.

Asia Pacific Breweries PTE Ltd.--Tiger Gold Medal Premium Lager Beer--2005 11.2 oz. Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  25 IBU’s?  (4.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Mild lace white head.  Clear Bright yellow gold color.  Crisp floral Pils front.  Tangy mild butter caramel slightly creamy flavorful all malt Pils Pale Lager body.  Zesty mild citrus hop spice refreshing end.  Sampled 3/21/2007.
Bottle from Tesco. Mild aroma of cereal & corn. Pale golden yellow colour, good head. Dry bland cereal grain flavour. Watery. Uninteresting international lager.

500 ml can - pours very clear pale yellow with a initially thick, but short-lived white head.  Very sweet aroma, pale malt, cereals, sugar, touch of grass.  Flavour sweet again, metallic edge, touch of corn, maybe from pale malt.  Standard, nondescript canned import lager.

500 ml can from LCBO, served cold in a Scotch Irish taster glass. 



App.:  Clear light golden with a minimal white film.
  
Aroma:  Light, sweet and fruity, hay/grass/cereal, apple juice, fairly plain.
  
Palate:  Macro medium body and carbonation.
  
Flav.:  Like the nose, a fairly restrained blend of light fruitiness, apple juice, cereal, wet hay and a touch of grassiness; some not bad biscuit malts on swallowing, with no bitterness and a fairly short-lived finish.



It ain’t awful for a pale lager.
Poured from can. Light straw colour with weak fizzy head. Grassy aroma. Very watered down lager flavor. Nothing offensive mind you, but just weak and plain with nothing to show for itself.
Bottle. Pours clear pale golden colored with a small creamy white head. Aromas of malt, grassy hops and vegetables. Flavors of pale malt, mild hops, grain and grass. Better than expected.

Another "international lager" up for rating. Pours a light, clear, wishy-washy orange with virtually no head. Smell is sweet malts with hints of cardboard. Taste is, as expected, not good. A slightly too oily palate reveals some vague malts and a touch of overcooked vegetables. Tiger lager is obviously another tossed-together macrobeer with the usual intent of getting people drunk and selling exclusively on fancy marketing. Only reason it doesn’t get the absolute bottom is that it’s not directly bad, merely absent of all good qualities. Dare I say kind of a "sweet water"? Yes, I think I do.

0,33 literes kiszerelés. Szép a habja, mint a keményre felvert tojás fehérjének, alatta a test aranyos (világos) citrom színű. Illatában kellemes a gabonák jelenléte, mely mellett egy kis élesztő is kiérződik. Elsőre komlós, kissé pörkölt kávés íz, mely meglep a szín után. Ezek az ízek (még talán halványan a kukorica is van) persze nem túl erősek, mert az szinte egyáltalán nincs neki. Olyan ez az egész, mintha egy enyhén ízesített ásványvízzel találkoztam volna.

Clear yellow pour with a white head. Aroma of lager yeast, cereal grains. Taste was suprisingly nice. I know I should avoid looking at ratings previous to tasting. It was crisp, cereal grains, tasty. Above average, worth a second try.

3.5.2010. Bottle. Poured Clear pale golden with a small, frothy white head. Aroma is weak of corn and vegetables. Flavor is honey and corn. Drinkable, quite refreshing. 
Rerate: 7.4.2011. 4.6% Poured pale golden with a thin white head. Weak fruity aroma. Flavor is semisweet, corn and malt, hint of bitterness in finish. Very light. Quite refreshing, this time little better points, mostly the overall score.
Bottle from Total Wine. Typical beer for the night. Yellow clear, watery, almost no aroma, this and bland. There was a mild sweet finish but all in all weak.
At an asian shop in Zaandam, bottle 330ml, clear golden, little head, no rice contain, rare for an asian, lots of hopbitter, very little taste and watery finish.
A pale golden beer with a good size head that takes 1 minute to fall. The aroma was grains-thats it. The taste was the same and is another basic tasting pale lager. Yawn
330ml bottle. Clear yellowish body with thin white head. Boring taste and aroma.
Bottle 330ml. Not my thing, offensive. Sulfur aroma, with some straw. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness. Highly carbonated, with a thin body. Yellow, with a thin head that doesn’t last.
Fairly good international lager, the version I drunk was 4.8% and brewed under licence in Edinburgh, I would buy this again and it went well with the chinese beef and noodle soup I made

11.2oz bottle.  Pours a pale light golden color with a white head.   Aroma is light with notes of grain, hay and grassy hops.  The flavor is similar its aroma, not sweet and not too bitter.  Nothing distinguishable.
Canette de 500ml achetée à la LCBO, bière dorée claire, très limpide, peu de mousse, arôme de grain, très frais au nez, léger goût malté, peu de houblon présent, désaltérante, agréable sans plus.
I taste banana in this one, which is good because I like that. Other than that your average pale lager. one I would have more often in Asia if I were there.

[2798-20100309] 500mL can. Sweet toasted corn aroma. Clear, yellow brown body with a quick foamy white head and quick tiny centralized bubbles. Toasted corn and grainy gritty hay yeast flavour. Medium body. Fair.

(From LCBO-Summerhill, Toronto, ON)
Slightly better than most pales but still pretty weak. Bit more body too. Refreshing but nothing complex.

(Can) Yellow with white, quickly diminishing, head. Soft aroma, hints of malt. A bit crispier flavor, not real bitterness though. Thin feel. Mostly just refreshing. Leaves quite positive feelings, I would have no problem ordering this if I wanted a beer in Southeast Asia.

330 ml bottle.  Pours a clear, golden yellow with a decent, collapsing, white head.  Taste is of malt, grass, some caramel and hops.  Similar aroma.  Thin body that is a little watery.  Slightly sweet, a little dry and a mildly bitter.  Easy to drink and rather refreshing, but not worth the price.

Bottle on 02/23/2010. Clear pale golden body with a small frothy white head. Sweet corn and honey aroma. Sweet honey flavor, light malt, and a bit of corn. Medium light body with moderately high carbonation.
Thanks to maniac. Pours a clear yellow.  Nose is sweet and a hint grassy.  Pretty much what I expected, but a little better.  I’d drink this over a bud.

Bottle in Singapore 2007. 

I did notice that it went quite well with the food. The beer was rather sweet with some grains and citrus. Not that bad but of course not a masterpiece.
Bottled. A light yellow with thin but lasting head. A nice spicy lager. Aroma is plain grainy smell but lightly spiced. Flavor is sweet then bigger hoppiness and spice to end a refreshing clean brew.

Bottle.  Pours a super pale gold body with a thin white fizzy lace thats dying to disappear.   Grain, corn, vegetative, light apple like notes, and a crisp expired cider note.  Grain, cardboard and hay with a chemical butter like finish.  Light thin simple, you know this story i’m sure.

No real aroma, fizzy yellow with a touch of head.  Good solid taste with a hint of bitterness, palate is quite complex given its a pale lager.  Overall I might just grab one of these over the domestic boys.
Light, yellow with slight green tinge color.  Sweet taste of mostly corn with some grainy taste.  For a pale lager, not bad.

In Scotland 2005!
AP: wage golden body, medium high white head. AR: hops, rice paper. F: fresh hops, some sweetness.

Can, 5,0% Thai testing 2010-02-06, Göteborg
Brewed at Thai Asia Pacific Brewery ID, 8850571831334
AP: pie colored body, no head
AR: appel core, 
F: much better body then the rest of the thai beers, some citrus, some sweetness

Brewed in Thailand under license from Singapore.Poured yellow with a small, quickly fading, white, foamy head. Not bad with spicy food, but not much of beer. Little malt flavor, probably corn. Very average.
500 ml can.  Pours pale yellow, large frothy white head.  Aroma is light sweet corny lager.  Taste is similar.  Decent with Asian food!
Pale golden wit thick white head that dissapates. Taste is sweet and light bitter. Light body. Watery texture. Brand leader in Singapore. Bottle in Singapore September 2007.

(bu-can, Asia Pacific Breweries, 5%)



yw-lcnt, ^co2, §head, §bitter T1 T2, musty T3, ~thru.
Very pale yellow-white, clean loose white foam.  Harsh adjunct aroma, metal, corn, sweet, grassy.  Taste is cleaner, sweet corn, a bit metallic but not harsh.

Pours yellow/gold with a small head that fades to nothing.
Aroma is a mix of grainy malt and cooked corn.
Flavours are very similar, with overly sweet cooked vegetables and a weak boring bitterness.
Carbonation is way too strong, and the body is very watery.

Pretty typical Asian lager, bits of corn and rice floating around in nose and aroma with a little bit of hop bite and some biscuit maltiness floating around. Not the worst pale lager I’ve ever had, but not something I’d drink regularly either.

330ml Bottle:  Aroma of grains, corn, slight hops, and lager yeast.  Poured pale yellow/gold in color with a small, white head that diminished but lasted around the edges.  Clear.  Very sparkling.  Flavor is slightly sweet and lightly bitter.  Tastes of malts, lager yeast, and a hint of hops.  Light to medium body.  Slightly dry texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Grain, and slight hop finish.  Quite tasteless.
330 ML bottle in Pakistan. Golden color and a thick white head fates quikley. Thin and weak. sweet aroma and taste, watery palate.

Pours pale golden color with a big white head that diminishes quickly but leaves a creamy top.
Aroma is malty with lots of cereal grains, hay and sweet syrupy odours. Decent.
Flavor is weak-ish, with slight bitterness and sweetness without much character. Not worlds apart from a Corona and sweeter and less herbal than a Stella Artois. 
Light body, refreshing, watery texture. A summer lager with crispness but not a beer to get too excited about.

12 ounce bottle from Whole Foods Market Charlottesville, VA. Pours a clear pale golden color with a large frothy head. Aroma is grain, lots of rice and a slight musty, sweaty vibe. Taste is sweet creamed corn and lightly grassy hops. Thin-medium bodied.
bottle - Zurich airport. Typical asian brew, good for washing down food in a restaurant, no more no less.

Bottle. Golden colored, white head. Aroma is lightly grainy, with some unpleasant pale lager notes, almost piss. Flavour is about the same, quite sweet and a bit of artificial banana. Lots of carbonation. Eew. Hard to drink.

33cl Can on airplane to Singapore. Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of sweetness, grain, piss and alcohol. Flavour is grassy, alcohol, grain, sharp, sweet finish. Light to medium bodied. Tastes very artificial, just bad stuff.
Bottle@Home. Grainy aroma with faint hops. Pale yellow colour, irregular white head, fair lace. Very grainy and light bitter. But that’s it.
another Asian "beer" I would not classify as a beer and highly recommend you never try.  No mystery why it’s bought by Asians, but no idea why Europeans, Aussies, or Americans buy it.

Bottle. Medium-gold with little head and no retention. Slightly sour cereal aroma is similar to Efes. Is nasty, whiffs of a dank sewage-ridden canal. Flat palate. Pretty putrid beer with some metallic notes. Very hard to get through!

12 oz. bottle at Fergburger in Queenstown, New Zealand.  Pours pale gold with a medium white head.  Very light aroma of grains, grass, malt, and maybe a pinch of hops.  The flavor follows suit and isn’t much to speak of.  Watery, with active carbonation but not a ton.  For its purpose, this one is just fine- inoffensive, non-skunky, and smoother than a lot of other cheap pale lagers.  Washed down my big tasty Fergburger well.
Boring curry fodder, undercarbonated with hints of rotting vegetables. Wouldn’t want to drink it *not* with a spicy meal. Vague sense of an earthy hop character.

Pours a clear straw yellow. 
Nose is weak, mostly light lager yeast nose and cut grass. 
Taste is run of the mill, clean flavors, dry, slight residual sweetness, hint of floral hops, not much grain flavor, very drinkable.
Pours a clear golden yellow with a foamy white head. Grainy aroma with some light grassy hops. Flavor is similar, but clean and satisfying. Not too shabby.

33 cl bottle, at Flat Top Grill, Lombard, IL. I’m adding some far-flung countries to my Geo Stats this month. And maybe because the bottle has been in a restaurant cooler instead of spending months on a grocery store shelf, or maybe because I’m drinking it with hot and spiced-up stir-fry, but this makes a good impression. Straw colored lager puts on an entertaining bubble dance when poured. Smell shows no obvious defects, just some light malts. Taste to me is quite passable. Wouldn’t be surprised to find it’s lightened with rice, but I couldn’t detect any adjuncts. Just some light malts and a low level bitterness, delivered with a slightly fizzy mouthfeel. Went down nicely, although a spicy stir-fry might cover a host of sins.
Bottle from Majestic at Eastchase and I-30.  Well, it’s an Asian pale lager.  Okay.
metal and rotten vegetables, its yellow, tastes like rotten vegetables, leaves a burn down the throat like most malt liquors dont even, wow fuck off tiger

Presentation: It was poured from a brown bottle into a Pilsener glass.

Appearance: The body has a pale light golden color with very good clarity. Its head is fairly thick, frothy and bright white in color. The head hangs on well as it slowly fades down to just a thin cap and makes some lacing on the glass along the way.

Smell: Its aroma is light and simple with notes of light grain, hay and grassy hops. 

Taste/Mouth: The flavor is similar its aroma, not sweet and not too bitter. It has a clean and mellow grainy malt character with just a light grassy hop taste on the finish. The palate is very drinkable with a medium body, smooth wet texture and average carbonation.

Notes: Overall its not bad at all for a pale lager.

Pours quite nicely, clear, sparkling, golden. Smells like corn, a bit ugly smelling. Aftertaste is very metallic, with a hint of chemicals, I think I’m becoming overly sensitive to preservatives in macros... Very light flavour up front of corn and adjuncts, very smooth palate with a sharp and short metallic aftertaste. Very mediocre.
Pours a pale gold with quickly fading white head. Aroma malt, some fruit, and hops. Flavor a bity of hops and slight sweetness. A very drinkable beer with some hot Thai food.

bottle, pours light gold with a medium white head.  Aroma is wheaty with light malt and hay.  Flavor is watery and bland, but again some wheat and corn.  Mild bitterness in the finish, but all in all boring.
33cl bottle. Clear yellow body with small white head. Flavour is malt and a little bitter.
Golden coloured with small head. Malty taste which wasn’t strong and finish was nothing special. This beer just didn’t have much of anything which is why I can’t recommend it.

Overall Impression:
One of those beers that can only be described as "Ok, but hardly memorable"
A so-so beer; I didn’t find it as repellant as some of the other reviewers but it was nothing spectacular.  Appearance and taste were okay, but not as good as Singha, for example.
gold blond coloured little sparkling body with a white head a little herby spicy aroma a herby spicy bitter taste with a bitter finish
Clear goldblond coloured beer with small white head and lots of carbonation. Sweet herby and spicy aroma. Full palate, slightly sparkling. Finish is very bitter.
Really not to bad for your plain old simple pale lager.  Typical profile, but easy to drink and nice.
Weak malty aroma. Golden yellow colour witjh nice white head. Surprisingly sweet taste with some hops. Nothing special, but quite allright for a pale lager.

Had in a Thai restaurant (very limited choices) with soup and salad. Typical Asian beer with little color, nose or taste. However, as with a lot of those, it was not overly disgusting either............just a cold way to wash down spicy food.

It’s TIGA TIME!  World acclaimed lager is a definite stretch. It pours a very faint yellow with a decent head to begin with that deflates almost instantly.  It’s the Keystone/Natti Lite of Singapore and tastes about the same.  You will have no trouble finding this anywhere in Singapore.
Smells like chemicals not beer, tastes the same. It was on sale for good reason.
A 0.33L bottle from K-Market. Mild malty and hoppy nose. Pale golden yellow colour. Thin taste with mild hops. Waterly.
Pretty awful, even by Asian lager standards. The only positive thing I can say is that it wasn’t sun struck.
Nothing to enjoy here, just another macro tasteless lager. I wouldn’t recommend spending money on this.
Pretty taken by taste of this beer. Great fizzy head that disappears fast, but tastes great. Smooth going down, with no bitterness or sweetness. Very light after taste.

Canette de 500 ml dégustée chez Bulai Tate of Thai (Port Hope, ONT). Arôme: Légère odeur de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’un large col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de céréales avec une pointe fruitée. Courte durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est mince avec une texture légèrement aqueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #2523)

Pours a light golden yellow color with a small quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is very sweet, honey, floral, grainy, just very sweet. Almost a candy corn like nose. Flavor starts cloyingly sweet, so much so that nothing else really comes to the forefront. Finally gets something else in the middle, unfortunately its just a grainy flavor. Finishes bitter and slightly metallic. Light to medium body and a bubbly carbonation. Not the worst pale lager but  still very bland
Thin lager, lacks the bite and crispness of better Asian lagers.  Not complex, not much of a finish.

sweet, slightly citrusy aroma with a touch of skunkiness. Pour is light amber with minimal head. Flavour is a slightly sweet malt with decent mouthfeel and slight bitter finish. Quite good for a macro.
golden color, little amount of white head.  The taste doesn’t really stand out and falls flat overall.

Draught in Singapore. Clear golden yellow, some head. Subtle sweet malty aroma. Medium body and fizzy. Citrusy foretaste with very little bitterness in finish. Refreshing decent lager, but very unexceptional.

Note-I had this in Singapore, before export, and in Australia after import. The difference was marked.

Pours a bright yellow straw colour. Not much of an aroma, perhaps a little malt and a whiff of fruit. The taste is much better, a light hoppiness and sweetness leading into a soft malt. Crisp. dry and refreshing. It was an amazing partner to the Singapore chilli crab and ginger sting ray flaps on the Singapore waterfront!

330mL bottle: Apperance is golden brown with slow fading white head, aroma of stale malt, flavor slightly skunky some decent qualities in in the malt not as stale tasting as it smelled. Would never buy again but not awful.

Draft - Looks nice, bright straw color. Smells awful - malty, slightly metallic, and some kind of urine-esque skunkiness (and this is @ a bar very close to the brewery, so age shouldn’t be a factor). Taste is actually quite decent, crisp carbonation and a nice combination of sweet and bitter. If you hold your nose, it would probably score several points higher, but the smell is just offensive.

Absolutely nothing exciting about this beer, but it really isn’t too bad.  Decent appearance: straw-colored bosy with almost no head.  Very light aroma leaning towards malt and a hint of skunk.  Medium mouthfeel with a fair amount of carbonation.  Mildly sweet flavor with grain and malt.  A slightly bitter finish.  Totally inoffensive beer that would go well with spicy food, but that’s about it.

You know, before I really started experimenting with beer, I really really liked this. Now it’s just another boring overrated lager. Pours clear and light gold, more towards straw. Poured a very deep head, but i’ll put that on the glass that I was using. But it only lasted a minuite or so. Malt and mild hops, this is the asian version of Hinneykin. Smell and tastes of malt and something cheap, left my mouth dry. Boring - very boring - there’s a million beers out there like this one.
Light yellow color with a pretty decent white head.  Metal and rice describes this beer.  Very plain and also very similar to the American macro brew beers.  Forgettable.

Nicely packaged 330ml brown bottle. A pale yellow lager with a loose disappearing white head. Nose is grainy sweet malt with a very subtle citrus hop presence. Flavour is the same as the nose. Finish is sweet and short lasting. Medium to light bodied with an average carbonation. It goes down well with spicy Asian foods such as a Laksa but that’s about all really.

Pour from 12 oz bottle. Classic pale lager look – mid toned yellow body with decent sized white head.  Faint but pleasant aroma of grain, maybe a whiff of grass.  Not much in the flavor dept – a bit of grain, a little sweetness, maybe a little bitter in the finish. Nothing bad about the taste – no metal, skunk, or decay. But no zest  either.

I always find it difficult to rate beers like this. There wasn’t anything offensive in either the aroma or flavor, but there wasn’t anything good either. If you rate it according to style, it’s probably pretty good. If you rate it hedonistically, you wont think it’s the greatest unless you are a sicko who likes to masterbate with a cheese grater..beercronic. 

So I go out for some incredible Thai food that’s just insane. I get options like Singha, Tsingtao, Bud, and whatever else crappy macro lager they had floating in the back. But I see Tiger and I think, damn..why not? So it comes with a frosted mug and I ask for a non-frosted mug and they look at me like I just asked them to poke them in the ass with my chopsticks. The waitress brings me out a non-frosted mug and I get down to business. The aroma is standard marco Asian lager style...clean with a faint aroma of rice, grass and metal. Flavor is clean with a touch of the metal I picked up in the aroma, with a bit of sweetness. The carbonation was medium, lots of bubbles with a standard piss-yellow color with a frothy head. Easy to drink, easy to forget but I’d probably order it again at that restaurant because it went really well with my food.
Bottle. On the whole, quite inoffensive. When you get it fresh, it doesn’t have that horrible metallic bitterness typical of many cheap-swill lagers.

330ml bottle. Straw colour with a good white head of consistent bubbles. Mildly carbonated with an aroma of malt  and a slight hint of spice. Good level of bitternes with an aftertaste that grabs you. Crisp and dry with a medium body and good texture.
330 ml bottle (4,6ABV). Pale golden body with a diminishing white head. Vague aroma of straw. Flavor is light malty with a light harsh bitterness. Watery body and really boring.
Pours a golden color with a white head.  Aroma is of grains, floral hops, and some yeast.  Flavor is pretty light.  There really isn’t much flavor at all with this brew.  Not good.

500 mL Can. Straw body with a small instantly dissipating fizzy white head. Faint aroma of grains, rice, and cardboard with notes of citrus, yeast, grassy hops, and corn. Flavor is mostly corn with some sweet malt; the aftertaste being like butter biscuits and the finish being the same as the flavor. This tiger does not have any teeth and claws, let alone any power to impress this beer drinker a second time.

A clear yellow/golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma is some sweet with malts and a little citrus. The taste is fruity and bittersweet. So is the aftertaste. A refreshing lager.
Pale yellow with a very thin white head. The flavour is corn, some malt, a bit metallic and a hint of hops. Very watery and tasteless.
unfortunately, zero scores are not accepted! This is a poor excuse for a beer and doesn’t deserve even a zero rating.
The appereance is pretty fucking dubious but I was relieved by the watery taste. Doesn’t put a tiger in my tank.

on draft at the Oz bar in Singapore.

pours a pale yellow with a medium size white head, heavy carbonation, some lacing.

smell is faint, some grain.

taste is creamy, slightly sweet, and grain.
It’s OK. Fairly standard for the ubiquitous asian lager. Slightly sweet. Bit of hops in finish. OK.

Pale yellow pour with a tiny ring of white suds.  The nose is of tiny earthen hops and some grains... if I’m really looking for it. Very light sour grains and some stab at a bitter back.  Same level of blah as every other macro-induced take on oriental brews.  It’s a shame they sell this seltzery over-carbonated stuff at actual bistros. What a disservice to the food.

Pretty dull lager overall with a slight taste of corn or is it rice? Generally a very light tasting lager and you can certainly get through a few. I found it reasonable for 1 or 2 but I may have to change my mind again at some point.
Friend gave this to me to try. He said it was great. Well he was wrong. Taste was a watery corn mess. Never again.
Bottle, Sainsbury. Pale yellow colour, medium white head. Aroma has some grassy hops and malts. Flavour is malty. Not bad in its kind.

Served at the local Wagamama’s and being adventurous, I gave it a shot.

 Poured a bland pale yellow with a fizzy white head. The aroma was almost non-existent except a faint smell of wet yard clippings.

 The watery brew sported almost no taste at all. Hints of wheat and grassy with a lingering mettalic aftertaste.

 It was somewhat refreshing, but I did find little reason to ever try this again.
light yellow two finger white pour. this beer is very light and drinkable. taste is good no funny aftertaste or skunk

Thin, malty tasting lager.  Unique taste, and yes a bit grassy and metalic.  Thought this was going to be harsh at first glance, however it is extremely smooth.  No skunk, which I wasn’t really expecting.  Not bad, but not great, could have been worse.
Multiple tastings. Catching up on some of the beers I drank in the past. Drank these while in Singapore. Nothing special.
