500 mL bottle.  Poured a clear gold with a two finger white head.  The aroma was grain and grassy hops.  The flavor was a bit metallic, with a thin grassy finish.
Drank straight from bottle.  Smelled and tasted smooth, with a mild earthy, malt flaover.  Aftertaste is mild and slightly grassy.  Not bad.

Sampled in bottle. A pretty nice brew. Goes down nicely. Has a good amount of flavor compared to other pale lagers from warm weather nations. Worth a try i am sure, but not anything to try hard to get a hold of.
Lacking in flavor but was better than expected. Could have offered more however...
This poured a very lgiht yellow color with a big white head. Aroma was of corn and grass. Flavor was a little corn and bad bitterness with notes of grass as well. Not good.
500 ml bottle. Apperance; light yello, clear. Not too much aroma but some malt, and you can also feel it drinking it. Some bitter finnish, not more than ok.
Pours pale yellow into a shaker.  Bright white head quickly recedes to hug rim. Sweet biscuit and cookie aromas. Crisp and malty.  Dry, sweet finish.
Similar to a Budweiser. Same taste, same smell. Although, I would drink one of these before a Budweiser. Very light body and carbonation. Nothing really here.
27.02.2009, 0,33l Bottle. Aroma is grassy or something. Weak malt. Colour is clear yellow, white head. I dont think this is a nice lager. I does not taste or smell anything.

(330ml bottle from a Chinese Resturant in Southport) It was either this, Fosters, or John Smiths. Didn’t pour it out but I expect it’s light golden in appearance with a white head. Smell slight hops but not very noticable. Tasted of nothing, water in fact, with perhaps a little hopiness bringing a sense of bitterness. Refreshing and served it’s job as a cooler and accomplice to Chinese Food, and not unpleasant, just very bland. Had a good amount of carbonation though.
Little or no personality. Dry and largly tastless it has very little going for it
Horrible corny cardboardy mess. Yellow with no head. Should have drank from the bottle to avoid smell.

Very average lager. Dry. Too carbonated. Light weight - taste, aroma and body, amongst others. Doesn’t sit nicely on the palate. Plenty of brews that are better in all ways. Crisp and easy to drink nevertheless. No character otherwise.
Ticker beer from my Dad.  Pale gold, with a thick white head.  Aroma is a maltiness, with corn, rice, light sweetness.  Taste is malty, corn, faint fruit.
Maybe the best/ least offensive macro brew of my visit to Thailand.  Light, crisp hops, malty, some bread.  Refreshing on a warm evening.

12 oz. single - $1.79 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: While it’s not exactly a tiger’s roar, there is at least a lively hiss of carbonation upon opening. Pours a crystal clear, yellow body with a medium-sized, white head.

Smell: Delicate, light pale malts with a soft touch of maize and some very mild floral touches.

Taste: Light pale malts dashed with a hearty handful of dried yellow corn and a medium sweetness. Faintly floral hops and mild bitterness leave you with, well, a slightly sweetish finish.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied, but not quite as thin as some of its lagered compatriots. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Oh, come on, it’s not so bad. Really! Though it leaves me wishing I had some tasty Asian grub to wash it down with.
Bottle.  Poured a clear yellow with a ok size head.  Smells very malty and little else.  Very light body.
Bottle. Clear yellow body with a medium white head. Malty aroma with some grain and hops. Light to thin body. Flavour is sweet malty with some hops and a grainy finish.

clear gold, effervescent bubbles, medium, quickly disappearing head, lacy.  sweet malt nose, trace of grain.  flavor is sweet malt, trace of mustiness.  light bodied, dry finish.  not a very good beer, in fact, the more i drank, the more cloying the taste became.  bottle purchased at the st. louis anheuser-busch brewery gift shop.

Oh shit this is not my bag. 500ml bottel. Its just so souless and hollow...with an apple ester tang,bunch of grainy malt & just an abysss of H20 under this. I wonder if they brew a foreign/export  stout ? .They should do .

As much as I love Singapore as a city, I do not like their beer.  The Tiger even smells bad to me, I think its about the water they use, but I don’t like it.  It has always tasted kinda off.  Feels like roten eggs.
Pale almost clear, no head. Doesn’t look like a beer. Very sweet, but also very BMC in. My brother brought this home from Thailand,  but I’m pretty sure I have seen it in stores.
Frash and not too fizzy. Easy drinking from bottle. Malts and hops are balanced well.
Not bad for the style. Light bodied and lightly sweet grainy taste. Not as much carbonation as some. Strange finish. No hops anywhere.
clear pale yellow.  small white head.  not much of an aroma.  thin bodied.  A hint of skunk in the aftertaste.  Not the worst beer I’ve had but definitely not the best.
Bottle at home. An average lager. Detected some fruity tates, including orange and peach. Very bland.

Appearance: Clear golden. Little bit of fizzy white head.
Aroma: Malt and slight sweetness. Yeast?
Taste: A bit watery. Some hops and malt. Easy-drinking, but not very exciting.
Info: 330ml bottle, 15/1-2009

330 mL bottle

Pale color, slightly yeasty and hoppy aroma.  Very weak mouthfeel--rather watery.  Slightly hoppy taste.  Better than Bud, but not by much.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts very mild, almost like water. Modest hoppy-dry aftertaste. Not really a masterpiece!

330 ml can. From Thailand (MP). Brewed in Thailand.
Golden colour with thin head. 
Aroma is weak malty. Some sweet malts and hoppiness in flavour. Also some alcohol present. OK.
Pale golden beer with thin head. Light bodied, watery mouthfeel. Another boring lager.
Gold lager pour, fizzy head.  Aroma of malt.  Very light sweet malt and grain flavor.  Watery.  I like the colors on the label.  There is not enough blue and orange together on beer labels.

World acclaimed? Seriously? Pours golden, white head. Aroma is metallic, some hops and possibly vanilla. Very standard. Clean, easy drinking beer, but tastes of very little. Yeast and corny hop are there when its in your mouth, with no linger flavour at all. Meh.
11.2 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $1.49 Typical lager.
Bottle thanks to ilovedarkbeer. Pours with a fading white head and a clear golden body. Aroma of butter, corn and light grassy hops. Taste is corn wheat and blah...fizzy...
Gold medal in what? Singapore category of the pale crap section? Golden color. Tastes like corn and wheat. Not offensive but just doesn’t taste like anything.

Bottle from the LCBO
For the life of me i can not remember why i rated this one this high it will need to be revisited

Just to clarify. Though Tiger is from Singapore, if you have this in say Thailand or Malaysia or Indonesia, the beer is brewed in that country- not Singapore. Pours like a typical Asian pale lager. Aroma is very sweet with some yeast in there but is mostly unremarkable. Mouthfeel is watery. Aftertaste is a little dry actually. Overall, better than other Asian lagers but that is not saying too much.
Bottle. Pale golden colour. A bit drier and crisper than your typical tropical lager.
Pours a clear gold with a decent head and slight lacing.  Dough, bread and yeast in the aroma, tastes like your average mass produced lager.  Palate is mildly slick, and short-lived.

Bottle.  Poured pale yellow with thin white head.  No lacing.  Sweet malt aroma.  Flavour of malt and sugar.  Not mych bitterness.  Sweet malt flavour.  Not sure what they were striving for here, but it’s not a helles.  Not bad though, better than most pale lagers.

33cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. It poured a pale yellow colour with a big foamy white head that settled down fast in the glass. It has a grassy aroma that also smells of malts and a hint of yeast. The flavour is very watery and tastes of bread. It has a very short aftertaste. All things considered it’s another pale lager, but with a slightly better flavour than the rest.
bottle. has a bit of a yeasty smell. pours a very light yellow with a small white head. has a normal lager taste. not really good but not bad either.
Bottle. Pours golden, with porous but short-living head. Faint aroma of hops and malt on the nose, and those with some yeast on the palate. Unremarkable beer.

0.33 l bottle from a store in Tirane, Albania, if I remember well. Poured pale golden body with medium sized head that went down soon. Very weak aroma, only some stale malts. Flavor is interesting though, a bit sweetish malty with hay and some fruits if you extend your imagination. Interesting, but I still didn’t like it so much. Even more strange were the notes of belgian ale yeast in its finish. OK and pretty pleasant, but no better than average pale lager.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with heavy who found it in Albania (thanks!)
 Poured a yellow body with a medium sized white head that went away fast.  The nose wasn’t impressive, odd malt and honey, a bit alcohol. The taste is malty as well I guess, notes of hay and wood, some soapy fruity sweetness. Better than expected by being passable. Still, nothing special.

I was actually surprised by this beer. Poured with a clear orange color, and had a slightly fruity taste with a light white thin head. I enjoyed this beer, considering the low expectation i had for it. Cheers to Singapore!

So Heineken has something to do with this.  It seems like a lot of leading Asian brews are owned or co-brewed by a leading European company.  This has an inoffensive aroma.  Taste is pretty insipid dry  lager with a touch of Central European hops.  Light and smooth, with a little more alcohol than expected.  Tiger is a fairly typical Asian pale lager - not bad, just bland.
Sullying the good name of Tigers everywhere. Bottle, waiting for an Indian takeaway. Little dry and bitter in the finish which adds to the unpleasantness. Metal, cardboard etc. Didn’t like it.
Clear golden with tiny white head. Sweet malty aroma with malty and caramel notes. Flavour likewise with hints of cardboard. Sweet finish.

I really didn’t enjoy this beer at all. Maybe it was because I’d been drinking much better beers earlier in the night or maybe because its expensive for what you get, Im not sure. Typical Pale yellow beer, very thin lager. Actually has some bitterness in the finish, which was rather unpleasant. Clean tasting but thats about it.

(Bottle) Pours a yellow color with a small white head. Light aroma of biscuit, hops, and grains. Taste is rather dry, and includes a surprising amount of crisp hops. Some pepper is mixed in with the grain, as is a stale, sweet bread note. A little more character than most pale lagers, but still forgettable.

Biggish white head with some bigger bubbles. Yellow body with carbonation. Rubbery grainy aroma with mealy sugary notes. Dry-acidic unclean grainy sugary taste with rubbery notes. Dry papery maize aftertaste lingers. This was unpleasant. Didn’t finish it. (0.33l bottle, Wine Monopoly.)
Average really, light golden corn lager flavour, easy 2 drink, tastes ok, but not that special, could be better, not good value for money, only in bottles.

ANother pale lager.  The appearance is standard yellow/straw color, with a white head.  The aroma is of malts, ajuncts like corn, etc.  The flavor is malty sweet, with slight to moderate hop bite.  The finish has some malt sweetness as well as hoppyness, making the finish relatively clean.  Ok for this style.
12oz can. I’m drinking this as my fifth beer in Hong Kong. As other reviewers have noted, this is a mediocre beer that is not worth hunting down. No wonder tigers are an endangered species.
bottle, clear yellow color, faint nose, slight head, malty crisp flavor with a slight hop finish, plain

12oz bottle.  Pours a clear, pale yellow with a white head which dissipated.  Nose is of grass hops and the distinctive "lager" smell.  Taste is of malt and is rather non-distinctive and plain.  Mouthfeel is thin and watery with some carbonation.  Not worth the time.

Bottle. Pours a clear, pale straw yellow with a small white head. Fresh, sweet aroma; cereals; slight notes of hops. Flavour is pretty much the same, but with more outspoken cereal notes. Finish is sweet with rice and dry and dusty lingering notes of cooked vegetables. Eww.  23-08-08.

Pale yellow with a lasting semi spritzy head. Aromas are mild to nonexistent exposing some malt characteristics and cooked barley. Medium nectar with very mellow carbonation. Malt forward with a mild bittering. I detect a little baked bread. The finish is mildly bittered.

Bottle. Crystal clear pale yellow with foamy white head that didn’t last. Slight grainy aroma. Tastes fairly clean, with some grainy character and a bit of a bite. Fairly thin. Its nothing special, but pretty easy to throw down with asian food.

Bottle: Poured a clear golden color lager with a large pure white foamy head with some good retention but no lacing. Aroma consists of sweet malt with some minimal adjunct showing. Taste is also dominated by a bland medium sweet malt taste with no easily discernable adjunct. Not the most complex beer out there but definitely not the worst pale lager out there.
An extremely disappointing beer. Tastes like water. If you’re in southeast Asia, and find yourself confronted with 1 of 3 brews. This would be the worst.
Bottle, 330ml.  Thirst quencher.  Quite full tasting, good gold colour.  Fairly enjoyable with spicy food.

Bottle from Quick Trip in McKinney, TX.
Pours a clear gold with white head. Small aroma of malt. Flavor is a small malt flavor as well, slight hop usage. Palate is light bodied and high carbonation. Not a bad beer, kinda simple and plain.
Bottled: Pours a gold color with no head. Bubbly, maltness, bland and boring. Good with tai food though!
Bottle from the Trump hotel in Las Vegas. Pours a clear gold color with almost no head. The aroma is skunked malt. The flavor was very sweet and unpleasant malt. Not very good.
Not bad at all for the 47cents/bottle  i paid. Body is surprisingly acceptable. Flavour is malty, and theres some bitter hoppiness in the end. For an asian lager, it could get a lot worse.
Golden and clean, with little head. Relatively rich taste with a little bitterness in the aftertaste.
(bottle from irishboy)yellow body,white head.aroma is of caramel malts,dried hay,and a hint of hops.flavor is much of the same.not to bad for a pale lager.

Taste 7/8 bottle(date?) Looks: Very clear pale gold with no head.Smells of mild grain/malt with a little spice. Taste: Very bland, weak and limp body. A little hops spice. I have had beers with a worse taste, but nothing more bland than this. Walk away.
Know, this is one of the gold old beers from the backpack days. Piss-yellow, quite thin but with a nice hoppy punch. Not bad for a maize pumped macro.
Pours a light gold. Nose is lacking. Fizzy white head goes "bye bye" quickly. Flavor is of citrus and corn. Drinkable but not my first choice. Have another? Not at the moment.

Pale beer with a one inch disappearing head.  Aroma – bread, citrus, yeast.  Flavor – clean, bit of hop, touch of sweet.  Finish – sweet fading to slight bitterness fading to odd bitterness.  Not so bad, but won’t buy it.
clear light yellow, little head, small malt aromas and a decently fine taste.

had it on holiday in England 08-07-’08. 640 ml bottle. second Chinese beer for me. yellow colour. maize taste.
( I now (2014-10-02) realize it is a Singapore beer, took 2 cans from a LIDL supermarket )
21.6 oz bottle-A clear golden body with no head and an aroma of corn and more corn with a little sweetness. Taste of the same with a sweet dryness on the back end. A typical pale lager.

0.33l bottle.

Standard lager, nothing special and nothing bad.  Decent when it’s cold.

Bottle 640 ml. Another pale and innocent "sushi-lager" Its best to get it real cold on a steamy hot summerday I suppose.... i didn´t. The appearance is clear, light yellow with a thin white foamy head. Thye nose is rather sweet with hints of citrus. It has a slightly dry and waterish palate. The finish is allright with a round taste of sweet hay and corn.
Pretty good, quite sweet. Nice to drink with Thai food or anything strong. I tend to buy this one quite often.

typical aroma for the style, but a little high on the egg smell. clear yellow with quite nice small white head. Not at all a gourmet beer, but a good session beer imo. taste is refreshing, not much, a little sweet notes, otherwise your typical pale lager. NOT the bad taste found in some discount pale lagers. This one is okay.
Bottle 0.33 l. Bought Kvickly Hilleroed. Weak malty aroma. Golden yellow colour witjh nice white head. Surprisingly sweet taste with some hops. Nothing special, but quite allright for a pale lager.

Bottle, Emni Indian Restaurant, Islington.
This is a good get out of jail card when there is a limited choice of brews on offer (especially at Indian/Asian restaurants!) . Flavour is sweetish  with a slightly dry finish. Nothing great by any stretch of the imagination, but as lagers go there are far far worse out there, and with a spicy meal its fine.

Yes it’s a yellow beer, but it’s a good one.  It’s aroma is of mild hops.  It’s a golden yellow color, with nice effervescence and a fluffy white head.  It’s also good tasting a nice balance of hop and mild malt.  It’s nicely carbonated and very smooth.  A great session beer
...bottle.  Nothiing amazing here, typical asian lager.  Watery, ricey, but good to knock out spicy foods from the palate, but otherwise, no real reason to drink it.
Crisp and clean taste, not a whole lot of flavor sort of grainy but its decent in its own respectable manner. The aroma reminds me of banannas and tiger pee.
Can 50cl, from Fakta. Clear, dry, yellow body with small/medum white head which did not last long. Sweet, malty aroma. Initial flavor was sweet but quickly finished off with light bitterness.
Typical pale lager, but one of the best out there, a definite buy if you want something light.
This is what the homeless buy off me when I’m at work. It’s really generic and cheap. Meh.
12 oz bottle from Ralphs, Palm Springs! Nose is sweet and grainy with light vanilla and caramel note; clear gold with a medium white head; flavor has a hint of bitterness with some light malty notes.

Pours a pale golden color with thin, white head.  Appetizing sweat cereal aroma with subtle hints of caramel and citrus.  Light bodied with good carbonation.  Sweet malt taste gives way gentle hop finish.  A good session beer.  Try with spicy noodle dish.
What was I doing?!?!?!? It is all mike lelevier’s fault. He made me drink this azz beer. I come to alaska and drink this. So sorry. Not much better than a Panama!

Bottle 12 oz from Party Source. Poured clear light pale color with large white head that diminished slowly with fair lacing. Moderate grassy aroma. Medium body  with soft carbonation. Light grassy bitter flavor with light grassy finish of short duration. Below average brew.
I have had this several times at Thai/Japanese restaurants.  Nothing out of the ordinary.  Typical lager that can be refreshing, but isnt a super high quality beer.
Bottle. Taste like an traditional mass marketed American lager. I wouldn’t recommend this one.
Light at first , then strong rush to your mouth . Sweet at the end , overall good beer , wife likes it  . Could not drink it everyday .
very light but for its style what can someone expect. It was mainly malty with bit citric in flavor.
Tasted like an American macro but it was smooth in that regard. Not much there to talk about. It worked with my sushi but I wouldn’t go back.

Canned version from Cambodia. Run of the miller "international lager". A bit grainy with a slight grassy hop presence. Fizzy carbonation and light straw in color. Corny off flavors. Still, its better than most American macro swill.
Bottle and can, tasted several times. Not much unique about this one - yellow, white foam, maybe some hops, it’ll give you a buzz and less of a hangover than others.
Well, all I can say is that it’s a beer. It is yellow. It has a white head. It taste like one pellet hop was thrown in and a handful of grain....along with a lot of water.

500ml can from the LCBO. I’m not even going to bother writing at any length about this one, what a disappointment. Had that weird annoying macro flavour that never ceases to displease the palate. Waste of money.
330 ml bottle. Light golden color, disappering white head. Aroma is ligth malt and hints of hops. Flavor is the same, with some sweetness. Not impressing at all. Watery.

21.6 oz (640 ml) brown bottle. Cryptic date code on back label. Poured out a light straw yellow color, with a minimal soapy white head. Aromas are corn, rice, cheap adjuncts, lager yeast.
Flavors are not much better, corn and rice, some sweet malts. Not as bad as some cheap lagers are. Went well with the spicy Thai shrimp I had.

Looks like a pale lager.  Aroma is somewhat akin to Saaz hops but more earthy and also has corn.  It is very drinkable and nothing much to dislike but, like almost all pale lagers, there isn’t much to like, either.

330ml can (Eckero Line)

Light yellow, fizzy. Gentle hoppy and light malt aroma. Fizzy in the mouth. Taste similar to aroma. Hops, scant as they are, are a touch metallic. Malt is soft. Quite inoffensive.
Decent aroma that was floral and sweet.  Appearance was rather bland.   Palate was minimal, but have had worse in the pale lager category.  Butter taste followed by a bit of hops.  Okay.

Color was golden with white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma was of sweet malt, floral hops, and some sweet fruit.  Flavor is slightly hoppy with some sweet fruit and a.  The drink is crisp with a dry ending which makes it very easy to take.

(Bottle) Pours pale golden. Aroma of sweet malt, dough, corn, light floral hops, some pear and glue. The flavour is light hoppy, light to medium sweet and light grassy bitter with a light to medium dry ending. The mouthfeel is quite clean and a bit crisp. A touch of pear fruitiness in the flavour as well. Rader light bodied.
las que puntúo con 2.4 son las que he probado pero no me acuerdo de la cata

12 ounce bottle at Flat Top in Champaign. There really isn’t anything special about this beer... it is just a typical pale lager. Definitely better than any Bud or Miller product, but nothing to make me want to try this again.
Bottle. Pours a little bit darker that yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet malt with a touch of cereal. Thin body. Flavor is fresh but very very light malt. It’s drinkable.

thin feel, rather punget smell standard lager smell mixed with a strong smell of sour malt, Terrable flavor sweetness of a lager mixed with a stronger than usual alcohol taste (odd for such a low ABV) stadard hohum lager color. Stick to a nice pils .
nice aroma,  a little light in flavour.  pours to a foamy head.  passes with a push
Very good aroma. But it tastes very bad. It has a very strong taste that  disapeers quickly.

Oct. 2006 - What can I say?  Pale yellow, little to no aroma, little to no flavor.  There was nothing offensive, at least.  Typical lager flavor, a little sweet, carbonated mouthfeel.  Not offensive but nothing to seek out, unless you want a beer from Singapore.
Very noticeable malt flavors. Attractive color and head. Although it may be satisfying, it holds no lasting impressions.
Tiger Beer is light yellow beer with a notable head. While it has very little taste, there is a suprisingly decent amount of taste. This was a very nice and refreshing pale lager.

Aroma of very sweet ripe apples and sour malt.  Pours pale yellow with thin sudsy white head, big carb bubbles.  Very sweet rice malt flavor with a horrible metallic biter finish that comes out of nowhere.  Yuck.
Gold color, at least has a decent head.  Smells like the typical piss American beer.  This one is saved by a slightly sweet taste, not completely terrible.

12 oz. Slightly more golden than most pales, with a creamy, three-finger head that leaves some soapy lace. Aroma is honey and dry grain. Flavor is honey nut cheerios and slight bitter grass on the finish. Light medium body is slightly dry and tingly. Pretty good industrial lager.
Bottle. Corn dominated, sweet lager with few redeeming attributes. Drunk in an Indian restaurant which probably dulled the experience somewhat. Poor.
nose is faintly malty, big foamy white head, piss yellow color corn flavor pretty watery, some small amounts of hops maybe???

It’s no so much that lagers suck, but that *this* lager sucks. Having had this a bunch when visiting Asia, I can certainly say that it doesn’t travel well (not that it was any good to begin with). Hey kids, it’s not piss - it’s piss from Singapore!!
bottle. this beer had a strange aroma like skunk or feet. it had a large head that seemd to last. very watery so you could drink a lot of these but I wouldn’t.

bottle. this beer let me down big time. not common in my area, I had been looking for it for a long time. it pours attractively enough. golden color with a huge fluffy white head. I put my nose in the glass and all I could smell were stale old farts. the taste wasn’t nearly as bad but it certainly wasn’t excellent either. a little malt sweetness that is partially covered by an oily vegetable flavor. the carbonation did remain throughout the entire glass though.
Fluffy big head, dissappears quick,aroma hoppy,as is the flavour,bitter flavour but a bit rough in flavour probably metallic,after taste mild malt sweetness,not bad but poor finish.

Poured lite golden. Looks a step above a lite beer. Had to put some effort into sensing the mildly sweet aroma. The  taste is sweet and quite unique. Very interesting. This a smooth drinking beer however at 5% the alcohol is hard to notice.
Same ol’, same ol’, just from Singapore this time.  Competently made, wet, thats about all  I got.

Bottle @ Industry, London. Somewhat embarrassed to even rate this, let alone enter it here. Oh well, was one of three awful beers I had at a now ex-co-worker’s leaving do before I had to walk to another nearby bar to buy and smuggle in something halfway decent...
10 percentile with 509 ratings pretty much sums it up, lol...
Clear, pale gold with a thin white head.
Pukey malt, barley and tinge of slightly metallic hops. Yum!

12 oz bottle poured into lager glass- poured transparent golden yellow, medium carbonation, foamy white head that quickly disappeared.  Aroma of malt and yeast.  Hits the mouth with a thin defined body, kind of a bread like taste quality to it, a few hops on the finish which is always appreciated.  Decent drinking brew, but not something I plan on robbing a truck for.
0.33 l bottle. Golden color with a small head, malty nose.Good carbonation and balanced bitterness with a malty flavour. Some dry and hoply aftertaste, Good,drinkable beer.

Draught, Dog House, HK, Has a lot of head. Clear yellow in color. Smells a little musty like a good pils. Tastes like a weakened heineken. Flavor is sharp, quick malt. Pretty dry. Has a slight island appeal. An ok beer.

Fyraftensøl (33 cl. flaske).

Kedelig øl med megen kulsyre, som dog er god til at slukke tørsten med eller drikke sig fuld i.

Hvis der er andre muligheder at vælge i mellem ville jeg aldrig vælge denne.

Bottle.  Nice thick foreign bottle with a pretty cool design.  Appearance is boringly "Lager."  Light corn yellow color with a bit of fizz.  A little darker than most of the American macros.  Aromas of corn and grain dust.  Flavor is about the same.  Reminds me of the dusty smell in the grain bins at grandpa’s farm... Bready body that is largely uninteresting.

Interesting label grabs your attention. Pale yellow american lager color and appearance. A little coarse and unrefined for a pale lager.  Volaitle aroma and flavors even tho this is not a real high alky % brew. Typical character of cheap american lagers. Many cheaper american lagers are much better than this. Sol, old german, brigade, lionshead and schmidts are all much better than this. Tho clean, industrial aftertaste border on the flavors of  american malt liquors or high gravity brews.. Will not sample again. Not extremely terrible, after all, it’s better than most of Melanie’s stuff.
oh wow, this is awful. Aroma and flavour smacks of adjuncts. Crappy vegetal, grainy flavour, blech, bad stuff.

12 oz bottle chocked down to make people happy on Thanksgiving 2007.  Clear straw color with moderate head and carbonation.  Boring musty aroma with some sort of adjunct grain noticeable.  Flavor is a hint of sweet with grainish malt/rice floating in there.  Hint of hop as well.  Nothing too off.  Semi-dry finish on a style appropriate body.  Not very good but I was not completely offended either.
Bottle - Light lager with adjunct sweet flavor. Nothing special.  Served at Asian Restaurant.
640ml bottle. Typical pale lager colour; white head that disappears immediately; highly carbonated; pleasant floral aroma; reasonable taste; but slightly sticky finish.
This was just another go around for the pale mass produced lagers.  Not something to really seek out.

Pale fizzy yellow, head fades rapidly, more of a disintegration than a fading.  Aroma slightly of green apple and rice.  Flavor is rice malt oriented.  Green apple show up initially, but as it warms, goes away entirely.  Some bitterness on the palate, faint floral hops on the finish.  Carbonic bite.  Not that bad really.
Poured clear with a yellowish tint. Small white head present. Aroma of rice or corn or something. Very minimal. Very watery and light tasting. Terrible.

500ml can. Smells sweet with an aroma of... orange? first thing that popped into my head, but that’s hardly accurate. Golden pour with a small wispy head that disappears quickly. Tastes a little sweet, bland but not bad. Goes down smooth with a slight bitter aftertaste. Remarkably average, not bad at all. It’s like Tsingtao’s better cousin in a short summary.
Nose of cereal/corn. Pours a cloudy  to clear yellow. Tatse is dry and stunted. Not nice unless drank on a hot day.
the name alone screams out "drink me".The taste, well, does not live up to the name. Bland, boring, and forgettable pale lager. Rather have a sapporo if given the option.

Decent beer if you are looking for something cheap and relaxing. Doesn’t go too far in terms of flavor.  Crisp, refreshing and light. Definitely, and only good in the mid afternoon.  Great cold from 7/11 on the commute home.

Bottle: Pours a pale, lucid golden with a thin white film for head. The aroma is predominately brewing flakes, corn, and some grassy notes. The body is nicely carbonated, not too fizzy. Flavor has a sweet, slightly dough-like pale malt back and a light grassy bitterness in the finish. One of the better Pale Lagers from a more obscure country.
330 ml Bottle. Pours a golden colour with frothy white head. Great to look at. Sweet flavour with a little bitter finish. Pretty average in flavour. Mouth feel is average. Pleasant drink.

500 ml can.
Pours a sparkly golden colour with a frothy white, fleeting head. Smells of citrisy, bready hops in addition to a slightly floral tweak. The flavour is sweet with a metalic, not quite bitter finish. Tastes kind of bare to me. It has a medium mouth feel and carbonation that attacks the tongue a little too much. Overall not one of my awesome beers.
33cL Bottle.  Another mass produced pale lager.  Pours a clear, corn color and white head.  Malty taste and very short, slightly bitter finish.  Average at best.
Aroma slightly malty/smoky, flavor is slightly bitter and clean tasting. Very straight forward, no surprises here.

33 cL bottle. Pours yellow, clear, with a huge white head. Somewhat thin aroma, slight dry malty with a little spiced hops note. Slight malty sweetness which quickly goes into a dry and slight fruity bitter finish.
Taste like a budwiser but not as fresh. Is was too sweet. Goes great with food, but not a stand alone beer.
22 oz bottle.  Nice clearish pour, barely any head.  Slightly bitter, but a crisp finish.  Wouldn’t drink it without food, and it’s always South / East Asian for me.

Pale yellow/orange in colour with average carbonation and a thin white head. Thin bodied with Low bitterness. Sweet tasting but very little flavour if any. Slightly bitter and crisp finish. 330ml brown bottle. Imported.
330 ml bottle - Pale yellow/gold. Medium carbonation.  Thin bodied. Sweet, slightly grassy flavour with  no bitterness. to speak of.

Asian beer - we lived off of these in Thailand (Chinese travelers smuggled this stuff in at half the price of Singha.) A rice pilsner. Not much flavor, golden in color - goes well with satay and spicy food.

Pours as is expected. Clear gold with a white head that sticks around and a lot of carbonation. Smells as expected. Slightly bitter and sweet. Flavor is as expected. Slightly bitter tone to a beer that has a mild sweetness to it. Tastes watered down on the end as no siginifcant traits hang around. Feel is standard. Drinkable. Sure. Why bother though. A standard boring lager.
Bottle. Pours light gold with a thin white head. Very grainy aroma with a hint of pear. Flavor is grainy as well with a very mild hop bite. Thin on the palate.

More commonly known as Tiger-piss. I drank cases of this during my travels to SE Asia, cheap and available everywhere. Appearance is probably its nicest characteristic, watery pale lager flavor with a small bit of houblon showing through. Good for a hot summers day in Malaysia.

Okay, not that bad. Actually better than most of the big brews. Looked nice with a pale gold color and a decent fluffy head. Taste wasn’t painful and showed a little complexity.  Not shocking to the tongue.
This is what Chinese Budweiser tastes like, except this beer does have some taste to it (it’s not very good but it’s there).

Quickly diminishing head. Pale gold color. Pretty shitty smell (cornbrew). Ugly sweet taste, which is a little noxious. Leaves kind of a bad taste in the mouth. Nothing notable except for the corn. (Part of the corn conspiracy methinks).
Not much to say really. Mass produced chemical beer. I remember it being better than this years ago. dehydrated urine in a bottle.
I do like the taste. Very smooth. This would be a good softball beer. Tried one warm as well and found no bitterness. But other than that its just a basic lager to me.

11.2oz bottle. Six pack purchased, poured yellow body, typical pale lager with a bit of spice notes, easy to drink.  I dont think i would go out of my way to get this again.  This might be good w/ food, maybe ill order it at an asian restaurante.
Watery grainy scent.  Pale straw yellow.  Weak head.  Watery waxy grainy taste with a bit of hops.  Slightly rancid aftertaste.  Not impressed.

330 ml bottle.  A friend brought me this bottle directly from China.  Pours a straw color with a head that dissappears in a blink of an eye.  Grainy aroma, mainly corn.  Grassy flavor boosted with pale maltiness.  Light to medium mouthfeel and a crisp dry finish.  As others have stated, this is not that bad for a pale lager.
Pours a clear gold with a small white head.  Smells grainy and sweet.  Very light beer, however, it has alot more taste than alot of pale lagers.  Not too bad.
drinkable, however i had high hopes with this one, and it really is just your basic pale lager...

Rated 8/3/07.  Bottle at Siam Garden.  Pale straw color with an average white head.  Decent lacing.  The aroma was of light corny malts, with mild spices and a bit of grassiness.  Flavor was sweet corn based, with intermitent pepperings of indiscernable mild spices and herbs.  Mild hop bite on the finish.  Slightly better than average pale lager.

Bottle: Pours Pale golden with a nice, medium sized white head. Realy no aroma to speek of.  Taste of light malt and hops. Slightly bitter finish. Light bodied. Drank it to a well made thai wok dinner.

Can. Medium gold appearance, predominantly sweet malt aroma and icing-sugar-smooth palate with dry finish. Easygoing flavour offers an effective balance between malt and hops. Standard stuff neither thrills nor disappoints.
I was quite frankly surprised by this beer.  I was expecting a light, no flavor beer...What I got was a beer with a nice flavor and great aftertaste.  NICE!
Pours light gold.  Not much nose.  Quick disapating head.  Sweet, notes of honey.  Nice subtle hops.  Kind of sweet finish.  complimented the sushi we had kinda well.
500 ml can. poured yellow. aromas of malt and hops both present but subtle. very typical pale lager but not the worst ive tried. has some backbone and an ok bitter finish

Bottle. Aroma of grassy hop, perhaps a hint of corn or rice. Brassy gold color with a significant white head. Thin to medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Starts with what seems to be a balance between pale malt sweetness and grassy bitter. The finish is rather dry, and the bitter stays. Rather clean, almost crisp. A pale lager on its way to being a pilsener. The Heineken of the East?
This is a good beer for casual drinking.  It was a good easy taste and no after taste to hide any food tastes that may be accompanying it.
From a 500ml can, pours a clear gold with a fading head. Well-carbonated, with a slight grainy character and pale malt flavor, with a slight hop bitterness and dry finish.

Pours pale clear yellow with very active carbonation and a good sized rocky white head.  The aroma has clear pale malt, light corn traits and light spice.  Medium / light body with a good amount of sharp carbonation.  The flavor starts with typical pale malt and muddled spices.  The finish is more of the same.  Not bad, but quite boring.  At least I’ve now tried a beer from Singapore.
pale yellow with white head, smells like hops and suger, or is that corn?  crisy brew.

All the way from singapore, but it was not worth the trip...I did not know if I would like tiger beer.  I asked myself:  is this something I would enjoy drinking? - I don’t know.  It was a mystery.  Now I know for sure.  I do not like tiger beer.  It does not taste good.

Well this one was definately disappointing.  Strange lager too.   Too bitter not much hop, malt or barley flavor.  Very pale, almost clear with no head.  Not much chance of me ordering up one of these again.

I tried this beer on July 6, 2007 after purchasing it from my local LCBO store.  It poured a golden orange colour into the glass with a fluffy white head that dissipated very quickly leaving almost no foam on the top.  Lots of effervescence.  The aroma was a combination of malts and yeast.  The mouthfeel is crisp with a lot of carbonation - dances on the tongue.  The taste is slightly bitter with some malty tones.  Not a great beer by any stretch.

From Bottle.  Aroma is grainy, bread-like with some light hop notes and sweet malt.  Beer is a straw color with a white head, low retention.  Flavor is pils malt with a solid bitter balance forward, some noble hop flavor, slightly sour.  Palate is medium bodied, with a light carb feel, but seems to have medium-high carbonation.  Overall a very clean beer, well made with decent bittering and a clean finish.

500 ml can Pours a nice yellow-gold with an encouraging head that thins out. Lacing sticks around for a while but honestly, this stuff goes down quick. Not much in the way of flavour, pretty weak actually. Not worth trying, unless you just have to for a rating’s sake.

A pale pale lager with an unremarkable nose and taste.  Only thing better than an American Bud is the label is more interesting.  This TIger won’t be found on any golf courses I know.  A bottle of spring water would do the same thing.

Bottle - Pours pale golden with very little white head.  Light aroma, not much to speak of.  Watery flavors of citrus and hops, aftertaste.  Light mouthfeel.  Not the worst I ever had, but not something I’d soon try again for a while.

Bottle.  Pale yellow colour with medium creamy white mostly diminishing head.
Week aroma. Sweet flavor. Watery palate.
Bottle. Pale golden in color with no head. Hoppy aroma. Hoppy flavor. Light citrusy notes. Crisp. Nice light lawnmower beer.

Pale lager. Low carbonation. Smooth flavor. Appears to have a hint of a citrus flavor to it. Overall, not an unpleasant beer but not a very memorable beer. It might go well with chicken or definitely sweet&sour asian foods.

Yellow,  yellow, yellow.  My favorite part of this beer is the appearance.  The flavor seemed nonexistent and left me the moment I grasped ahold of it.  Some where in there it tasted metallic...not a big fan.
This is one of those entimental beers for me. A treat to drink; one of my favorite lagers. Goes great with karaoke.
JUST A BEER MAN. A PALEY PALE ALE IF EVER THERE WAS ONE. NOT BAD AND I GUESS THAT’S GOOD! SIMPLE UNASSUMING AND QUENCHING. GO AHEAD A CHILL IT REAL GOOD AND COLD. YOU WON’T MISS A THING.

in tropical weather i didn’t want anything heavier than this. drank this on numerous occassions in various kopi tiam throughout kuala lumpur and penang. the open-air eateries are all stocked with this. light-bodied with a slightly dry finish. it seems that the refrigerators they keep the beer in aren’t very cold but surprisingly this didn’t taste totally awful at room temperature so it gets points for that. good for cooling off your palate which might be burning hot from the curry mee you just ate.

pale yellow w/medium lace light syrup body smooth and sticky light malty bitter with some sweet hops, inoffensive and balanced just rather simple. had it in a really good indian restaurant definitely good for accompanying a good meal but not complex enough to be drunk by itself

Aroma is strong, but is decidedly bland, almost chemically.  The most prominent aroma is sour hops.  Pours gold with small head that does not last.  Flavor as a bitter start that is taken over by honey tones and it all disappears into a nonexistent finish.

OK. Let’s face it. Tiger is not the most original or exciting beer on earth. It’s not a bad lager, and certainly better than the standard Australian lagers (bleuuchhhh). But I will not under any circumstances buy it at home at import prices. It’s just not worth it.

However, after slogging through the Singapore heat and humidity for several hours, Tiger takes on a much more appealing quality than it would otherwise merit.

Plus it does go very nicely with a plate of roti, a fish head curry or a couple of freshly fried samosas. And it is even better enjoyed as one watches all those ridiculously gorgeous Singapore girls go by. (Oh, to be single in Singapore...)

Anyway, it gets extra points for the above reasons.
Light yellow color with no head, or aroma for that matter.  A little grain for the flavor, but thankfully no horrific off flavor either.  Non-offensive.

I initially tasted  this beer at Bush Gardens Tampa. Being a Florida resident I go there often, it was the day I first drank Tiger.If I wasn’t so stoned right now I might remember the other beer I ventured but that doesn’t matter; it should be obvious that I enjoyed your brew a little more.I purchased a 6-pack ’pon this fine eve and as I plucked it from my grocers cooler I thought,"hmm....this seems a li’l flimsy." I was, naturally, speaking of course of the package that the beer was contained in.Being a beer drinker with a range of consistent standards the beer was the last thing we selected at the store.There was a 5 minute wait at the register and a 4 minute drive home.I got out of the vehicle and the slight moisture build up caused the cardboard packaging to tear and all of my sweet beer came crashing to the ground.Maybe your engineers foresaw this prediciment and the bottles were made from a glass that did not break from a 3 foot fall.I understand marketing and cost cutting, BUT, if you spend a small amount extra on making a superior box design then your sales would improve. I’m sure you know that it’s the package that helps sell.When picking up beer the genuine beer man knows that if you cut back on something cheap like the box,well that says alot about your company.Please listen to what I say I know what I’m talking about here I am after all "THE CUSTOMER."
Light corn aroma.  Pale in color, but there is lots of foam.  Some sweetness.   No flaws, and no offensive aroma or flavor.  Not bad at all.

A 12-oz bottle shared by the gang from Cellars Wine & Spirits in St Paul, MN. Pours a pale golden yellow brew with a thin white head. Fast dissolving and sparce lacing. Aroma is a typical macro beer with the average medium barley/ corn malt, some sugar, dusty wheat, and soap. Taste is light body, a little citrus, gritty, and not much hop finish. When serve at 35 F degrees, nice lawn mower beer.
No aroma. Golden color, thin head. Very little flavor, with a metallic finish. Very thin mouthfeel. At import prices, this is pretty bad.
from bottle, light yellow in color.  A somewhat sweet flavor with a clean finish. Would be really good on a hot day
Pours a light golden beer. weak malty nose. Dominant maltiness with an unpleasant bitterness. Very watery. Some corn in the flavor. Somewhat slightly sour. Unpleasant finish.
Pleasant is the word for this little one. Nice golden colour and sweet taste. Slips down a treat, especialy when having a Chinese meal.  A little unspectacular and lacks a little kick.
Pale golde. An extremly thin version of a pale lager, detecting a little bit of malty sweetness, but the taste disappears fast. Very drinkable but very boring

Standard straw-golden pilsner body and nose.  Decent thin yet bubbly white head. Crisp hoppy, spicy bite with dull finish. Very drinkable, but not very standout. Still, for the style and considering the alcohol percentage, quite clean and refreshing.

Bottle, 33 cl. Clear straw golden, small white head. Pretty clean and neutral malt aroma, virtually no hops. Thin and watery. Starts off a bit sweet but has a nice light bitterness in the finish. Neither bad nor interesting.
Golden colour. Top stays few seconds. Than dissapairs. Hops are low bit of premium  lager taste.  Nothing really really speacial. But kind of different flavour.

22 oz bottle:  Aroma is very light hop characteristics and a spicy corn note.  Appearance is very light straw color with a soapy white head.  Taste is like  lightly spicy budweiser.  Nothing really special about this pale lager at all.  It’s named after my favorite baseball team, but that is where the similarities end.  Not horrible, but not something that I’d seek out on a regular basis.
Is this actually from singapoe?  It doesn’t say so anywhere on the bottle or the pack.  Not worth looking for at all.

The aroma is alittle too light for my taste. Unlike most pale lagers I can detect some hops in the aroma. It looks like a pale lager. It is alittle darker than budweiser though. Suprisingly bitter for a pale lager. It’s great for the style. Some dust in the taste, no malt. Some sourness, I guess that may be corn but I am not sure. The palate is typical wateryness of a pale lager. Relatively boring mouth feel. A good lawnmower beer but definitely not something to order with a meal at a nice restaurant. The overall was brought down because of how expensive it is in our area.
Really clear colour looks very flat with some tast of corn and much water has a hint of grain.Boring beeri guess.

Bottle... AWOL ’07... Clear straw-colored lager with a small, fizzy, white head. Excellent, creamy retention. Faint aroma of grain (mainly corn) and pepper.  Well balanced flavor... moderately sweet and moderately bitter with more than just a smidgen  of tartness. Medium-bodied with a lightly creamy mouthfeel and prickly carbonation. Short, crisp, lightly bitter finish.

This beer is a clear straw color with columns of bubbles and a short-lived thin white head. Very little lacing is present. Sweetish malt and light hops aroma. Light-bodied and somewhat crisp with a fairly bland hops and malt flavor. The finish is short and lightly bitter. Indistinguishable from similar beers the world over.

Bottle from Satan.  Thanks, Dark Lord! Pours anemic yellow and smells like stale corn flakes.  Weak head and half-assed lacing.  Tastes like watered-down Heineken, which means it REALLY sucks.  Corn, water, water, and a little bit of corn.  Mouthfeel feels about as nice as your mother stroking your leg on a long trip cross-country.  Avoid like a Thai whore.

Bottle. Nice white head, both creamy and bubbly. Lasts long. Pale golden body. Very light aroma. There is some fresh sweetness, but that’s all. Pleasant and balanced flavour. Mild, dry and fresh. Well balanced carbonation. The finish is heavier than the beginning without being too bitter. Smooth finish. Very drinkable. Cool name. I like Tigers. (28.03.07)

Pours light gold with a faint head. Lots of inital carbonation. Aroma is light malts, corn and mild hops. Flavor follows the aroma. Quite sweet. Corns, malts and a light hop bite. Seems pretty crisp and sort of refreshing. But overall pretty plain.
Can at boat in Halong Bay. Clear yellow - white head. Sparkling, corn, sweetness, very thin, light salty, boring.

Bottle. Awsome apperance; pale pilsner golden , lasting  white head with good lacing  and  a  sparkling body.  Then it gets  pure Asian:  minimal aromas , minimal flavors. But  this one has a quite crisp and dry mouthfeel, not that bad.
Another oriental beer that you havev to try at least once.  Pours a very pale yellow, but has a very large head.  Has not much bite to it, but there is a strange aftertaste after 15 to 20 seconds.
A good summer beer, very refreshing.  Decent smell, fresh, crisp taste, some bitterness on the back end, but not too much; very easy to drink.
Bottle. Pours pale light golden with a medium white head that dissipates quickly. Hay-like and malty aroma with a citric edge. Quite thin. Pretty sweet and malty flavours.

bottle - Pours pale yellow with a one finger’s width head that fades fast.  It has a malt/rice aroma, sweet flavor, and not much flavor at that.  It has the light taste and dry finish of the typical Asian lager.
Bottled. A pale golden beer with a small head. Soft aroma of malt. Sweet flavour with light final bitterness. Not much pleasant.

Bottle: Clear gold in color with a white head. Aroma, grassy hops, some pale malts, yeast, and popcorn, though the popcorn may have been coming from somewhere else in the bar. Flavor, not much at all, very watery.
11.2oz  bottle. Six pack purchased, poured yellow body,  typical pale lager, easy to drink, no flavor, nothing else to say....plain.

Bottle.  No aroma.  Stale malt skunky flavor. Little to no aftertaste of any type. Very uneventful and unmemorable drinking experience.  I guess the only thing I enjoyed was the pic of the Tiger on the label. Weak. Weak. Weak.

Sampled at the Renaissance Festival. Pours a yellow body with a white, foamy head. Aroma of malt, skunk, fruit. Watery mouthfeel. Finish is light and a bit dry. Nothing too offensive but wouldn’t seek out or drink again.

Bright golden, mostly dead, under a large white head that fades fast to a thick film. Adjuncty aroma, mostly cardboards and metals. Pale malts show late, as do dusty floral notes and mild sulfurs. Rather thick in the mouth, the flavor finds sweet malteds leading to herbal bitters. Light mineral finish. Doesn’t taste as bad as its odor.


640ml bottle from Woodman’s Food Market , Carpentersville, Illinois 60110

Bottle. One finger foamy white head that was quickly goon. Body was clear light sparkling with a pale yellow color. Aroma was light malty notes of caramel, grain and some hoppy. Light bodied with a thin texture and a soft carbonation. Flavor was sweet with a light balancing bitterness.
Sweet malt aroma with mild hoppy notes.  Golden with thin white head; mild carbonation.  Sweet malt with medium bitterness.   No overbearing flavours.  Fairly smooth front to back with a dry finish.

Hmm, can be very hit and miss, in Thailand I drank GALLONS of the stuff, anywhere else in the world I seem to regret ordering it as soon as it is put in front of me, a very popular beer Internationally but not my scene
Bottle.33cl. A bit metalic and that is not to the style small amount of diacityl, smell like a german lager.? light sweetness, lightly bitter.
I was forced to drink this for several weeks, and unless there was no other choice- as was the case when I originally sampled this beer- I wouldn´t bother.
Not much here... kinda like a premium BL or ML with a much better taste... i.e. actual hops and malts.

This is a great beer for drinking on a hot summer day, which makes sense because it is brewed in singapore and that’s all they ever get there. It’s one of those beers that will really quench your thirst. It is slightly watery, but the flavor that is there is great.

Poured thin pale gold with tiny white head. The aroma was of sweet and grainy malts. I also smell a bit of sweet banana-orange sherbet. The flavor starts off with sweet malts then turns to pale grainy malts with hints of hop bitterness. No noticeable flavor or aroma flaws.
Bottle:  Pours fizzy and yellow with as much head as you want.  Malty and smooth, not much hops or bitters.  Aroma is a bit sour and grainy with some fruit essence.  Not bad for a pale lager.
Pours a nice gold with a quickly disappearing foamy head. Grainy, slightly metallic aroma, with some corn in there also. Also has a metallic flavor, harsh and not particularly enjoyable.
Pale yellow with a white head.  Very little aroma--but what is there seems to be rank.  Watery palate and straw like flavors combine for a less than appealing taste.
Pretty good hot beer. Which is why it is made in Singapore. Hot and humid. the beer is quinching, not to overpowering with much of anything or a heavy aftertaste.
Bottle. Clear yellow with mostly diminishing white head. Weak aroma of slightly sweet malt. Very weak flavor of some malt and hops. Watery on the palate. Short finish.
Bottled: Classical mass product. Grainy, corny, light sourly and weak. Metal and hop notes. Watery but drinkable.
Pours golden yellow with small white head. Malty aroma with some scents of hops. Typical lager taste, corn, hops, malts, and fruits. Decent.
Bottle. Must have had a fresh bottle. Fairly decent. Had a nice crips finish with maybe some hops detectable.
(can) Lager gold with small white head. Very little aroma. Typical pale lager flavor. So So.

An aroma of wet paper and corn. A really nice golden pour. A flavor that is not all together bad it seems to have a tad of malt and a slight sweetness that is followed by a light bitter that I don’t think has anything to do with hops. A slightly thin palate carbonation is ok. An ok beer for the style. I’ll tell you this I drank 3 Buds with dinner last night and they were only slightly better.

You don’t drink this beer for sheer quality or enjoyment really. Don’t let anyone tell you this beer is harmless. A couple of dozen will rule you out of anything productive for at least two days. Don’t make the same mistake I did.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, fruit and hops.

330ml bottle I got in a rather lacklustre 10 pack for Christmas. Light slightly sweet malt aroma with a hint of corn to it. Very spritzy looking body, pale gold with white bubbles. Sweet sort of malt flavour to it, nothing much else. Mildly dry finish. Refreshing with no off-putting flavours, nothing outstanding though.
It’s a golden tiger with an OK head. The aroma is malty, slightly hopped. The flavour is sweetish with notes of malt, caramel and it has a weak bitterness. Weeeellll, it was cold and wet... 1535
Great tasting for a session beer.  No head. Not quite dark enough for a quality lager.  No aroma, which is a good thing typically for lagers.  Good flavor for a corny beer.  Not overly carbonated.
Pours faint straw, thin, thin white head.   Odd aroma, perhaps bready and corn.  Not a whole lot going on.  Slightly sour, maybe some apricots.  Finishes dry. Not offensive. bleh.

Bottle from Hy-Vee Liquors poured into lager glass - Pours pale old with a quickly diminishing 1 finger white head; Heavy skunk and maybe some corn to the nose; Made me cringe; Skunk on the initial taste; Stale yeasty bread backtaste; I couldn’t even finish it. I took one drink and couldn’t keep going. Maybe it’s just the heavily skunked brown  bottle (doesn’t make much sense since I’ve only had problems with green bottles being skunked). I’ll buy one more time MAYBE and give it another shot.
Aroma typical of an Asian beer.  Somewhat sour on my palate but found quite appealing ice cold.  Average at best but not disappointing.

Golden body, with a quick, fully diminishing head. No lace. Bready aroma. Pretty well balanced between malts and hops, but I think the malts are a bit more prevalent. OK carbonation -- surprisingly smooth. I would definitely like to try this one on tap.

[Sampled local every week in 3 months, 2005] 

Nice wellfreshing beer, a little malty and a little hoppy taste with lowmedium body. Perfect for the hot climate.
Bottle at the Brickskeller in DC. Decent, but nothing at all to call home about. Dry, and pretty malty.
Golden lager with a strong malt flavour and fruity overtones - apricots and apples. A fine dryness in the finish - a decent beer.

Bottle. Bright clear yellow colour with an average lsting white head. Flowerish aroma and somewhat malty. Flavour is a bit sweer and malty. Short aftertaste. A normal straw lager, nothing special, nothing bad.
Pale yellow, watery, little taste... Not real terrible but nothing special either.
Nice golden yellow color with a medium head and very faint aroma. Not a very strong taste, but better than your average run of the mill macro. Good safe choice that is still slightly exotic.
In the bottle at the HyVee Oktoberfest beer tasting in Council Bluffs. Light yellow color, crisp palate, with thick head. Surprisingly pleasant.
clear and bad. bad taste.  i’d prefer less taste.barnyard, basement aromas, rotten eggs, cough drop, skunky, ass.
Can. Looks quite good with a light golden color and white head. Doesn’t tastes much though. Some citrus tones, lemon? Quite a lot of carbonation. Very thin.
Bottle:  Clear light yellow with a thin white head, wet hay in the aroma with some grass, thin bodied with solid carbonation, starts lightly bitter and ends lightly sweet.  Not bad for the style.

At Thousand Crane - 11.2oz bottle:  Pours a clear straw yellow color with a thin layer of alabaster bubbles.  Aroma and taste are of light grains, grass, some lemon and spice. Watery texture, crisp and well carbonated.

I purchased this beer in a bar in Shanghai, China, and was not disappointed, but not very impressed either.  The aroma was malty and had a hint of floral character.  The beer had an unexciting appearance, with a light golden color and thin, white head.  The flavor was decent, and largely bitter.  It had a light body with mild carbonation.
33cl bottle. (27 NOK) Watery lager. Little flavour overall. Light colouration but head retention ok in glass.
Good flavour, no head after its poured, it seemed a little flat, nothing special for an Imported beer, i wouldn’t buy it again, but would still drink it if it were free.theres better value out there!

12 oz. Bottle: Pours clear golden with a foamy white head that diminishes rather quickly into nice lacing. Aroma is lemony with hints of floral and some malts. Malt flavor is sweet with hints of corn grain. A refreshing light beer.

Probably one of my least hated pale lagers. Pale golden with a white fluffy head, aroma is lightly floral, with sweet malt in the background. The flavour is light but not too unpleasant, grainy malt and light floral hops are all there is really. The finish is crisp and refreshing.
500 mL can.  Pale yellow-gold with almost no head.  Aroma is floral, with a bit of a wine spritzer thing going on.  And corn.  Corn syrup is dominant in the flavour.  No finish.  Not a winner.

Sweet, malty, slightly white-winey fruity aroma. wood and metal. The maize lends a very mellow, cereal-like flavour that’s barely there at all. A hint of soapy lemon that’s not completely unpleasant. maybe this could work. In a sauna.

Tried this at the Decatur Beer Festival, against the better advice of my friend, who insisted that Tiger was so gross that even sailors refused to drink it.

Man, he was right.

This stuff is so bad, the police will try to wrestle it away from you.

Bottle 0,5l. Pale golden coloured - almost yellow. A soapy white head. Sweet malt is traced in the aroma and flavour - and nothing more. Why bother bringing this to Norway where we have more than enough of tasteless lagers?

Pours pale gold with a tall white head that actually lasts. Nose is lightly hoppy, kinda pilsner grassy quality. Flavor is watery and light, dry and crisp in the finish though. No skunking or canned corn flavors which was really nice, although the beer never really developed any flavor.

330ml bottle, from the November release at Vinmonopolet, Norway. Not so much to say, more or less like the rest of the style; golden, low-level foam. Weak, pale malt aroma, citric flavour and dry finish. Thin mouthfeel and watery impression. A bit strange that Vinmonopolet includes this in their assortment during the the witer season (04.11.2006).
Pale straw with an initially large white head that vanishes.  Aroma is some sweet malt and grain.  Flavor is light sweet malt.  Short crisp finish.  Fairly typical asian lager.

Ahhh another pale lager another country rating. This beer is from Singapore, but it’s called Tiger. That’s funny. Why you ask? 

Well: The name Singapore is derived from the word “Singapura” or “Lion City” as legend has it that a Sumatran prince sighted a beast that looked like a lion when he first set foot on the island in the 14th century. In the year 1819, Sir Stamford Raffles established a British (Britain also is symbolized by the Lion) trading station on this island. Singapore gained its independence as a sovereign and democratic nation on 9 August 1965. It was admitted to both the United Nations and the Commonwealth of Nations in the same year.

This beer smells like a corn syrup truck overturned in a fetid swamp that hung heavy with decaying vegetation and the offal of small swamp creatures. There are many mangrove swamps on singapores coast. The water for Tiger beers comes from there...I assume.

The body is a pale gold with a somewhat lasting white head that is mostly bubbly.
In Singapore people can be legally caned. Caning the buttocks draws much blood. It is unkwon if the person who developed this recipe has ever been caned....

The fore flavor is sweet corn/karo syrup with faint cereal grains and little to no hop presence. It has no finish as it finishes the same way it starts...grainy and sweet. 

In singapore you can be put to death for possessing over 500 mg of pot, but this beer appears to be perfectly legal.

Large bottle, white head that disappeared quickly, slight malt aroma, reminded me of the typical macro brewed lagers in the states, had a slight skunky aroma (it had to travel a long ways to get to Michigan), tasted like a light lager, little malt with a touch of bitterness and some sour on the tongue, this stuff is sold everywhere because of the World Series in town, I wouldn’t bother trying this again unless I could have fresh on location but might may not try it then either.
A skunky lager with a touch of some citrusy malt which seemed to go well with Chinese food but unfortunately never seemed to go away afterwards.

This is an average lager.  I would definitely drink one on a sweltering day in SE Asia  But there is no way I’d drink one anywhere else.  Tastes very much like a Heine.  A bit of skunk and sweet and malty, enough bite for balance.
Sampled this at the Great Decatur Beer Tasting Festival.   pale yellow in color.  no head.  malt aroma and malt flavor.  to thin to get anything else.  This was crap.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt. Flavour is fruit, malt, sweet, yellow apple.
Bottle: Pale yellow with little quick diminshing head. malty sweet taste. Watery & thin. Short finish with basically no taste. Little hoppy notes. Below average!
Pale yellow color, little white head. Mildly hoppy aroma with notes of grass. Drinkable but it will probably bore you to death before you finish.

Bottle in Vietnam. Only decent flavoursome beer widely available in Vietnam, and probably seems a lot better when its compared to the locals. A sweet lasting taste, pretty full bodied. Nutty and malty and even some banana in there for some reason. A very acceptable lager.

Gold / yellow, with a nice foamy white head. Creamed coran aroma, with a touch of black pepper. Smooth corn flavor with a bready note, and then some veggie flavors. Thin peppery finish. As it warms, a vaguely chemical character emerges that slightly mitigates what has been a surprisingly positive experience.

12 oz can. best before nov 05.

Clear yellow,  with a fluffy egg white head. Minimal lacing. 

Grainy aroma.

flavor is a little grainy, a little metalic.

light body.
 Not great, but considering it is almost a year past it’s prime, it wasn’t horrible. I’d like to see if I can get a fresher sample and try again.

Bottle (6’er) bought at halftime of Fla. St. - NC St. game.  Pretty standard flavor, definitely a "more than one" beer.  Not really what I expected for the price.  But then, when you buy based on packaging, gotta hand it to their marketeers.

12oz bottle, no date.  Aroma of light grass, skunk (at first), grainy malts and a bit of nondescript sourness.  Pours a clear pale yellow with a tiny white head, dissipating to a ring.  Flavor is again grainy with a little dirt towards the finish.  Also got a little cardboard as well.  There may or may not have been a tinge of grassy hops, but if it’s that faint, it probably isn’t there.     Light bodied and moderate carbonation.  Just another uninteresting (albeit not terrible) pale lager.

Bottle.  Bought at Vinny’s six pack shop after football broadcast.  Light gold pour and a decent, yet common lager nose.  A little corn, a little malt in the aroma, but also some sweetness.  Not bad taste, but not different in anyway from most decent lagers.  Light body and decent carbonation.  Not too bad.

(Bottle)- Not a bad brew this one. Yellowish in colour, aroma was malty-bitterness, flavour was preety smooth, a combination of a sweet fruit followed by smooth malt. This was a little watery tho, could very easily drink alot of them without noticing. Possibly great for a summers day. I would have this beer again. Not bad, Not bad at all.
Fizzy orangish yellow with a quickly diminishing head. Aroma of pears and malt. Smooth brew but very effervescent pear taste, sweet malty.

Tiger Beer
12 oz bottle
Recent bottling, stomached 09/06
Medium pour in a tulip glass

Poured a clear straw yellow with a medium white foamy quickly diminishing head.

Smelt of grain.

Taste was upfront light sweet grain followed by light bitterness on a short finish.  Mouthfeel was light, watery, overly fizzy, and heavily astringent.

Overall, a disappointing beer with bonus points for a cool beer cap, fun origami beer holder, and perfect to down while watching the Detroit Tigers win the World Series.

Bottle poured into a chilled mug: I wouldn’t say it’s exactly a pale yellow, it’s a tad darker. Thin fizzy head disappeared almost immediately. Slightly malty aroma and taste with a crisp finish. It’s a mediocre pale lager, but more than I expected from Singapore to be sure.

Had on an Air Lingus flight. Pilsner yellow with white magically disappearing head. Aroma was typical pilsner smelt like beer for lack of a better term. Flavor may have suffered from the slightly too warm temp. It tasted a little watered down but was more refreshing than say a macrobrew.
Bottled.  A "gift."  Pours clear yellow with a hint of orange.  Head disappears quickly.  Aroma is biiter-pilsner-like.  Almost no taste.  Watery body.  Not offensive, but not one to buy a case of.

500ml can, 5% a/v

Pours a standard lager colour with a standard lager head.. Nothing impressive about the appearance. The smell is of citrus and veggies. The taste, is barely there, but clean with a nice finish. Not a bad beer considering its from singapore (No offense you singaporeeans)

Light gold body with a white colored head. The aroma is earthy bell pepper with some potatoes. There is some decent note of bread crust. The taste is rotting leaves with some dirt mixed in. There is also some nasty burnt vegetable matter. This is a fairly lame pale lager, but not the worst I have tried.

Clear, yellow appearance, fast fading head, no lacing.  Sweet, malty, vegatal aroma.  Crisp, fairly clean (as long as it stays chilled) taste with a miniscule hop presence.  Light bodied, well carbonated mouthfeel leading to a short lived, boring finish.

12 oz bottle at Indonesian restaurant in Oakland area.  Pours yellow and clear with a small white head.  Aroma is quite sweet and adjuncty with hints of floral hops.  Flavor doesn’t deviate much from the expectations of the aroma, lightly sweet with a bit of corn, mild soap and mild hop bite in the finish.  Light body and moderate carbonation.  Served as a nice counter point to my Malaysian barbequed lamb chops, but ultimately is nothing more than yet another mediocre, fizzy, yellow lager.

Found this bottled at Binny’s in St. Charles, Illinois.  Straw yellow, bubbly and clear, with a tall foamy white head that dissippated slowly into a film.  Nose of canned corn, slightly sweet and cereal-y.  A tad on the dry side, but with a thicker mouthfeel than most Asian lagers I’ve had, similar to an American wheat.  Finishes clean and dry.  A good example of an overwrought style.

From a 640 ml. Tiger embossed, gold foiled wrapped neck, brown bottle with a coded freshness date on the bottom of back label.

Poured a pale lager golden with a foamy white head that settled into a thin lacing.

Aromas of grain husk, cereal malts and a bit herbal.

Good carbonation and a crisp, dry, smooth light bodied mouthfeel.

Not bad, but ho hum tasting, sweet cereal malts with a little huskiness, a soft herbal, grassy hoppiness, a smooth bitterness, and dry sweet malty finish, pretty clean overall, decent, average macro lager drinkability.

Passable macro lager from Asia Pacific, was given to me to try today by the beer manager at a St. Louis liquor store I frequent when I’m in town.

The 12 ounce bottle poured a crystal clear light yellow beverage with a small fizzy head that was entirely diminishing and left almost no lacing on the glass. The aroma had notes of wet wood, grains and no discernable hop character at all. The body was light with medium carbonation and a watery texture. The flavor started off lightly bitter with a taste like old leather. The finish was medium in length and the bitterness grew a little more prominent through the finish. This is not a beer that I would care to partake of a second time.
Light malty aroma. Large frothy white head. Fair lasing. Clear yellow body. Sweet light initial flavor. Light watery palate.
Pours a pale, pale, pale yellow, no head.  Aroma is corn.  Flavor is corn.  Not nasty, perhaps even refreshing, but entirely ineeded.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a weak head. Light aroma of hops and notes of malt. Malty flavour with a touch of hops. Very average for a pale lager.

This is my 100th beer. An OK lager, or maybe I was lucky enough to get a decent 6-pack that didn’t rot enroute to the U.S. Hoppy scent, watery taste with faint malty taste and a dry, astringent finish. I love the bottle though. Among Southeast Asian lagers, Singha and Tiger will forever be behind my beloved San Miguel Beer...

Bottle. Pours a clear pale amber with a huge, fluffy white head that eventually diminishes to a ring of foam. The aroma is slight, and slightly flowery. Has most of the major macro lager characteristics. Just a little bit astringent, but no other defects. It is what it is: a good example of a bland style of beer.

12oz bottle.  Clear pale golden hue.  Slight white head.  Corny, grainy, slight caramel nose.  Nothing too complex.  Light, crisp, decent enough malt note.  Dry and adjuncted.  Is that a word, adjuncted?  Smooth with a slight cinnamon and maple note.  Easy.

The Budweiser of Southeast Asia.  Signage for the beer is everywhere even when it isn’t available.  Nothing terrible bad about the beer but it’s definitely nothing special.  Standard mass appeal, served ice cold, adjunct riddled beer. Although it has a nice edge and a fairly smooth finish.  Cheers!
Just a standard lager, nothing special at all. The can has  medals of awards the beer has won, what I want to know is who is giving out these awards?Tthey must be out of their minds!

doesnt kill you that heineken brews everything?? or carlsberg as well in Southeastasia.  This is readily available throughout the area.  clear bland pale lager with a white top, small notes of vegetation in the nose.  slightly bitter end feel.  adjunct city.

pale yellow with a frothy head.  slightly sweet aroma.
 flavor is somewhat malty and balanced considering it is a generic  lager.
 nothing eceptional but it is what passes as an exotic import in india
cool bottle, golden pour, carbonation throughout, a slight malty after-taste,  with a little sweetness
Pour is a pale yellow with a white head.  Aroma is no where to be found.  Flavor is much the same, just a pale lager cornyness.  I did not expect much and that’s what i got.
I actually quite like this beer for it being a pale lager it has a bit of flavour for it’s catagory. Malty and sweet...it’s refreshing. I like the tiger on the label too - grrrrrrrr

on the first smell, this beer reminded me of stewed tomatoes. pours a crisp golden color with a medium white head.  Taste could be better, but on the whole, it was refreshing, with light malts and grass.

500 mL can.  A great refreshing summer beer.  Very simple and smooth.  Smells a little sour or lemony but then has no bitter after taste you would expect.  Not much hops but very light malty taste, clean finish.  Not the tastiest lager out there, but very smooth.

Just another crappy tropical asian lager. The adjunct (maize) is quite obvious, and the alcohol is blaringly so for something that is only 5% abv. The carbonation is shallow and a bit biting and once it subsides you get a quick burst of metallic bitter twang. Not quite as cloyingly sweet as some others, but after one of these I’m calling for a cleansing ale. Bring on some LCPA.

Pours a clear bubbly pale yellow with a thin amount of froathy white head.  Aroma is a bit grassy and corny and a tad sweet.  Flavor is slighty honey sweet and then typical pale lager touch of hops.  Overall, average.

Pale gold body with a minimal white head that diminishes quickly. Corn and honey aroma, nothing that great about it.  Very malty body, too little in the way of hops... highly overbalanced.  Dry ending.
Abit more hops would help this one, quite malty, drinkable if its hot, but I’d otherwise pass.
33 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Clear golden colour with a weak head. Light aroma of hops and notes of malt. Malty flavour with a touch of hops. Very average for a pale lager, someway dull.
Pale yellow lager that tastes like every other pale lager you could drink. It’s refreshing on a hot summer day, but it’s still nothing special.

From bottle in Bangalore, India.  A drinkable beer from Singapore.  Actually not a half-bad maltiness, which is very usual for beers coming from Southeast Asia. Some OK noble hop flavor coming through.  Simple, clean beer.  Nothing bad, nothing especially good.  No real reason to drink it outside of Asia and nothing else is available. Ok.

A refreshing mid-end lager without much going on. Sampled straight from the bottle, so no idea what it looks like, but it wasn’t overly carbonated and had a light mouthfeel. Overalll malty flavor with very little hopping. This was the first beer in which I could detect a light metallic aftertaste in the flavor. Nothing special, but not bad.

The gold medal says it all, not every beer can boast to having won the beer world cup as Tiger did in 2004 and also in the lager category for bottled and canned lagers it is brewed under licence in many places but the best to my taste is the ones brewed in KL Malysia
Been to Singapore, but I’ve never tried their beer, so Tiger it was.  Pretty plain beer, similar to many North American beers.  It’s a good beer, but far from anything special.
This has got to be the one of the most boring beers I’ve tasted. I don’t understand how they can claim to be world renown.. eeks...

Bottle. Watery, weak, thin and boring. Not much to it, far too safe! Apologies if i’m generalising, but this is the 7th or 8th asian beer i’ve had up to this point and they’re all thoroughly bland and normally watery. Singha is possibly the slight leader in this area, and that is saying something.

the taste is splendid. been drinking this beer all my life as its my home product. hugely underated by singaporeans, tourist coming to my country must try it. golden brown in color and rich in flavour. with a smooth aftertaste.

..had this beer a couple of times in cavendish square at this asian restuarant.no food though!...this beer is quite clean.deium gold..slight head..low bubbles.real drinkable..not to shabby..nice subtle tasty bitters..a session beer for young adults b’cuz of its easy going aurora.
Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a fizzy white head.  Aromas of hops, grass, and grains.  Flavor is a nice crisp hoppy/grain taste with a nice clean finish.

(04.01.06) On tap at the Four Seasons coffee shop, Hotel Kunlun, Beijing, China. Clear golden yellow with diminishing large white head. Average carbonation. Sweet malt aroma. Light-to-medium bodied beer that starts with light malt sweetness and corn flavor.  Some sourness detected. Infected beer or tap line?  Finishes with light hop bitterness and malt fade. A rather mediocre pale ale. The bottled version was better tasting.

Slightly skunky aroma with some off grain smells.  Very pale gold, webby head.  Very good label and cap.  In fact, the label and cap were the high point of this beer.  Sweetish, under-hopped, skunky malting. Thin.

The aroma has malt and no detectable hops. The appearance is pale gold with a small head. The flavor is mildly bitter and malty. It’s uncomplicated except for a toasted herb bread taste that is also present. The palate is thin. There is nothing bad here and there is nothing all that good either. There just isn’t all that much to report.
330 ml bottle.  Medium yellowish going to orange color.  Good head after pouring but lost it within 5 mins.  Skunk aroma.  Low carbonation.  A bit sour but it doesn’t really taste something.

Poured from a bottle at Double Happiness, a cool underground bar in Manhattan’s NoLiTa nabe. It smelled stinky, and I thought it might be skunked. The bartender assured me that that’s what it was supposed to smell like. The taste was only a little bit better. I had it without food, which I think was also a mistake. Not one I’d return to.

Catfight: Tiger Lager vs Tiger Special Classic Edition rated head to head in an unsensational winner-takes-bugger-all contest. This one-off all-Singaporean bout comes courtesy of Bridge (Classic Edition) and Nice Houseguest With Poor Taste In Beer (Tiger Lager). Does Tiger Lager have the claws to see off the Classic Edition?
