Or will the CE’s vaunted addition of crystal malt turn the contest? Does anyone care? Let’s find out... Appearance (both poured simultaneously into identical chalices): a clear win for Classic Edition. TL arrives with a watery gold body and skinny head that vanishes immediately. CE is brighter, deeper and has a head that not only lasts but also laces. TL 2/5, CE 4/5. Aroma: TL is sugary sweet, with cardboardy malt. Uninspiring. Can it get worse? Surprisingly, yes. CE smells stale, despite being well within its ’consume-by’ date. It’s fruity, with some wet dog. TL 3, CE 2. Palate: TL is surprisingly oily, with a dry finish. CE is fizzier. TL 3/5, CE 3/5. Flavour: TL is all sugary cornwater, with faint banana and a dry, mildly grainy finish. CE benefits from the crystal malt, but marginally. It has Juicy Fruit chewing gum and canned pear notes. It’s much maltier and just as sweet. TL 3/10, CE 4/10. Overall: I expected the Lager to win this hands down, but there was no contest. The CE is no classic, despite the name, but it’s superior in most aspects. Total Scores: Tiger Lager 1.6, Classic Edition 2.0. (Tiger Lager: 330ml bottle, bb Dec 2006; Classic Edition: 330ml can, brewed Dec 30, 2005)

I’m amazed that I have heard so many positive reviews of this beer.  It was colossally disappointing.  Very little flavor and a watery palate.  Give me a Singha, Tsingtao, or a Kirin Ichiban any day over this.  I may deserve a caning for saying this but Sillipore needs to stick to business trade and stay out of brewing.

Bottle in Singapore, Draft in Beijing
Neither very remarkable.  Pale, clear yellow with soapy white head.  Not much aroma or taste.

Bottle. OK pale lager. Frothy white good mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour.
OK aroma and flavor, A little watery.

Bottle at the Penny Black, Northwich (JDW) 29/10/2004
Clear golden coloured with fruit and hop aromas. Crisp slightly dry malt finish.

Bottled.  Clear yellow beer, very small white head.  Sweet nose with a touch of hops.  Light body and lightly sweet taste which is somewhat malty.  Some strange bitterness in the finish, doesn’t last long, though.  Not metallic, but not balanced.
21 Feb 06 - Light malt aroma.Clear amber,ok heading&suds lace.Sweetish malt flavour.Slight medicinal finish&herb finish after.

Light yellow body, medium white head. Clean slightly herbal nose, weak initial maltiness that disappears into a bland citric finish. Watery lager, poor but not insulting, drinkable if you are just thirsty.
Bottle.  Straw malt aroma.  Golden yellow with small head.  Light sour malt flavor - not much else.  Moderate acidity and carbonation.  Nothing offensive but very little in the flavor department.
A light straw yellow beer with a weakish head. A clean hoppy nose with a hint of lemony citrus. A dry hoppy taste with the citrus aspect coming through again.
Strong malt hop aroma. Crystal clear yellow colour with poor hed and lacing. Bitter hop malt flavour. Flat palate.
Clear, yellow pils style with quickly dissipating white head.  Sweet.  Corn.  Suitable for occasional jokes on friends.
Golden yellow with a white head.  Seem to be an every day run of the mill pilsner.  Nice hops and not overwelming so it’s good with food.
Bottle. White, good-looking, high head. Yellow clear body. Weak malt aroma. Sweet hops flavor, again corn is the sinner. Why do they add this (money money money ?). Gold medals hm ?

Bottle.  Light blond color with an aroma of hops and citrus.  Over carbonated, reminds me of a typical  mexican beer.  A slight bit skunked.  I imagine that this is shipped warm from wherever it’s brewed.  In the end, this is a beer that you can drink in quantity.
Gold yellow colour, flat, small white head. Nice fruity aroma, little malty (some hints of banana?) Rather flat taste, light finish, little dry bitter, misses some character.

First rating
Initial Rating Date: 1/29/2006
Very light colored, almost no smell to it. Very little taste, watery. Might work on a hot day on the beach when you’re thirsty, but this was a very boring beer, not worth the money I spent on it.
3/2/3/2/5=1.5

330 ml can on a BA flight from Gothenburg to London , sampled on January 26, 2012.
Clear pale golden color, fluffy white head. Sweet, sugary, light acidic, vegetables, cream, hints of malt scent. Sweet, herbal, dry, bitter, sugary taste. Mineral, grainy aftertaste, also sugary. Spritzy mouthfeel, low bitterness.
3/3/4/3/8=2.1

Bottled 0,33L. Much compact and adherent head, good fullness. Yellow pale color, shining and with a fine fizz. Watery and gaunt scent, light notes of malyt, dry grassy and lemon. Enough pungent taste even if much inconsistent and with a unbalanced bitter on the end.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a small white head. Weak aroma and a thin malty, light skunky taste. Light body with a thin finish.
Nice watery yellow beer with a tiny bit of hops.  I guess Singapore isn’t quite prepared to join the ranks of Germany and Belgium when it comes to quality brews.
Sampled at the local beer festival.  Not sure what is so special about this pale lager, it was mediocre at best.  A bit of skunky taste.  Extra points for the hot babes pouring the samples of this.
Pale golden colour with a minor mostly diminishing white head. Weak aroma of malt and hobs. Sweet taste in a watery body. On on warm day, i might drink one more of these, but dont count on it.
This is just another any old lager. Pretty sweet, but really not as good as the 33 export I also had at a hookah bar in NYC.

Bottled. Pale golden and white head. Light malty aroma. Light malty aroma with some fruityness. Quite fizzy mouthfeel and a rather dry finish. Time for a Tiger? Not for me, it’s too boring. Rating: 3-2-4-3-8-2.0. 051231

Bottle. It’s a clear, almost golden beer topped by a small, white head. Neutral aroma with pale malts and a fruityness reminiscent of yellow apples. There’s some hints of bitterness in the flavor, as well as fruityness and pale malts. Some bitterness in the finish too. Medium body. Sure, a decent beer, but uninteresting as hell. 091223
Pale golden colour with very little aroma.  This beer is a little sweet for my taste and is also quite thin.  Certainly not a favorite.
What a world class pale lager! God damn it is good. Very fresh aroma and flavor, and low in weight, which signifies that you can drink a lot of them without getting hurt over a night.

Clear, golden straw body with medium carbonation and an ample, cottony white head. Aroma of lemon zest, lemon juice, canned corn, and buttery nuts. Somewhat metallic, sweet and relatively tart. No sign of hops anywhere. Watery texture. This is basically bottled lemonade. I could ask why they bother to brew these things but that would beg the obvious question why I bother to drink and rate them.

I’m not sure what they won a gold medal in, as the bottle says.  Anyway this was pretty much your average lager.  Was kinda thin, had strong carbonation, and didn’t have much taste.  Bit malty.  Might be good on a hot lawn mowing day.
Bottle. Pours a pale yellow color. Aroma is skunky and a little sour. Bland beer. Some malt and grain I believe. Not the worst beer in the world.

Tiger Beer Lager-Hainan Asia Pacific Brewery-355ml can-pours a foamy white head with yellow color.  Aroma is grain.  Taste is grain, good carbonation.  A bit better than the standards for this region.  Dated 10/_/05.
Bottle. Pale golden colour. Small white head. Grassy aroma. Watery, some hints of citrus flavor and a little grassy. Some weak hints of hops too. Not a beer I like.

Appears a pale gold with a small white head that quickly fizzles out. Some lacing sticks to the glass with nice carbonation streams rising to the top.
Smell is of an American adjunct lager. Smells of creamed corn, and sugary pilsner.
Taste is of the corn again, mixed with some carapils malt. I guess it’s ok. Nothing too obtrusive in this one to make it gross.
Mouthfeel is smooth and crisp with a mild bit of corn sugar sticking around.
Drinkability isn’t too bad. I was happy to get to try this out at Wolfgang Puck’s in Lake Buena Vista, FL.
Bottle. Light in color. Small head that disappears almost as fast as you have put the bottle aside. Nice carbonation. Easy drinkable. Not very hoppy. A beer with a "girlish" appeal.

Bottle: Clear pale gold with a thick, solid white head. Lots of uplifting lemony malt aromas, floral overtones and the occassional spicy harmonic. Watery, juicy, lightly citrus hops to begin, with some tannic cardboard malts mid-palate and a grassy finish. Not bad for the classic tropical thirst quencher.
This, I think, is a real boring Asian lager. Similar to tha Japanese Kirin. Not much aroma. The taste is little grassy. That´s all.
640ml bottle poured a clear pale yellow with a short lived white head. Aromas of honey and corn. Palate was thin but crisp. Flavors of white bread, some sweetness with a clean mildly bitter finisf.

(Bottle brought to Denmark from Vietnam. Cool.) Yellow, clear color with a white fizzy head. Aroma a bit like grass. Dry flavor with some metal and yeast (!). Very thin and not particularly pleasant on a dark, cold fall-evening in Scandinavia.
(Bottle 50 cl) Pilsener golden with a creamy, white head. Weak, malty aroma. Sweetish malty flavour with a disharmonious and rather sharp and unpleasant bitterness. Thanks to MiniLøve. 101105
Its probably cobra masquerading as another beer because i cant taste much difference at all. Not surprising really, boring plain lager int it.
Tastes like earwax and saccharine disolved in soda water. Undeservedly popular in many countries in Asia.

The usual pale gold bubbly color you come to expect from these pale lager imports, short head filled with various sized bubbles, no lacing.  Aroma is sweet and thin.  Granular sugar sweetness with hints of green apple.  So, here’s a beer from Singapore - that’s the most exciting part of it.
Pours pale yellow with a thin white head. Sweet corn aroma. The flavour is more corn, some bittering hops. Thin watery palate. Not really that good.

Bottle (From Sainsburys, BBE Sep 06). No head - industrial cider look-a-like. Fruity funky high alcohol, green apple aromas. Sweet smelling. Sweet and yet at the same time thin body which draws attention to the over sweetness in a way a richer body would not. Unenjoyable.
Another bitter and sweet at the same time beer. It is nice, but a little tiring, not for a prty or a drinking session.

Pours a clear pale yellow with a fully receding white head.  Aroma of biscuit, corn, and sweet malts. Tastes lightly sweet, and noticably more drinkable than the average lager.  Light bodied with high carbonation.  Finishes very neutral.  I’m sure there’s rice in here, but it’s corn that I’m tasting.  Pale lagers do taste quite similar across the globe, but I’m consistantly amazed at how much I prefer the Asian varieties.
500ml bottle from Sainsburys. Pale gold with disappearing white head. Smell of maize. Flavour is dull and awful. In fact I don’t normally pour beer away but this was awful, so I did

Very classy packaging for this beer ,the label and 22 oz bottle look good.
The beer itself is pretty clean, simple lager in the German style. Pretty similar to Becks but with maybe just a touch more taste.
I actually, much to my surprise, found this quite nice and easilly drinkable.
don’t bother reading this. the beer is Nothing great.  Tastes like every other pale lager.
Bottled.  A golden coloured lager with a pleasant white head.  The aroma and taste are lagerish with grass but also a little hop.  Clean and drinkable, beats a lot of lagers comfortably.

Bottle. An employee of mine brought this back for me from Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia. Very malty, creamy lager aroma with some corn notes. Crystal clear gold with a cascade of champagne like caronation rushing up to form a smooth, lasting, tight bubble, white head. Nice artistic lace. I must also note that the label and cap are very attractive. I love the blue, orange and gold color combination and the tiger logo on the cap and label are sharp. Brewed to please the masses, and please them I’m sure it does. As pale lagers go, pretty darn good. And I now see that it enjoys a welll above average percentile in its style. I think this beer is underrated, as are the majority of beers on this site that aren’t big and flavorful. I could see myself at a 5 star hotel in Ipoh, enjoying a Tiger at the bar with some bar snacks.
Clear pale straw colour with thin stark white head. Mild grain yeast nose. Mild bread taste with mild malt hints and dry bread finish.

A Mes rate: 
Well its pretty rank. I have yet to try an Asian lager that I like but I am assured they exist. I only drank it as it was free and there was nothing else but alcopops.
I had to have a jug of Tiger when in Singapore.  The beer is OK, but nothing work taking home. Orange in color, little hops flavor.

Can (500ml).  Poured clear, pale, oily yellow-gold with a big, fizzy, rocky, ephemeral head.  Aroma strongly metallic and chemical, with harsh burnt flour notes and plenty of sugary sweetness.  Taste is sweet and chemical and fairly harsh, but a strange apple/carrot juice flavour makes is almost horrfyingly interesting.  Mouthfeel is thin and metallic.  Apart from that strange sweet juice note in the flavour, just another S.I.L.

light orangish-yellow color out of the bottle.  small white head. some remnants laced glass. smell is sweet like corn and grass. can taste the corn too. light body on the palate. watery.  didn’t have with asian food. maybe thats the key?

This bottled brew poured a medium sized head of white colored frothy medium to large sized mostly lasting bubbles that left behind a transparent straw yellow colored softly carbonated body and a good lacing.  The aroma was mellow with smooth malty notes and the mouth feel was smooth clean crisp with a mild tingle in the finish.  Its malt hop flavor was good and I especially liked the clean crisp notes in this brew.
Clear light yellow color, short white head. Aroma of corn, some faint hops. I could actually almost copy the description from the Kingfisher Lager. Watery taste.

After spending a summer in Asia, Tiger beer was a favorite of mine in the area. I think that this was largely due to the lack of options at local watering holes. That being said, the Tiger really is an average beer with minimal taste. It pours a pale yellow with limited aroma. The taste is tingles the palate on the way down followed by a light alcohol aftertaste. A nice beer in 35+deg weather and when choices are few...

Pours a light, clear orange out of the bottle.  No strong aromas, smells like a light macro brew.  Taste is kinda bland as well, a little grassy.  It does go very well with Chinese foods.  Perhaps I’m a bit sentimental from when I drank it in China.  And especially there, if you can get it on tap, it’s gonna be a good night.  But watch out the next morning.  That’s when the Tiger bites.

Bottle from Total Wine, Cary, NC.  Pale gold pour with some hopcit (not much) in aroma and taste.  I think this one may bust my Singapore cherry.  I wish I could cane a hot blonde chicks ass while I drink this.  That would raise my score by 0.2 easily.
A light aroma and amber in color.  The head was white and there was light bitterness but no appreciable aftertaste.
Bottle; Slight amber in color with a large white head. Some lacing. Smells of spices and malts. The taste was stale like with some after taste of alcohol. Light in body.
Very piss yellow with alot of lacing and a thick but light head. The taste is alot of corn and a a touch of malt. Probably goes good with asian cuisine but not a normally enjoyable beer.

Light straw yellow with a medium fizzy head.
Aroma is sweet malt, corn and grass with a bitter corn flavor.
Finish is sharp and bitter...blah!
Quite promising appearance and first malty,sweet taste, but the lack of a bitter finish was a disappointment
Had this one at a chinese restaurant in Switzerland (Fribourg). Similar to Heineken but slightly inferior.

Wow this was really awful. Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very pale yellow color with a large soapy white head. The aroma is sour skunk. The flavor is sour skunk with a hint of pepper on the finish. Drain pour.

Bottle. Best before end of 7/05. Poured a medium sized white head with fine-small sized bubbles, lacing was sparse, carbonated, transparent, and a pale yellow hue. Aroma was malty. Period. Flavor was malty and  hops. Tingly palate. Medium body.
Zurich - Gold in color, kind of hop/wheat nose with a follow in the taste then it breaks off and loses the flavor for a nice smooth ending.
Pale straw yellow with moderate head, malty nose. Basic and boring, on par with most mass-marketed North American lagers. Nothing exciting here, but nothing offensive either.

(bottle) Clear golden colour with a medium foamy white head. Corny malty aroma. Sweet flavour and a malty beginning, quite balanced slightly dry and bitter finish. Surprisingly good. Sorry for my bad expectations.

Bottled.
Yellow coloured with a small white head.
Aroma of malts with noppy notes.
Thin watery flavour with notes of malts and hops.
No aftertaste.
One of the most tasteless beers I’ve had.

Bleh...  another strong corn pale lager from the far east.  This beer is best with lemon and only when eating a huge spicy meal.  Not much going on beyond the corn flavour and aroma.  It does give off a huge white foamy head on its bright golden colour.
This is quite a nice bottle, thats aboput it really. There is some sort of carbonated liquid that has alcohol inside but it doesnt taste of anything so im not sure what it is.

It’s funny how some of the lowest rating beers in the world seem to win more awards than all other far superior ones, take Hahn Premium for example (shocker!) racing away with the AIBA award, each and every year it’s presented. This is another of the conundrums questionably scooping up awards at festivals but failing miserably on RateBeer (where it seems to matter most). Now I know it’s in poor spirits to attack a beer, but sometimes the lines need to be drawn. Tasted from the bottle and poured into a pilsner glass. Clear gold body with high carbonation shooting up to a short loose, bubbly white head. Aroma had an initial bite to it but lapsed into wafts of ’DMS’ vege’ water, egg yolks and freshly mowed grass. A little better in the mouth, cleaner and quite dry with a high amount of corn and plastic flavours coming through and a little grapefruit and cantaloupe. Highly carbonated, not bitingly, and very light bodied. Finishes off with a husky and gassy forgettable swallow. Quite a boring, one dimensional lager that has taken me years to try, and minutes to forget!!!

I can’t say anything too offensive about this pale lager, because there’s simply not that much here.  Pale yellow with pale sweet malt aroma and pale sweet malt flavor and yes, a pale watery finish, there’s nothing really bad about it.  Except that it’s too watered down and flavorless to be a real beer.

Pours a pale yellow with a frothy white head that quickly dissipates to nothing. Smells lightly grassy and a bit sour, astringent.

Taste is grassy, watery and oddly sweet. Probably the corn I am tasting. Not much here at all and not very pleasant. Thin mouth. Not that drinkable. Will take the sting out of spicy Thai food. There I said something nice.

Bottle: Pale straw yellow, clear, with a tiny white head that quickly fades to nothing.  Aroma is mild at best, light malt and grain hints.  Taste is slightly sweet grains up front, followed by mild cereal and light corn adjucts.  Light bodied, watery, slightly overcarbonated.  Pretty inoffensive, easy to drink.

White head on a yellow body. This beer is designed to quench the drinker’s thirst in a hot environment, and does not have any other ambition. As such, it is pretty effective, but it is certainly not a beer I would sit back and just enjoy. The taste is pretty unremarkable.

Bottle, at home.
Yellow with white head, quickly gone. No lacings. Aroma of malt and light of hops. Flavor moderate of malt and hops. Light body, watery, soft carbonated. Does it have a taste???
clear golden colour with small white head. light malty flavour. very boring and thin.

surprisingly not a bad beer, i got this from a distribution place and it was a pretty flavorful tasting pale lager, much like a kiran, but with a littte more bite at the end this is an excellent beer if u want to try something different from singapore

Pours golden just like all of the other asian beers I’ve tried.  Not much head.  Disappears quickly.  More malt on the flavor than other Asian beers but nothing to get excited about.  Watery and carbonated on the palate.  It was o.k. to drink after doing some carpentry work tonight to quench my thirst, but as I guessed nothing good about this one really.

From tap. Poured very light gold with about a finger of artificial looking head which disappeared pretty quick. Aroma - what aroma? My senses could have been a little attenuated as I was following the ABC Extra Stout, but all I could detect was a faint hint of vomit. Taste - what taste? Best that can be said is that it was not offensive. Someone has obviously beaten this tiger with a VERY large stick and turned it into a pussy cat. Palate was watery and weak. The ONE redeeming factor is that it goes down very easily in the tropical heat. This is nothing like the beer I remember 15 years ago.

Light, thin golden body with a thin, white head.  Bland, boring aroma mostly of light malt and rather obvious adjuncts.  The body is light, thin and unappealing.  Flavors are nothing to speak of, mostly the malt/adjunct blend with a touch of mild hops at the finish.  Not my go to beer when it Asia, to be sure.

Bottle, pours a very plain pale lager color with small-nonexistant-head of white foam, looks synthetic.  Awful aroma and flavor, tastes like water with malts and hops added, wait, that’s beer, this doesn’t taste like that, no.  Tis worse than beer.

Bottled: Pour reveals a standard gold clear mega lager with a bubbly white cap ...minimal retention and lacing. Fizzy.

Reasonable aroma...some garins and grassy hops over a light fruit tone. Light bosy easily drinkable, fair balance between sweet malts and hops dry clean finish...this is a premium mega lager taste.

500 ml can.  Pale golden colour, thick lasting white head.  Light pale malt aroma, soapy, almost no hop aroma.  Bland dusty flavour with a bit of light malt.  Not a whole lot going on in here... booooring.

A very attractive lager, clear gold with a firm white head..nice! Aroma is very fruity/hoppy with a nice maltiness in the background. The fruit carries over to the palate and the malt creeps in on the longish finish. I enjoy this and am quite surprised by the low overall rating, but that’s life I suppose.

500ml can. Golden pour, head is white with large bubbles and collapsing foam. Soft note of herbal hops. Light malt/grain mix with a little malt sweetness breaking through. Towards the finish light hops show up.
Canned. Golden beer with a thick white head, collapsing quickly. Nice perfumy aroma, rather fruity. Light sweetness. No hops, and light finish. Good bodied for an Asian lager.

The faint and unremarkable aroma lacks any complexities more than hints of dish soap and Bud Light.  The only true complexity of this beer is the perplexing manner by which it seems to entirely avoid the back of my tongue, leaving the tasting experience completely hollow.  The major benefit of this SE Asian beer is that it does not get significantly worse as its temperature rises slightly.  It’s goal seems to be neither to offend nor impress.

I dont think this actually smells or tastes of anything at all, i hazard a guess at bitter hoppy aroma after painting the inside of my nostrils with it, im still not sure though, Ill let everyone know what it tastes like when the results get back from the lab.
Simple, quenching lager best suited to a long hot day. Nothing spectacular but does the job.

Aroma:light malt,bitterness.
Appearance:Gold with a small head.
Flavor:Water and malt.
This beer taste nothing.

Hoppy bitterness in the aroma, mild sweet corn or vegetable, not too skunky, and some chemical notes. Pale clear yellow with thin foamy white lacing head. Light bodied with medium-high carbonation. Starts with mild bitterness and medium acidity. Sweetness taste a bit adjuncty, with corn or rice perhaps. Not too bad for the style, though, and there is a bit of crispness to it. Finish maintains the carbonic acidity, mild corn sweetness, and more rounded bitterness. After is clean with notes of hoppy bitterness.
Bottled. Golden colour, small white head. Sweet malty aroma, with hints of barley. Sweet caramel in taste with hints of yeastiness. The aftertaste has except for sweetness hints of maize.

Was out shopping today and came across this in the cooler, and then realized I had had this about a year ago. Tiger Beer sponsored an event I attended in Toronto last Feb. Not impressionable to be honest. Kind of typical in most sense, added a vegetable sort of aftertaste I found weird that the time.
Bottle from SpringsLicker.  Typical pale lager in appearance.  Strange bitterness, vegetable hoppy???  Thin bodied.

This would be more aptly named "Zoo Tiger", ’cause it resembles the smelly, lifeless, haggard-ass beasts licking up their own vomit, living in a cement box, much more than it resembles the noble creature in the wild.
Pours pale yellow with a quick dissolving head. Tastes skunky, grassy, and watery. 
Not so good.

[can] Bright dark straw with a spongy head that quickly becomes little white lillypads.  Aroma is a nice balance between noble hops and malt, but is very subdued, and with a grainy note.  Flavour is simliar to a good continental pilsner, but the malt is not crisp--it’s sort of acid that lingers on the tongue.  Also, very watery.  Little bitterness and a bit sweet.  Medium body and lots of carbonation.  I wouldn’t have this beer again.
Bottle Pale, golden body.  White, fizzy head, fully diminishing.  Hints of hops in the nose.  Uninteresting lightly bitter flavour.
Fizzy yellow with a big white head. Sweet corn aroma. Sweet malty flavor. Much better than I expected.

i found this bottle in the fridge i don’t know where i got it.skunk aroma corn and nastyness. almost transparent yellow color dont taste too bad corny with a lil hops, thin body not a bad flavor junt a lcak of flavor

Fizzy pale yellow beer with a fizzy white head. Aroma is a sweet mix of cheap malt and corn sugar with a faint hops presence. Flavor is sweet and sugary but some malty notes appear in the palate. Finishes with a bold burst of hops bitterness. Overall, this is my favorite Asian beer. Nothing spectacular, but excellent for the style. A pleasant surprise.

You could nearly accuse this beer of being a safe choice in the tropics and this is certainly true in Thailand and Singapore.Pale gold; looks commercial. Nose not doing much aside from some mildly sweet adjunct. Soft mouthfeel, again very commercial with minimum levels of hoppiness and not much more in the malt department.

Look, smells and tastes just about what I expected out of a S.E. Asian Lager. Mild scent of non-distinguishable malts and hops, slight wheat and dusty scents too. A bit sweet but has a bit thicker of a body than most of the other Asian macro lagers. Nothing fancy here. Would be better were I in Singapore on a hot humid evening washing down some spicy Szechwan dish or Indian curry
Pale yellow, almost whitish.  Some adjunct sweetness in the aroma.  Flavor is weak but there is a surprising amount of hop in the finish.  Thin as water.  Better than BMC but not by much.
Golden color and a thick white head fates quikley. Thin and weak. sweet aroma. watery palate.
Watery, no taste and some floral smell. Sweet malt and corn sweetness. Dry very bitter and metallic aftertaste. Pale yellow. Carbonation. A lot of soapy foam that gives some creamyness

Golden color and a thick white head that holds for a decent amount of the glass. Aroma is slightly malty.  Slightly bitter with a strong malt base.  Aftertaste is more or less the same as the body of the beer.  This style is very similar to other asian beers I have had.

Having tasted this beer for the first time while in Singapore which is were the beer is brewed.  I most certainly have a different impression of the beer than most.  I thought that it was very good for a pale lager, which I don’t usually choose first.
Light colour. Aroma is a simple bitterness but there is almost no bitterness in the flavour which is more sweet and corny. YUK

Pale golden color out  of the bottle with a one finger fizzy white head that quickly dissappeared.  Not much of a nose.  Some malty sweetness with a faint citrus finish.  Not much going on here, but not all that bad.
Yellow color with a low sticky head. Some malt up front, honey-ish, low bitter. Thin and weak. Not as bad as I expected, but that doesn’t say much - I was prepared for the worse.

Why am I not surprised that this beer comes from Singapore?  Well, first off, with a name like Tiger...that tips ya off.  Also, it smells like it’s from India.  OK, that may not make sense, but eat at an Indian restaurant (like I did today) and then try this beer later on, and you’ll think "This smells like it’s from India."  Maybe it’s something in the water...I dunno.  It tastes similar to many domestic brews like Budweiser, except it has a certain flair about it--it helps that the Indian smell also smells of biscuits and that carries over into the taste.  Not a terrible beer, but not as good as Singha.

Mildly sweet aroma. Clear golden colour with pretty much no head. Sweet yet lightly bitter with a strong alcoholic finish. Fizzy carbonation and watery body. I don’t have the words to do this justice. Can. Thanks, JoeMcPhee!
not very good at all. looks nice, but tastes awful. golden in colour, big white head, horrible taste.

From bottle.  Had been advertised to me by friends as an incredible beer, so of course it did not live up to its calling.  Looked nice--good fluff-bubbly head, burnt orange/yellow color--but no dice on the sip.  Grassy and harsh, masked only by the food I was eating at the time.  Lots of bubbles, kind of bad on the palate.  This cheap tasting drink is a marked contrast to the shee-shee, but excellent, "Tiger Tiger" bar in Piccadilly Circus in London.  Ah, Bard, what’s in a name?
was very light but for its style what can someone expect.  It was mainly malty with some citric notes in the aroma and flavor.

Mandarin restaurant... well nothing better to accompany a buffet of mass produced chinese food than this doughy drink.  Not skunky, bt very metallic.  A pinch of sweetness.  It’s close, but no cigar... unless you’re eating at the mandarin of course!

[12 oz. bottle] Pale straw color with a very thin white head. Faint malt aroma with a hint of hops, corn and biscuit. Malty and sweet taste at first that disappears quickly and leaves a slightly sweet aftertaste. Thin and watery and very carbonated.
Another SIL. Couldn’t find any tiger taste at all. Less hoppy and more malty than the usual pilses around me
Slightly malty nose.  Simple and hint of sweetness in the palate at first.  Short but good aftertaste.
Yellow with a medium white head and fair lacing.  Malty and hoppy aromas.  Sweet, then sour, almost citrus-like.  Metallic and dry palate.
Straw yellow, no head, fizzy carbonation. Light herb nose. Not as bad as expected - yes, nowadays I give credits for this. Light parfume, grass taste.
Light yellow and fizzy lager. Not much flavor or aroma to speak of. You can smell some corn. It reminds me of Miller products: BAD, BAD, BAD, BAD, BAD!

Pale yellow color, little white head. Mildly hoppy aroma with notes of grass. Malty flavor with grassy and somehow hoppy ending. Little bit of skunky aftertaste. Mildly flavored overall, strong carbonation makes this to be crispy experience.
Pale gold in colour.  Aroma was almost none existent with just very small amount of grassy hops.  Flavour was weak, watery, some sweetness.  Very bland light body.  Finishes watery and boring.

The label is full of medals won over the years which is usually a warning sign. The second warning was the fact that it is owned by Heineken.So what you get is a bland lager that could have been brewed anywere in the world.If anything should serve as a warning against globalisation this is it.
Decent beer... Slighty sweet, refreshing, and more filling than I would have expected.  Nothing to get excited about but nothing to turn down if someone else is buying.

Bottle. Clear golden coloured, with little visible carbonation and virtually no head when it had settled down. Lightmalty aroma. Doesn’t taste of much. Light with a watery mouthfeel. I won’t be bothering again.

(on bottle)The most non-flavored beer I ever had. And therefor it´s difficult to judge. It is light and kind of creamy and very...odd. And when I´m gonna have some asian food, with olts of garlic, lemongrass and ginger? I´ll take take an IPA.
Plae and bland with no or little distinguishing characteristics. I thought this was a waste of money
Pale colour and a very blandish taste.  Drinkable but it will probably bore you to death before you finish more than a couple.  Abit germanic in taste.

Clear light golden yellow with a quickly diminishing average head.
Sharp hop nose, acidic.
Bitter/sour flavor with a mercaptan afterbite.
Thin, very poor.
Bland beer, weak head, weak taste.  It’s not exceptional it any way.  Worth a try, just don’t expect much and you won’t be disappointed.
Only a slight but agreable malt and orange aroma. The flavor is less welcoming. Sticky and grainy with some orange and an almost total lack of hops. Not even refreshing. Medium bodied.

Good golden color,small but fast fading head that left little behind.The aroma was mild malt,faint hops and maybe a fruit presence.The flavor was nothing special.Light malt and hops with a slight metallic taste along with a touch of a medicinal side.Nothing great here but i guess it’s atleast worth a try.
Gold in colour. Some hops and mineral aromas. A bit of a herbal flavor, but this is just your typical macro pale lager. Very dull indeed.

Well, it’s just another bland Asian lager, to be consumed only with spicy Asian food, and I have to admit it performs reasonably in that context. In fact, I marginally prefer it to most of the alternative, similar products. Bottle (640ml) from Tesco.

Canned - 500ml. Pours a pale gold carbonated body. Its thick bubbly head fades within a minute. Light malty aroma with some tiny floral/herbal notes. Mouthfeel is corny and moderately bitter. That average asian lager has nothing to impress me but it is highly preferable to Budweiser...

640ml brown bottle.Poured a pale gold crystal clear. White short lived head. Tiny bubbles from light carbonation. Faint citrus hops nose. Crisp bitter citrus flavour with satisfactory mouthfeel. Medium long bitter finish.I drink this a lot at work in the hot weather since its the best choice out of the chilled stuff in my local Sainsburys, and Oddbins have taken to filling their fridge with San Miguel and Budweiser. Its not bad and I have never had a skunked one.
Foamy though disappearing white head on a piss yellow body. Sour corny aroma. Thin and weak flavor. Some malt and hops and no more. Just as expectet, a bland and boring foreign lager.
A standard lager with not much taste. Thin looking with an off flavour in the aroma. Waste of time.

Pours a pale yellow with a quick to fade white burst of a head. The aroma is too faint for me to really care to bother describing it. The flavor has a little bit of malt to it, but more of this vegetal/corn thing that was really giving me a bit of trouble toward the end of the glass. You’ve got to keep this one ice cold or it’s nearly undrinkable.

Bottled (BB 01/2005)

Pale lager color, typical small white head. Lively carbonation. Soapy sweet aroma. Thin, watery, metallic but some bitter hoppiness is saving this one. I even bought once entire case of this because I got a free cool bag with it :)

I'm a pretty big fan of Asian lager, in fact i am a pretty big fan of asian anything, asian food, asian culture, asian women... Tiger beer is not the best of them, but definitely a good one, i like it.

Bottled, in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
 Well heaven knows how I've not rated this beer before, I must have over looked it a 100 times. It was just a fluke that I even noticed it then. Pale golden larger, with a fine steadily rising, fine white head. Soft malty aroma. Flowery malt flavour, with a little crips bite in the middle.
Whitest head I've ever seen - chlorine white, in fact. Citrusy taste, fresh but nothing special. Probably best drunk cold with spicy food :)

this is a poor beer from asia.  this bad boy gets a rating from me just because of sentamential value.  rumor had it that they used formaldahyde when making it.  really unremarkable tasting in almost every single way.... good for a cool looking bottle to hold in your hand though
Very similar to other beers of this style that come in a can. Typically lager in every aspect except for the somewhat fruiter aroma, but it isn't even that fruity.

Yellow & fizzy with light fizzy head. The aroma is mild and malty with some crisp hops. The flavor is citrusy & wheatish. Not too bad, very session with some fruit (banana?) & malts. Finishes like a lager.
This is a drinkable Lager.  Nothing special.  Finish and flavor is-plain,light, clean, and smooth.
Not much to say...it's beer, but definitely nothing special. If I was living in Singapore and this was the only beer around, I'd love it. Since I don't, it's not exactly my top pick.

Oddly enough I was served this in an Irish Coffee mug. So working from there.... Not much to speak of with this beer it had malt and hops. The hops lasted a while which I like. Anyhoo, it had a card on the menu saying it had just won a gold medal at some international beer festival, I giggled, it just ain't that good. The palate thing is a something special for it.
Canned. Pale golden color. It's not bad, but somewhat resembles sugared water. Rather boring.
Pours light gold and fizzy. Blink-gone white head, plenty of carb though. Dull aroma. It's drinkable but the beer has a funny sweet flavour that I can't put my finger on.

Bottle at Poppy Red, Birmingham. This is actually one of my preferred premium lagers, and a solid choice in the sort of places where trendy young people hang out. It strikes me as rather a creamy tasting lager, yet it remains pretty crisp and dry. Obviously it's got something in common with Freakee Soda, which is a deeply terrifiying thought. That aside, yes, it's not too bad.
Very non-descriptive.  Clear and crisp on a hot day, but nothing more than that.  Resembles a mass produced SAB beer.
(500ml can) Clear pale golden body with small head.  Aroma is medium sweet, grassy/herbal.  Taste is watery carbonated malt -- pretty tasteless.  Light body.
Oddly greenish.  Bad nose.  Sour and adjuncts.  Probably blessedly, has no flavor.

Thanks to argo0 I can now check Singapore of the countries list. Yellow fizzy body with a foamy white head. Simple malt and hop aroma. Not nearly as bad as I expected. The flavor is non-offensive and that is ths best think going for it. Body is light and fizzy. As MilkmanDan said, it is better than a Singapore caning.
Very pale and fizzy beer, with head that is gone in a second. Aroma is not that clear, but the flavor is on sweet side. palate is very thin.

Thanks to argo0 for bringing this! Standard yellow with a white head. Light malt and very faint hops. Hint of aluminum, also. Body is thin, but it’s not unexpected. Some corn-y notes abound. Easy to drink, just not very good.
Pretty good out of the can, cant speak for it in bottles. Sort of has that lightly sweet spoiled taste, no hops. Good amount of fusel alcohol.  Shouldnt this be an american standard?

(Re-rated from 1.9->1.3->1.8 - hey, it’s converging!:) Pale yellow color with a large, but very quickly fading head. Very hoppy aroma when pouring, but it fades quickly into mild, honeyish-fruity, alcoholic stuffiness. Lightly malty, sweetish-fruity and aromatic-hopped flavor with a quick, slightly bitter finish. Light-bodied, slightly watery, oily and sugary palate. A very easily drinkable, very typical, sweetish lager.

from can - thin white head which literally disppears in seconds.  I’m not getting any aroma - maybe a faint hint of tin.  pretty typical bad European lager - mostly tasteless with a strong metallic hop finish.  not interested.
Nice bottle with the raised glass for the word Tiger.  Poured a large head and disapated quickly.  Smooth and only the slightest hint of hops. One bottle from Beers of the World.

Very pale yellow colour with no head. Aroma of... well, not much, really. Thin, fizzy body. Sweet corn syrup flavour with a slight and metallic bitterness in the finish. Did a good job cutting through the spicy red curry I ate at the Thai restaurant where I was drinking it, but pretty forgettable otherwise.

Not bad at all. On the mainstream lager scale this is good. Smell is nothing special. Neither is colour, but at least the head holds up a bit.

Light taste, main attraction is a slightly bitter afteraste. Should work well with oriental food.
Had worse beers from Asia. Still, the taste of corn makes this otherwise bland lager unpleasant.
It's okay... Don't really know what more to say. Taste okay, appearance okay and dosen't leave much behind. Not my favourite
Bottled, Pasteuised. Pale gold colour, big carbonated head. Fairly decent asian malt lager though heavy carbonation masks much of the character. Standard Indian restaurant fare, but not the worst.
Poured a pale gold color, very faint aroma of malt. Flavor is light and mildly sweet. Decent beer but very little personality. Very middle-of-the-road.

Crystal clear golden colour with a nice off-white dense head and trillions of small bubbles rising from the bottom. Aroma of metal, light malt, a slight sweetness and a subtle, yet noticeable hop smell. Light-bodied; Initial strong flavour of metal and malt fades to a mild balance between malt and hops. Aftertaste is not shabby-its not offensive and offers some decent flavours. Overall, this is better than the average foreign Lager, and it shows with nothing too offensive (a bit of metal). I bought this twelve ounce bottle at Beers of the World in Rochester, New York.
This went down easy enough but so it should have as I just had an hour of hard squash, nothing stood out but then again it wasn't offensive.
Pale gold. White head w/ big bubbles. Sweet, canned corn aroma. Light body. Sweet, somewhat syrupy corn flavour, though bland and muddled. Little aftertaste.
A middle of the road beer.  No great taste but at least its clean and smooth.  No real aftertaste, just an easy drinking beer which is good in the hot singapore weather.

I actually liked this one.  This one is much better than most of the crap lagers that countries export.  I think this one stands out.  Very dry in the flavor which I like, balanced and easy to drink.  It just actually has a little bit of flavor to it and so many of these do not.

mmm, not all that all its that its cracked up to be. No head and quite light amber amber colour suggesting that its not quite a full flavoured beer. Standard Imported Lager this time from singapore. Too sweet and dry, nothing else stands out. Fair lager but better choices for the premium imported price.
Standard.  Fairly bitter, im waiting for a lager who will come out, take my had and take me to a world of difference.  Dont get me wrong, this isnt bad, it just isnt good. cheers
Pale blond color. Ordinary aroma, light malt and corn; sweet. Dry taste, really useless. Bitter final. Very bad!
(Bottle)  Light yellow colored beer pours with a thin white head.  Below average tasting lager...

Not terrible, but not anything to carry cases home for.  You average international lager.  I almost liken this to a Becks (import).  No hops aroma or flavor at all.  Your typical lager, nothing spectacular.  miles ahead of a Buttwiser, or any other typical US brewed lager from a mass producer, but I can't say it's much better than a Rolling Rock, or something of that manner.
This beer has a light yellow body - hue with a bitter initial flavor and a light body.

Can, at Taipei airport, at 8:50 in the morning.  This concludes my "crappy Asian lager" tour.  The smell is an awful sour corn aroma that made me flinch when I first got a whiff.  Looks like fizzy champagne.  Weak, thin, slight mouthwash taste in the finish.
Golden, small white bubbly head. Slightly sour malt aroma. thin bodied. Hints of malt, corn with some sour notes.
Pours a clean yellow, thousands of tiny bubbles flow constantly upwards. . . Head never goes away - sweet malty aroma, not bad here, but there is a distinct lack of flavour, too bad.

Better than your average Bud, Bush or Coors but not quite ready for the big boys.  Still if you don't mind a thin head, or lousy body (I've dated a few of these) then you won't hate this beer.  Has just a tad of that exotice (asian) twand to it.  Just a touch.  Could've used more.

Bottled.
An international standard lager.
Not much to say about this one.
A sourish cereal aroma, rather fresh, metallic flavour.
Nothing of any special interest going on here. Aroma and flavor like so many others. An ok lager, but not worth exporting.

Starts off with a pithy white head with a bit of lacing. Yellowy, see-through appearance with a lot of bubble action. Wet paper bag aroma - Saaz hops. Crisp lager flavor - not as dry as most far east beers. Makes a decent thrist quencher.
Better than most american macros, but that really doesn't say much. No hops. Drinkable, but not my first choich. Did not "bring out the tiger" in me, sorry Tony.
The color is light golden with a nice white head. The taste is very light. A little malt and a little bitterness.

Bottled: This is a beer, I've been drinking a lot with pleasure in Asia without taking notes. It's now easyly available in Denmark, so I had to try it again. Clear light golden coloured. Has a white head. Is light malty and metallic in the aroma. Corn flavour. Quite dry and crisp. Has a light bitterness. A little dull, but compared to other asian lagers its quite good and refreshing.
A mainstream beer thats better than a bud and thats pretty much as far as this description needs to go.
Many medals and even more rice/corn in the palate. Yellow, thin body, some malts in the taste. Typical megalager.
Gwinnett Brewfest 2003 - Nothing special. Maybe one or two steps up from Bud.
Toronto Festival of Beer 2002 - Nice lager, with some hops. Drinkable with more flavour than some, but pretty mainstream.
A pale beer, and not much of a head. A standrad lager  with a somewhat metallic taste.
nothing special going on in the aroma, rather sweet and far from being skunked, the beer is pale yellow and the taste is a bit sweet and very smooth for a lager,
Very macro European style which is not necessarily a bad thing. Pale gold (as noted by many), with a good creamy head. A good beer
Pale gold colour, very little white fizzy head. Grassy, yeasty aroma. Honey and sugary sweet flavours dominate, slight bitter finish. Prickly and watery mouthfeel.

Pours a pale gold, with a fluffy white head that dies very quickly.  Aroma is malty, lagered, and possessed of a light spicy hoppiness.  Flavor is light, yet fairly rich and mildly hoppy.  A little plain and bland.  Reminds me of Heineken or Becks.  Well carbonated, light body.  A decent pilsener or american style lager, but plain.
pours pale golden. I didn't mind it really, it had a bit of hop flavour, and had a pleasant yet simple flavour.
Had a few of these in hong-kong.  Pale colour, light yellow.  Crisp lager but not much substance - no interesting hoppy finish or sweet lager finish.
Pale golden. Somewhat sourish in the aroma. Sweetish in flavor. International Standard Lager.

Bought this beer on special for $4.80 for a 4-pack  just out of curiosity (for a buck twenty a bottle, I'd drink just about anything).  So considering the price, I can't really complain.  Died in the arse and went flat pretty quickly though.
Had it in Hong Kong and Singapore. Cold, wet and refreshing. Nothing special, but not bad for a lager.

This is the best Asian beer I have had, so I do recommend it. it is smooth, yet has it strong aroma and taste, there is almost no bitterness but the malt stays for a while in your mouth, leaving a nice aftertaste.
A pretty average beer. One of the better beers from Asia. A nice everyday brew. Pretty easy drinkable. Fancy label.

We have a theory here that the reason why they use the Tiger as the logo is because it tastes like Tiger piss.

The flavour is flat, it's too fizzy and has a bitter aftertaste. I have no idea why you guys in foreign countries are paying so much for this when you have much better stuff over there! Must be the power of advertising.

I had this beer while I was at a Indian restaurant.  It is a good companion to spicy food because the beer is light in body and sweet.  Although the price paid for it was ridiculous.  Not a bad beer but not overly exciting either.
Gold, large lasting white head. A slightly more full bodied and maltier mainstream lager
I tried this on the recommendation of this really hot girl I dated who was from Singapore.  For as much as she ranted, I was quite unimpressed.  Although, I can see this being good on a hot day.
Got a hot Thai dish on the table? Well serve up the Tiger, and be quick about it.  Well, it has low fizz and doesn't leave you bloaty, which is essential when eating spicy food.
Pours very foamy then disipates quickly. Tastes sweet like the domestics, but with stronger hop notes. Tastes like so many others......
Aroma? there is none! Pale golden color, with minimal head. Sweet tasting, just as I suspected.

Bubbly foam head with little aroma.  Mega fizzy.  Pale golden medium body.  Taste is quite sweet with a slight bitter ending.  After sitting for a few minutes the taste degenerates.  Better than I thought the beer would be.
Goes quite well with the abundant greasy 'fast food' in and around Singapore. The best beer in South-East Asia!
Dry and megafizzy, much like most Japanese beers.  This is a tad sweeter than most, perhaps.
Very sweet and slightly skunky. Bad.........................................
Not too Bad, drinkable with slight tinny and hoppy notes...lol..............

Can:
Nice hops, with a gentle nudge of malt in there.  Nice off brown/golden colour.  I didn't get much head out of the can, but that's always more of a visual thing, isn't it?
Bottled(330ml). -good drinkable beer, the only non-european beer I found on airport Stansted(London), crisp taste, hoppy
Just another Asian lager.  Fine very cold with very spicy Malay or Singaporean food.  A little bitterness, a little malt.  We've all had worse.
There is nothing like sitting in Little India in Singapore and dringing this from long necks, yummy hot weather beer
Mid-range beer. Good cold with Malaysian food...............................
It doesn''t grab my attention. Good cold. Mind you it''s not a horrible beer. Very pale in colour.
Not bad for a lager--actually hoppy in parts. A better example of a medicore style.
One of the better beers I have had travelling.  Taste was great, although it may have been working in the Malaysian sun (40C) all day.
As a lager it was ok.  The colour is straw or lighter, almost an invisible beer.  Very little head.  Light aroma.  A comfortable sweetness but you have to hunt for any hop flavour.
A light yellow beer with a fine head. It doesn''t have much aroma. The taste is slightly sweet and nice hoppy - a very fresh beer.
Has some hop flavor and aroma.Slightly sweet.Clean finish.One of the better Asian beers.

I was expecting the worst with this one, but was pleasantly surprised, at first sip, to get a delightful fruity--mainly grape and apple--tang. After a few more swigs, however, it suddenly dawned on me that this actually tasted like some corner-store apple cider (perhaps even, yuck, Strongbow). If I had to choose between sweet, dry or draught, I`d have to go for the former.

Light gold with large creamy head.  Strong bready and lightly spicy hop aroma.  A hint of rice.  Lightly watery up front, only a hint at bready malt sweetness.  Med bitterness is a prominent feature.  Somewhat sour.

Light gold color, medium head. A light bodied lager style beer. Light and crisp taste, malty and fairly hoppy. Mild flavor. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is crisp and clean. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Fairly standard lager

Bottle bought at a supermarket in Singapore.  They love their Tiger beer there.  It had a light yellow color with a slightly floral aroma.  The flavor was crisp and slightly better than other Asian lagers.

Oct 2019. Drunk keg at various bars and from can and bottle at various locations around Southeast Asia. Its a standard global lager, and when drunk as part of a blind taste test against other Southeast Asian beers - Singha, etc, it was no better or worse. OK. [2.3] 

June 2018.  330ml brown bottle, filtered, as part of the (slightly disappointing)  BeerWulf World Cup Beers box. Drunk chilled from the bottle during Korea v Germany. Yeah, slightly salty, but quite acceptable global lager. It's not divine, but it does the job. [ 2.1]

April, 2006 Sweet, creamy lager with a light salt finish. Standard stuff. Inoffensive and drinkable. Went well with the Wetherspoon Chinese meal deal.  [2.1]

Oct, 2002 ’Give that man a Tiger!’ The most popular and most heavily promoted beer in Singapore where it is made, this lager was first brewed in the 1930s. The brewery is now partly owned by Heineken. It tastes like Mother’s Pride thinly spread with cheap margarine. Slightly salty, almost as though someone had opened a bottle of Marmite in the next room and a hint of that aroma had mixed with the beer. [1.1]

Super-clear and golden-straw in color. Has a quickly diminishing head. Fizzy, watery texture. Very light in flavor, although there is a slight bitterness in the finish. Dry and bland finish. Not unlike carbonated water.
pale yellow colour.  slight grainy malt aroma.  more hops than most standard lagers.  not bad on it's own.  it went great with the curry I had for lunch.
Classic south-east asian lager, with a lovely pale straw colour.  As with any good SEA brew, very refreshing when ice cold.  Perhaps a bit lacking in depth or substance.

Pale gold clear under a small white short lasting head. Faint hop and hint of a sticky tropical fruiy aroma. When it warms up a little and glass is swirled a short burst of fruity nectar honey and plasticene aroma appears. Light body with a touch more bitter than the usual low end Lagers. The middle has a very short sweet quickly fading to bland something I can't quite put my finger on flavour. Finish is mainly dry and faintly fruity I started out only rating this to add another country to my collection but it'sactually quiet reasonable in comparison to many of its cousins.
It was a very hot un-airconditioned bar in England August 17th, and this beer quenched my thirst. Beyond that I don't remember much about the beer!
Fair amount of body for a lager, malt flavour present, great thirst quencher in the heat.
A lager with a fairly frothy head and good carbonation.  The beer is pleasant, but the overall effect is spoilt by a dusty aroma.

7/20/02: I hadn't had this beer in some time, and I don't think I've ever had it when not eating an Asian meal somewhere. Malt is an undercurrent in aroma, body, chief flavor characteristics and the finish. Hops are prominent enough and produce a citrusy tang in the finish. This has more body than many lagers. Tiger's main problem is a lack of complexity---the aroma, body, flavor and aftertaste are all essentially the same. In sum, this beer is not exciting but acceptable, and tastes a lot better with Thai or Indian food than as part of a "session" line-up.
Yellow, generic looking.  Nose is almost non-existent, with slight malt.  Taste is quite hoppy though.  Actually sharp and bitter.  Much better than I expected.
Not too bad. A typical Asian lager, on the malty side.  Soft carbonation.  More like a pilsener.
Bland with a sharp, unpleasant bitterness...................................
Pale golden colour.  A bit drier and crisper than your typical tropical lager.

I a bottle with food, so the tasting is a bit biased, but this was actually surprisingly good relative to other lagers I've had recently.  Some spiciness in the flavor, average/typical appearance and palate.  Nothing special but if that's what the restaurant has, it isn't a bad beer to try once.

Re-Rate 05/14/02: Clear gold in color, a minimal white head and little lace. Nose is malt, the start is malt, the top thin, the finish is dry, acidic, moderate carbonation, some hops, but the quintessential example of why "LAGERS SUCK"
decent lager drining beer. and hey, how many of us can say we've drinkin a lot of singapore beer? its kinda cool

Pleasantly suprising lager, tastes smooth and cloudy. Nice bottle and label. A good looker lager with nice fresh colour and a very pleasent aftertaste. A bottle to top off a chinese/ thai/ indian meal. Rather expensive, but worth it if your on a night out.

Unspectacular light gold appearance with an aroma that can only be described as that of a cold turkey sandwich with whiffs of oranges. Light malting underpins the taste of this delightfully smooth lager that is nearly perfect on the palate for this style. Thoroughly smooth, and having a malt spike, this a great find for an imported lager.

For an Asian beer, this is not too bad. Far more flavour than e.g. Thailand's Singha. I've never been to Singapore, but can imagine Tiger Beer would be great in the the tropical heat there. So leave the Singapore Gin Sling for the chicks - be a Tiger!
Very well balanced, smooth and tasty.  Had the luck to have both a bottle and canned versions.  Both very close witht the bottle being a little more crisp.
Faint smell of hops. Golden colour. Even fainter taste of hops.Dull.........
this is just like an average australian beer, nothing more or less. quite refreshing with a decent aroma.
pale golden colour. Medium bodied, rather sweet, some bitterness. OK........
This is a nice dry lager, perhaps more suited to the Singapore heat than an English spring day.  Still refreshing, though.  Adendum, I must have been drunk!  Points deduction!
A pleasant but very boring lager. A bit more aromatic and sweet compared to traditional lagers. The finish is only lightly bitter though (and frankly pretty bland).

Bottle. Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is light to medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain), trace hops (flowers), with notes of DMS and soap. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter. Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Weak aroma that’s more flaws than anything, and sugary sweet flavor without much to balance.
A very tasty aromatic lager. Sweetish taste with complex overtones of barley bread and spiciness. Excellent balance between malts and hops.
Not a bad beer at all. Nice flavour to it...................................

After a bottle of Asahi Super Dry I decided to overload my senses with a Tiger. First aroma hinted at cow dung but I may be mistaken. Reasonably well balanced but understated, with hints of malt and hops but hey thats what beer is made of so what more could you expect.
Great beer to drink in the heat of Asia.....................................
nice color,quite lively flavour, peculiar aroma and aftertaste- not unpleasant, would be nice with a curry stir fry
First drank Tiger beer in 1972. Quite good, especially after having only San Miguel beer to drink for the previous 6 months!
Ok beer. Reminds me of a standard Canadian lager. ..........................
I was very impressed with this one. Pleasant hopy flavour, but could be a bit fuller.

Can 330ml 
 
Appearance:  Clear golden lager with quiet bright snow like cap.3+ 
Nose : Sweet grainy aroma with refreshing hint of aromatic hops .6-
Flavor/Palate : Medium thin bodied, malty bready middle . A bit flat with some semi dry alcohol above. Very little character shown. Thin bitterness with metallic edge. Forgettable .
quite lively. good hops. quite bitter.......................................
bland sweet ricey corny crap, grainy and very faintly malty. thin, tinny hop aroma. it's cleanish at least. zzz
Better rating beer, good strong, firm upper palate, lingers a nutty flavour... quite enjoyable. Best asain beer around.
Smooth, drinkable lager. However, I wouldn't buy it again because it is similar in style and taste to many local lagers but much more expensive.
A superb lager beer with plenty of nose. A thirst quenching bite, best drank when ice cold
This beer is crisp and quenching and it goes down surprisingly easy but the flavour is not very profound (despite a sugary, overforceful aftertaste)
This is by far the best beer around.  I grew up in Singapore and I was raised on Tiger, so that might explain why I like it so much.  Nothing beats a tall cold tiger draft on a hot night.  try it
Straight forward lager.  No hints of anything significant.  I didn't detect any of the fruit hints.
Pale yellow.  Odd esters in the nose - pear, green apple - always a sign of a failed lager.  Light and watery, with some slight fusel influence.  Unclean, hopless, a total drain pour.
light golden colour, few head, fine hop aroma, sweet fruity flavor..........

Ok beer. Reminds me of a standard Canadian lager. ..........................
I was very impressed with this one. Pleasant hopy flavour, but could be a bit fuller.
